title: ArchiCAD Drafting Experts
description:
???? **Join Our Team: 3 ArchiCAD Drafting Expert Wanted!** ????

Do you excel in using ArchiCAD to create precise and detailed drafts that lay the foundation for stunning structures? If so, we're looking for someone just like you to join our dynamic team!



**About Us:**

At Sachdeva Architects, we're passionate about transforming visions into reality. We specialize in creating awe-inspiring architectural designs that leave a lasting impression. Our projects range from residential masterpieces to commercial marvels, and we pride ourselves on delivering innovative solutions that exceed expectations.



**5 Positions: ArchiCAD Drafting Expert**



**Role and Responsibilities:**

ArchiCAD Drafting Expert, you will play a pivotal role in turning our architectural concepts into tangible visual representations. Your responsibilities will include:



- **ArchiCAD Drafting:** Utilize ArchiCAD to produce accurate and detailed drafts, blueprints, and schematics that form the basis for construction and realization of projects.



- **Collaboration:** Work closely with architects, designers, and project managers to understand design objectives and translate them into compelling visual assets.



- **Innovation:** Stay updated on industry trends and technological advancements to bring fresh ideas and techniques to our rendering and drafting processes.



**Qualifications:**

To succeed in this role, you should possess:



- Extensive experience with ArchiCAD software for drafting and design purposes.



- A strong portfolio showcasing your ArchiCAD drafting capabilities.



- Attention to detail and a keen eye for aesthetics, ensuring that every design element is accurately represented.



- Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively within a team environment.



- Problem-solving abilities to address challenges and provide innovative solutions.



**How to Apply:**

If you're excited to be a part of our creative journey and have the skills to match, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter detailing your experience in ArchiCAD drafting to using this portal. Feel free to include any relevant project examples that highlight your expertise.

The hiring will be in steps.

1- Video Interview.

2- We will conduct a test to know your skills and access your performance based on the test.

3- Test review and final interview. We will conduct a final interview to discuss the contract and company policies.



**Benefits:**

We value our tea
mbers and offer a range of benefits, including:



- Competitive salary and opportunities for growth.

- A collaborative and inspiring work environment.

- Access to cutting-edge technology and resources.

- Recognition for your contributions to our success.



Join us in shaping the future of architecture through your exceptional ArchiCAD drafting skills. Together, let's turn dreams into reality!



We can't wait to see the magic you'll bring to our team!

title: Product Support Specialist (Open to Fresh Graduates)
description:
APPLICATIONS FROM RECENT GRADUATES OF COMPUTER SCIENCE OR OTHER IT-RELATED PROGRAMS WITH BASIC WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT SKILLS WILL BE ACCEPTED – COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED.



ROLE OVERVIEW

We are currently hiring a PRODUCT SUPPORT SPECIALIST to become part of our growing team.



In this role, you will assist customers by answering questions, understanding their needs, and delivering clear, practical solutions. We’re looking for someone professional, detail-focused, and genuinely passionate about helping people. Rather than relying strictly on scripts, you should be comfortable analyzing situations and offering thoughtful, personalized support.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Respond to customer inquiries and requests promptly

• Troubleshoot technical issues and explain solutions in a simple, easy-to-follow way

• Understand customer goals and guide them toward successful outcomes

• Share helpful best practices with guidance from internal subject-matter experts



QUALIFICATIONS

• Strong English communication skills — spoken, written, and reading comprehension

• Recent graduates in Computer Science or other IT-related programs with basic website development knowledge (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.)

• Curious, proactive, and customer-oriented mindset

• Comfortable working in a fast-paced learning environment

• Previous customer support experience is a PLUS



WORKING HOURS

•        Full-time remote position

•        8 hours per day, 5 days a week, a break is included

•        OPTIONAL: Work 6 days on alternating weeks



HOW TO APPLY

•        Use “PRODUCT” as the subject line of your application

•        Include a short cover letter and include the link to your CV/Resume



PLEASE MAKE SURE TO PROVIDE A WORKING CV/RESUME LINK, AS APPLICATIONS WITHOUT IT MAY NOT BE REVIEWED.

title: Scroll-Stopping Video Editor
description:
About Us:

We are a dynamic and growing real estate company committed to delivering engaging, high-quality video content that educates, inspires, and connects with our audience. We focus on platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and long-form YouTube content to build our brand and provide value to our viewers.



We’re looking for a talented and creative Virtual Assistant and Video Editor to join our team and help take our video content strategy to the next level — with a special focus on creating unique, scroll-stopping, attention-grabbing videos that captivate viewers instantly!



Key Responsibilities

Video Content Creation:

Edit highly engaging short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts using scroll-stopping techniques inspired by accounts like Viral VFX — focusing on quick cuts, dynamic motion, fast-paced storytelling, and visually arresting graphics.



• Edit long-form YouTube videos, ensuring polished storytelling, cohesive structure, and professional-quality visuals and audio.

• Repurpose and reformat existing content creatively across different platforms to maximize reach and impact.



Trend Analysis and Recommendations:

• Stay on the pulse of emerging trends, editing techniques, viral effects, and short-form content strategies on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.

• Proactively recommend new video ideas, viral trends, and innovative editing styles based on platform analytics and audience behavior.



Scroll-Stopping Techniques:

• Integrate eye-catching visual effects, punchy text overlays, rapid scene transitions, and motion graphics to grab viewers' attention in the first 1–3 seconds.

• Develop hooks and edit sequences designed to stop users from scrolling and to increase watch time and engagement.

• Continuously study and emulate high-performing styles like Viral VFX while adding a creative, brand-appropriate twist.



Brand Consistency:

Ensure all videos are consistent with our brand voice, visual identity, and messaging while still pushing creative boundaries.



Collaboration and Communication:

• Work efficiently with provided raw footage to produce high-impact final edits.

• Communicate effectively and proactively to clarify project details, timelines, and creative direction.



Content Optimization:

• Add captions, trending music, transitions, and visual effects that elevate the production value and improve viewer retention.

• Optimize each video for the nuances of different platforms (e.g., TikTok pacing vs. YouTube Shorts structure).



Project Management:

• Manage and prioritize multiple projects independently, meeting deadlines with minimal supervision.

• Provide clear and consistent updates on project progress and timelines.



Performance Tracking:

Review analytics to measure video success and adjust editing styles and strategies based on audience engagement and performance metrics.



Qualifications and Skills

Experience: Proven experience editing short-form viral content for Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and long-form YouTube videos.



Technical Skills: Proficiency with professional video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or similar). Experience with Asana is a bonus.



Creativity: A strong sense of storytelling, timing, and rhythm, with a knack for crafting scroll-stopping visuals. Sourcing ideas from other industries besides real estate to capture what they’re doing successfully to drive followers, engagement, and business. Be open to learning new techniques and deepening your video editing capabilities. 



Trend Awareness: Passionate about tracking social media and editing trends — particularly viral techniques used by top-performing accounts.



Attention to Detail: Meticulous and quality-obsessed — no sloppy cuts or overlooked errors.



Organization: Excellent time management and the ability to meet deadlines without sacrificing quality.



Communication: Strong, proactive communication skills for remote collaboration.



Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required)

• Experience working with real estate, lifestyle, or educational brands.

• Graphic design skills for thumbnails, branded overlays, or custom assets.

• Knowledge of SEO, YouTube keyword optimization, and social media content strategy.

• Familiarity with basic performance analytics and reporting.



What We Offer

• Competitive hourly rate or project-based compensation, working toward full-time position.

• A creative and supportive environment where you’ll have the freedom to innovate within our brand’s voice.

• Opportunities for growth as our brand and platforms expand.



How to Apply

Visit our social sites:









Visit some of our favorite creators to see our inspiration:


 (love the scroll-stopping ideas he uses)


 (though her work is too heavily edited, IMO)


 (I love some of her really creative work and want to copy it like 
, 
, and 
 - her videos are brilliant and I'd love creative help with coming up with ideas like these.)


 (love the clean thumbnails)


 (love her storytelling and her thumbnails)



Submit your application including:



• A brief cover letter explaining why you’re a great fit for this role.

• A portfolio showcasing your best short-form and long-form video editing work, preferably with scroll-stopping examples and unique video editing concepts. 

• Links to any social media accounts or YouTube channels you’ve contributed to.



We are excited to find a creative, innovative, and results-driven tea
mber who can help us create thumb-stopping, binge-worthy video content that expands our impact and builds lasting connections with our audience!

title: Senior Visual Designer |Ecom Graphic UI UX Designer
description:
We're a high-growth digital fashion brand redefining online retail through bold aesthetics and ruthless creative efficiency. We move fast, test constantly, and believe exceptional visual storytelling drives conversion. As we scale across APAC markets, we're looking for a senior creative operator who treats design as a commercial weapon—not just decoration.



The Role

You'll own the entire visual ecosystem of a modern fashion e-commerce operation, from scroll-stopping social assets to high-converting
 campaigns. This isn't an "execution-only" role; you'll architect precision-crafted workflows that let us produce luxury-level creative at startup speed through mastery, not automation.



You'll be responsible for:

Campaign Creative: Conceptualizing and producing visual assets for seasonal drops, sales campaigns, and product launches across Meta, TikTok, Google Ads, and programmatic display. You understand that every pixel must earn its place in the feed.

Retention Design: Designing high-converting
 marketing templates (Klaviyo/Iterable), SMS graphics, and push notification visuals that maintain brand coherence while driving repeat revenue.



Social Velocity: Creating platform-native content (Instagram carousels, TikTok covers, Stories, Reels thumbnails) that respects current fashion aesthetics and platform algorithms. You know the difference between "designed for Instagram" and "repurposed for Instagram."



Digital Experience: Collaborating on website UI updates, landing page designs, and mobile-first merchandising layouts (Figma ? Shopify/Custom headless). You think in conversion funnels, not just grids.

Production Architecture: Building bulletproof design systems, scalable template libraries, and batch-production workflows that allow 50+ unique assets per week without sacrificing craft quality. You obsess over file hygiene, non-destructive editing, and component-based efficiency.



Asset Management: Organizing rigorous file structures, version control, and handoff protocols that allow rapid iteration across multiple markets and languages without chaos.



Who You Are

Non-Negotiables:

5+ years professional experience in digital design, with a portfolio demonstrating fashion, lifestyle, or premium e-commerce work (DTC brand experience strongly preferred). You've shipped campaigns that actually sold product.

Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Figma at a professional production level—you know shortcuts better than you know your own address and can manipulate complex masking and retouching in your sleep.

Production Craftsman Mindset: Obsessive attention to detail, color accuracy, and typographic precision. You believe that speed comes from mastery and systems, not shortcuts. You've managed high-volume output (40+ unique deliverables weekly) while maintaining luxury-brand standards.



Business-Level English: You can write compelling copy for ad headlines, articulate design rationale to stakeholders using conversion metrics, and catch cultural nuances in Western fashion marketing.



Asia Timezone Ready: You can overlap 11 AM - 7 PM SGT / CST with reliable high-speed internet and your own professional-grade equipment (Mac/PC capable of handling 4K assets, calibrated display, Adobe CC license, etc.).



High-Velocity Temperament: You've thrived in environments with aggressive launch calendars, real-time performance feedback, and same-day turnaround expectations. You don't wait for inspiration—you build disciplined routines that guarantee consistent commercial-grade output.



Compensation & Culture

Competitive salary denominated in USD

Performance bonuses tied to campaign ROI and creative throughput metrics

Remote-first with quarterly team creative summits in major Asian cities

Annual design tool budget and priority access to sample collections



To Apply: Send your portfolio (Behance, personal site, or PDF), your Instagram/TikTok handle if you manage creative accounts, and one sentence describing the most high-pressure creative sprint you've survived.

title: Scroll-Stopping Video Editor
description:
Video Editor & Creative Strategist (Virtual Assistant) – Real Estate Content

About the Role

We're a real estate team looking for a Video Editor VA who is not going to do what everyone else is doing.

If your reel portfolio looks like every other agent's page — generic walk-through clips, the same trending audio slapped on listing photos, cookie-cutter text overlays — this is not the role for you.

We want someone who watches our market, studies what's working (and what's overdone), and brings us original ideas for how to promote our listings and grow our brand on Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube. You'll have creative input here. We're not just looking for someone to execute a checklist — we're looking for someone who will push us to do better content than we even knew we could.

This is a long-term role with real creative ownership for the right person.



What You'll Be Doing

Short-Form Content (Reels & TikTok) — Where We Need You to Think, Not Just Edit

This is where we want your brain, not just your software skills. Before you touch a timeline, we want you asking: What's going to make someone stop scrolling? What haven't people seen yet? What's the freshest way to show this listing?



Develop original concepts and hooks for listing promotions — we don't want recycled formats, we want ideas that feel fresh and specific to each property

Pitch creative directions before editing begins — formats, angles, storytelling approaches

Edit short-form videos (15–60 seconds) with scroll-stopping VFX, animations, sound effects, and text overlays

Hook viewers within the first 1–3 seconds — every single time

Stay ahead of trends so we're using them early, not after they're played out

Flag what's getting oversaturated and steer us away from it

Reference-level style: Learn With Kayo and VFX Creators



Long-Form YouTube Editing, SEO & Posting



Edit YouTube videos (7–15+ minutes) in a clean, polished, and professional style

Add light music, simple graphics and titles, clean transitions, and B-roll where it adds value

Create click-worthy thumbnails that drive impressions to views

Optimize titles, descriptions, and tags using tools like TubeBuddy

Upload and manage the posting schedule

Monitor high-performing real estate YouTube channels for content ideas and scripting inspiration, including:



Las Vegas Olga Moreno

Buying Southern Oregon

Moving to KC





Work with our coach to build an SEO strategy that supports subscriber and watch-time growth



Creative & Strategic Contribution



Proactively bring ideas for video formats, hooks, and editing styles — don't wait to be asked

Recommend ways to repurpose long-form content into short-form clips

Flag performance opportunities and suggest adjustments based on what's working

Take ownership of improving quality and consistency over time





Required Skills & Experience



Strong experience editing both short-form social content and long-form YouTube videos

Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and/or Final Cut Pro

Proven hands-on experience with motion graphics, VFX, text animations, and sound design

YouTube SEO experience (titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails)

Solid understanding of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube algorithms

Familiarity with AI tools and Canva for thumbnail creation

Sharp storytelling instincts and attention to detail





The Kind of Person We're Looking For

You're creatively restless — you notice when content formats get stale and you're already thinking about what's next. You don't need to be micromanaged. You bring ideas to the table before you're asked. You take feedback well and you're always looking to improve. You're reliable, organized, and easy to communicate with across time zones.



Nice to Have



Experience working in real estate, with creators, or in educational content

Track record of growing a YouTube or short-form channel

Strong sense of visual branding and consistency





How to Apply

Please send us:



Examples of short-form videos with VFX (Reels, TikToks, or Shorts)

Examples of long-form YouTube edits

A brief written response covering:



How you approach creating scroll-stopping short-form content

How you approach clean, professional YouTube editing

At least 2–3 original content ideas you'd pitch us right now for promoting real estate listings on Reels or TikTok — show us you can think beyond what's already everywhere

Ongoing support and feedback so you can get faster and more confident over time.



Requirements

Comfortable working inside web?based software after training.

Full Time

title: Assistenz für Google-Unternehmensprofil?Verwaltung (Freelance, vollständige Einarbeitung)
description:
Wir suchen eine zuverlässige, detailorientierte Freelancer?Kraft, die uns bei der Verwaltung von lokalen Unternehmen in unserer Software für Google Unternehmensprofile unterstützt.



Vorkenntnisse mit No?Code?Tools oder spezieller Software sind nicht erforderlich. Wir stellen eine klare, einfache Einarbeitung sowie Schritt?für?Schritt?Anleitungen zur Verfügung. Deine Hauptaufgabe ist es, die Prozesse sorgfältig in der Software umzusetzen.



Deine Aufgaben

Einloggen in unsere Plattform und Verwaltung mehrerer lokaler Unternehmenskonten.



Aktualisieren von Unternehmensdaten (Name, Adresse, Telefonnummer, Öffnungszeiten, Einzugsgebiete) nach Vorgabe.



Anlegen und Bearbeiten von Beiträgen, Fotos, Dienstleistungen und kurzen Beschreibungen anhand unserer Vorlagen.



Unterstützung beim Bewertungs?Management: mithilfe unserer Textbausteine Antwortvorschläge erstellen und den Status von Bewertungen im System aktualisieren.



Einstellungen und Checklisten pro Kunde in der Software anwenden, damit jedes Profil korrekt konfiguriert ist.



Einfache Dokumentation der erledigten Arbeiten pro Unternehmen (Status?Notizen, Datum, durchgeführte Aktionen).



Was nicht von dir erwartet wird

Kein Programmieren oder technische Entwicklung.



Kein Verkauf, Upselling oder Abschließen von Kunden.



Keine komplexe Marketingstrategie – du folgst klaren Anweisungen und Vorlagen.



Das bieten wir

Vollständige Einarbeitung in die Software und unsere Arbeitsabläufe.



Schriftliche SOPs (Prozessbeschreibungen) und kurze Video?Walkthroughs für jede Aufgabenart.



Laufende Unterstützung und Feedback, damit du sicherer und schneller wirst.



Anforderungen

Sehr hohe Genauigkeit und Sorgfalt – du prüfst Namen, Telefonnummern, Links und Rechtschreibung sorgfältig.



Sicherer Umgang mit webbasierten Anwendungen nach kurzer Einarbeitung.



Fähigkeit, Checklisten und Prozesse Schritt für Schritt abzuarbeiten, ohne Schritte zu überspringen.



Zuverlässigkeit, Verbindlichkeit und Einhaltung vereinbarter Fristen.



Gute schriftliche Deutsch? oder Englischkenntnisse für einfache Textanpassungen und Bewertungsantworten.



Nice to have (kein Muss)

Erste Erfahrung mit Google?Unternehmensprofilen, lokalen Unternehmen oder Online?Branchenverzeichnissen.



Erfahrung im Remote?/Freelance?Bereich mit Arbeiten nach SOPs.



Rahmenbedingungen & Bewerbung

Freiberuflich, Teilzeit, langfristig angelegt.



Das Pensum steigt mit der Anzahl der betreuten Unternehmen.



Flexible Arbeitszeiten, solange die Aufgaben zuverlässig und fristgerecht erledigt werden.



Wenn du Interesse hast, sende bitte:



Eine kurze Vorstellung von dir und deinem Hintergrund.



Ggf. relevante Erfahrung mit Online?Tools oder Datenerfassung.



Deinen Stundensatz und deine typische wöchentliche Verfügbarkeit.



Wenn du strukturierte Arbeit, klare Checklisten und eine langfristige, unkomplizierte Umsetzungsrolle schätzt, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung auf Deutsch da wir mit deutschen Kunden arbeiten und alle Konnetare/Posts in Deutsch schreiben werden.

title: YouTube Video Editor
description:
[Job Description]



The workflow is outlined below. Please note that the majority of your tasks will focus on "3. Mass Production of Sign-up Guide Videos." Detailed guidelines for each video will be provided via direct message.



1. Test Video Submission ($25/video)



Task: Watch the provided reference video, record yourself going through the actual exchange sign-up process, and edit it to match the reference style.



Note: After reviewing this test submission, we will d
 whether to proceed with a long-term collaboration.



2. Full Video Production - New Exchange Sign-up ($40/video)



Frequency: Approximately once a quarter.



Task: Record the entire process of signing up for a new exchange from scratch, edit the video, and submit the final file.



3. Mass Production of Sign-up Guide Videos ($20/video)



Frequency: 5~7 videos per week (Primary task).



Task: We will provide you with a raw working video and a reference video. Your job is to watch the reference, generate and add TTS (Text-to-Speech) audio, perfectly sync the audio with the visuals, and add visual highlights (e.g., highlight boxes, arrows).



[Requirements]



1) Ability to generate natural US-English voiceovers using ElevenLabs and self-review the audio for quality.

2) Highly detail-oriented to ensure perfect audio-video synchronization and natural-sounding pronunciation without awkward pauses.

3) Comfortable with consistent, repetitive editing tasks without losing focus or quality.

4. Portfolio Required: Please attach links to tutorial videos you have edited in the past.

title: Replo Expert – Figma to Shopify Implementation (Pixel-Perfect)
description:
We are a fast-growing DTC e-commerce company launching multiple brands across various niches. We provide high-end, completed designs in Figma; we need a technical Replo Developer to bring them to life.



This is a development-only role. We don't need a designer; we need a builder who obsesses over padding, typography, and mobile responsiveness.



Job Details



Rate: $12–$15/hour (depending on experience)

Capacity: ~20 hours per week

Type: Long-term, ongoing projects (Landing Pages, Product Pages, and Homepages)





Key Responsibilities



Execution: Translate Figma files into functional, high-speed Shopify pages using Replo.

Precision: Ensure 100% visual accuracy (pixel-perfect) from Figma to live site across all breakpoints.

Efficiency: Build reusable sections and templates utilizing Shopify Metafields and Dynamic Data.

Performance: Optimize every page for lightning-fast load times and clean structure.





Requirements



Advanced Replo Skills: You must be able to build custom layouts from scratch (no reliance on pre-made templates).

Figma Mastery: Ability to inspect files for exact dimensions, CSS properties, and assets.

Shopify Savvy: Strong understanding of how Replo interacts with the Shopify ecosystem (Liquid logic is a major plus).

Quality Control: A "check twice, cut once" mentality—especially regarding mobile responsiveness.





To Apply

Please use "REPLO-DEV" as your Subject Line and answer the following:



1. Provide 2–3 links to live Shopify pages you have personally built using Replo.

2. Do you build pages manually in Replo or use auto-import plugins? (Note: We require manual builds to ensure clean structure).

3. Confirming you are available for ~20 hours/week for long-term work?

title: Urgent - 1h/day - Competitor Research Assistant (Remote, Part-time)
description:
Who are we?

We are a fast-growing fashion dropshipping company running multiple Shopify stores across Europe, generating over €100,000/month in revenue.

To keep growing, we constantly need fresh competitor data from the market — that’s where you come in.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a Competitor Research Assistant who can spend around 1 hour per day using simple online tools to:



Scroll through Meta Ads Library



Find new fashion competitors in our target markets



Log the right ones into a Google Sheet



This is a very simple, repetitive task — but it’s important for our business. You don’t need advanced skills or experience; you do need to be fast, accurate, and consistent on a computer.



Your main tasks will be:



1. Use Meta Ads Library (we’ll provide the link and guidance)



2. Scroll through ads using our keyword lists and filters



3. Visit the advertised store and quickly understand what type of store it is



4. Identify:



- Fashion dropshipping stores (they sell products we can also find on AliExpress / similar suppliers)



- Real fashion brands that design/produce their own items (we don’t count these as competitors)



5. Log the approved competitors into a Google Sheet with the required details (URL, brand name, notes, etc.)



Use a few Chrome extensions and simple online tools we’ll provide (for example, to check product sources or store details)



We’ll give you clear examples and checklists, so you know exactly what to do.



Key skill: spotting dropshippers vs real brands

Today, many dropshipping stores try to look like “real brands” (thanks to AI, better design, etc.).

Your most important job is to look past the nice design and figure out:



Is this store selling generic products we could likely find on AliExpress or other common suppliers?



Then we count them as competitors.



Or are they clearly a real brand, designing and producing their own unique products? 



Then we do NOT count them as competitors.



We will teach you what to look for, but you must be:



Curious and observant



Willing to follow the logic, not just the “vibe” of the website



What we expect from you

You do NOT need to be an expert in e-commerce. You do need:



A fast and reliable laptop or desktop



Stable internet connection



Comfortable using Chrome, multiple tabs, and Chrome extensions



Basic Google Sheets (copy/paste, fill in rows, no advanced formulas needed)



Fast and accurate when clicking, checking, and logging data



Basic English reading so you can follow instructions and understand websites



Ability to focus on repetitive work without losing accuracy



Reliability: if we agree on 1 hour/day, we expect you to actually show up and do it



Nice to have (but not required):



Any experience with dropshipping, Shopify, AliExpress, or Meta Ads Library



What we offer 



100% remote – work from anywhere



~1 hour per day (7 days/week or 5 days/week – we’ll agree together)



Pay: $2 per hour (simple and repetitive task) + Bonuses



Possibility to get more hours in the future if we work well together



Training provided – we’ll show you exactly how to do the job



Simple, clear, step-by-step tasks



How to apply

Please apply in English and include:



A short introduction about yourself (1–3 sentences).



Your laptop/PC specs (how old it is and if it runs fast with many tabs).



A brief example of any repetitive or data-entry task you’ve done before (if any).



In 2–3 sentences, tell us how you would try to understand if a fashion store is a real brand or a dropshipping store, just based on looking at their website.



Please use this subject line / title:

"Market Scraper – [Your Name]"



We may start with a short paid trial (for example, 30–60 minutes of scraping) to see how you work and how well you follow the guidelines.

title: AI Social Media Manager Needed
description:
Hello there!



We are a growing Marketing Agency with multiple e-commerce stores looking for an enthusiastic and professional Social Media Manager.



This role is a part-time role where you will be working with our current team of 8.



Here is an example page that we are looking to make and manage: 







We need someone who has a decent understanding of marketing and is able to put the information given into an attractive post and manage it for us.



As well as create reels that can help us grow.



We are an AI-forward team and actively use tools like Claude for copywriting, brainstorming, and ideation, as well as Nano Banana Pro for AI image generation.



We expect our Social Media Manager to be comfortable leveraging these tools to speed up workflows, generate compelling copy, create visuals, and come up with fresh content ideas.



If you already have experience using AI tools in your creative process, that is a huge plus.



Requirements:



* Minimum 2-year social media management experience



* Must be proficient in English



* Know how to use Slack for communications



* Must be comfortable using AI tools such as Claude and Nano Banana Pro as part of your daily workflow



* Ability to use AI-generated copy and images as a starting point and refine them to match brand voice and quality standards



Your tasks as a manager will include:



1. Make posts based on the information we give you — 4 carousel posts per week and 2 story posts per week



2. Come up with ideas for posts that we can do and manage them on the account yourself



3. Look for ways to grow the account even more



4. Use Claude to assist with writing captions, brainstorming content angles, and drafting copy for posts and stories



5. Use Nano Banana Pro to generate on-brand images and visuals for posts when needed



6. Continuously explore new ways AI tools can improve our content quality and output speed



We ask that you answer the questions below to help us get to know you.



Questions:



1. Have you made social media management posts before?



2. Do you have any examples of your work we can see? If so, please link it below (Product Preferred).



3. How long would it take you to think of a post idea based on a post we gave and make it?



4. Can you work flexible hours during the morning?



5. Can you commit to at least 3 months if selected?



6. Do you have any questions about the job/job description?



7. Have you worked for a Marketing agency or e-commerce team before?



8. Have you used AI tools like Claude or ChatGPT for copywriting or content ideation? If so, please describe how you've used them in your workflow.



9. Have you used any AI image generation tools such as Nano Banana Pro, Midjourney, or similar? If so, please share an example or describe your experience.



10. If we gave you a product photo and a few bullet points about a promotion, walk us through how you would use AI tools to turn that into a finished carousel post.



We are looking to grow very quickly in the next few months and this position will allow for opportunities to be moved to incentive-based pay and a salary increase.



We ask that if you do provide examples, that it be examples relevant to what the job describes.



Biweekly Pay: $150 CAD + BONUS



Hours: 2-3 Hours Per day, some days you won't need to work :)



Currently, you must be able to work at least 14hrs/week (including weekends)



*** HOW TO APPLY ***



*You must include your favorite color in the subject line of your application for it to be considered (this shows you actually read it and is very important).



1.) Send us a message answering our 10 questions



2.) Include examples of your work



---



I updated the question count reference from 7 to 10 to match the new total, added three new AI-focused questions (8–10), expanded the requirements and task list to reflect the AI tooling expectations, and included context about your team being AI-forward. Let me know if you'd like any tweaks.

title: AI specialist needed (Claude, Gemeni, etc)
description:
Hello there!



We are a growing Marketing Agency with multiple e-commerce stores looking for a knowledgeable and forward-thinking AI Automation Specialist.



This role is a part-time role where you will be working with our current team of 8.



We are an AI-forward company that already uses tools like Claude for copywriting and ideation and Nano Banana Pro for AI image generation across our workflows.

Your job will be to find new AI tools, test them, and figure out exactly how they can save us time, improve our output, and help us scale faster.



If you're the type of person who gets excited every time a new AI tool drops and immediately thinks about how it could be used in a business setting, this role is for you.

*** HOW TO APPLY ***

title: Sponsorships Lead for Large YouTube Channel
description:
I run a large, established YouTube channel with nearly 1 million subscribers and over 100,000 views per video.



We are looking for a serious, driven sales professional to secure sponsorship deals.



You are fully responsible for:



• Creating the sponsorship strategy

• Identifying target brands

• Finding decision-makers

• Writing and sending outreach
s

• Following up consistently

• Negotiating deals within approved ranges

• Presenting finalized deals for approval

• Managing the sponsor pipeline



You must be proactive. You will not be micromanaged.



This is not a role where you will be trained.



You are expected to create and execute your own outreach strategy. You will not be given step-by-step instructions or daily direction. You must be comfortable taking full ownership of the process and driving results independently.



You must also be comfortable communicating directly with companies. This includes professional
 communication and video calls with brand managers when necessary. You should enjoy sales conversations and feel confident representing a large brand. This is not a behind-the-scenes admin position — you must be comfortable being visible and leading discussions.



You do not need previous YouTube sponsorship experience, but you must have:



• Sales, outreach, or lead generation experience

• Excellent written and verbal English

• Confidence communicating with brand managers

• Strong organization and follow-through

• The ability to think strategically and execute without supervision



We are only interested in reputable sponsors such as VPNs, cybersecurity companies, vitamins, health products, productivity tools, and similar legitimate brands. No gambling, crypto schemes, or low-quality products.



Compensation:



This is a non-salaried, commission-only role. You will receive 20% of all sponsorship deals you close.



For a channel of this size, that is a significant earning opportunity. Individual deals are worth thousands of dollars.



There is no cap on earnings. Your income is directly tied to your ability to secure and close quality sponsorships.



Include the word ORANGE in the subject line of your application.



Please tell me about yourself, your sales experience, and outline how you would approach landing the first sponsorship.

title: Are you a rockstar administrative VA? Then we want YOU!
description:
Our administrative VA will be working mainly on back office tasks, making sure our business runs smoothly. Some

marketing and customer service work may be required.



Genesis Homecare Agency is a growing U.S. non-medical healthcare company that coordinates in-home care services for seniors and individuals who need assistance at home. We are looking for a reliable, organized, and professional Virtual Assistant to become a long-ter
mber of our team.



This is NOT a short project. We are seeking someone who wants a stable, part-time position and to grow with our company.



You will be working directly with the agency owner and management team to help support daily operations.



What You Will Be Doing

• Following up with job applicants (text,
, and occasional calls)

, etc.)

•
 management and inbox organization

Social Media Management and more!





Tools You Will Use

 (Gmail/Outlook)

title: Virtual Assistant – E-commerce & Operations Support
description:

support our daily business operations and help to create, document, and organize our business processes. This role is essential to maintaining smooth order processing, customer service, and administrative workflows. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with multiple software platforms and can manage routine tasks with accuracy and efficiency.



Key Responsibilities

Order Processing & Invoicing

? Handle manual order entry with attention to detail and accuracy

? Manage EDI customer invoicing, including reviewing and sending invoices to customers

Sales Manager Support

Customer Service & Returns Management

.



Order Queue & Workflow Management

? Move orders through processing stages systematically

? Print orders and update order statuses

? Verify that orders have been properly invoiced



Hiring Support

? Screen resumes for specific positions on Indeed as needed

? Review candidate qualifications against established criteria

? Categorize candidates and forward qualified applicants to hiring managers

? Maintain organized candidate data and follow communication guidelines



Required Qualifications

? Proven experience as a virtual assistant or in an administrative role

? Proven experience writing, modifying and organizing standard operating procedures/work instructions

? Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data entry

? Proficiency with Microsoft Excel or other spreadsheet tools

? Strong organizational and time management skills

? Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

Preferred Qualifications

? Experience with e-commerce platforms (Shopify experience preferred)

? Experience in resume screening or recruitment support



Work Details

o September through February: 5-10 hours per week

o March through August: 20-30 hours per week

title: Operations & Estimating Coordinator (Construction – Full-Time Remote)
description:
Wholesale Flooring of Denver specializes in carpet, LVP, laminate, hardwood, cabinetry, and tile. We exist to change how homeowners experience contractors by delivering clarity, communication, and stress-free project execution.



We are not hiring a general virtual assistant.

We are hiring for our Operational Control Center.



This is a long-term role (2+ years preferred) for someone who wants stability, structure, and responsibility inside a growing U.S. construction company.



Role:



You will manage estimating support, pricing updates, CRM workflow compliance, installer coordination, inbox control, and proposal preparation.



You are responsible for operational accuracy, documentation control, and communication flow between sales, vendors, installers, and clients.



This is a systems-driven role. Detail matters.



Responsibilities:

Estimating & Pricing Control



• Enter measurements and job data into QFloors

• Update material pricing when the vendor confirms pricing

• Confirm vendor lead times before pricing updates

• Verify margin structure before proposal drafting

• Prepare professional draft proposals for review

• Send proposals independently once fully trained

• Maintain proposal turnaround under 48 hours



You may update pricing based on confirmed vendor communication.

You may NOT independently adjust margin strategy without approval.



CRM & Workflow Enforcement (GoHighLevel)



• 100% logging of client communication

• Trigger and monitor follow-up workflows

• Ensure estimate follow-ups occur within 24–48 hours

• Track pipeline stages accurately

• Maintain complete contact records

• Monitor install check-in and review request workflows



No client falls through the cracks. 



Installer & Job Coordination



• Confirm installer availability

• Confirm installation dates with installer AND client

• Ensure Installer Checklist confirmation before install

• Confirm material readiness prior to installation

• Send job packets and documentation

• Verify Company Cam “Before” and “After” photos



Inbox &
 Management



• Inbox at zero daily

• Label and archive per company system

• Route vendor invoices properly

• Flag financial items immediately

• Maintain organized digital documentation



You control the flow of information.



Reporting & Accountability



• End-of-day summary report

• Weekly KPI dashboard report

• Flag operational risks immediately

• Escalate delays or pricing issues early



Required Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)



• Minimum 2+ years construction estimating experience

• Experience supporting contractors or construction companies

• Strong Excel skills (formulas required)

• CRM experience (GHL preferred; similar accepted)

• Vendor coordination experience

• Written and spoken English fluency

• Experience handling invoices and POs

• High attention to detail



If you do not have construction experience, do not apply.



Preferred Experience



• QFloors or estimating software experience

• PlanSwift or Bluebeam

• Construction document review

• Remote work with U.S. contractors

• Proposal preparation experience



Performance Metrics (First 30 Days)



You will be measured on:



• Inbox at zero daily

• 100% CRM logging compliance

• Proposal turnaround under 48 hours

• Accurate pricing updates

• No installs without checklist confirmation

• Zero missed follow-ups

• Accurate vendor invoice routing



This role is structured and performance-based.



Authority Boundaries



You MAY:

• Update pricing once vendor confirms

• Confirm install dates with the installer and the client

• Send proposals independently once trained



You MAY NOT:

• Adjust margin strategy independently

• Commit to pricing without vendor confirmation

• Override checklist requirements



Work Schedule



• 30–40 hours per week

• Must overlap with Mountain Standard Time (MST)

• Reliable internet required

• Quiet work environment required







Who Will Succeed Here



• Detail-oriented operators

• Process-driven thinkers

• Calm under pressure

• Comfortable enforcing systems

• Proactive communicators

• Slow but accurate



Who Will Not Succeed Here



• General virtual assistants without a construction background

• Freelancers juggling multiple full-time clients

• People who prefer creative work over structured systems

• Anyone uncomfortable with accountability metrics



We value long-term partnerships.



If this aligns with your experience, submit:



A short paragraph describing your construction estimating experience



The CRM systems you’ve used



Your Excel proficiency level



Your available working hours in MST



Why are you seeking a long-term role

title: Graphics & Funnel Designer
description:
About the Brand

We are a premium coaching brand serving accomplished, high-achieving women 40–60 who are seeking deep love and partnership.

Our aesthetic is elegant, sophisticated, and emotionally intelligent. We prioritize thoughtful design, emotional nuance, and premium aesthetics that resonate with accomplished women. Our audience is discerning, intelligent, and visually attuned. Every funnel must reflect that standard.



About This Role

We are not looking for someone to build a funnel from scratch but know how to optimize existing templates or funnels we've used already. We work from proven, high-converting funnel templates inside GoHighLevel, and we need someone who can take existing templates and expertly adapt it to our brand — our colors, fonts, copy, imagery, and overall aesthetic — so it feels completely custom and elevated.  The highest priority is your ability to make a funnel ridiculously high-converting and also aesthetically beautiful and on brand.

If you're great at following direction, being part of a team, executing quickly, and making things look polished and beautiful within an established structure, this role is for you.



What You'll Be Responsible For

Importing new and customizing existing GHL funnel templates to match our brand and launch goals

Refining and optimizing landing pages, opt-in pages, sales pages, order forms, and upsell pages within the provided template structure. Ability

Applying brand fonts, colors, imagery, and copy with a refined eye for detail

Setting up automations, workflows, triggers, and
 sequences

Integrating Stripe and calendar booking systems (not sure this is necessary because stripe is already integrated)

Designing branded
 templates within GHL (do we need this since Het is advising us for deliverability)

Ensuring full mobile responsiveness and a clean, seamless user experience

Maintaining visual consistency across all funnel assets

ADD: Ensuring our funnels are optimized with the latest enhancements for conversion





Required Skills

Proven, hands-on experience building and customizing funnels inside GoHighLevel - you are a GHL expert

Ability to work with existing templates and make them look completely on-brand — not just functional, but beautiful

Strong GHL automation and workflow knowledge

Clean, refined design sensibility with an eye for typography, balance, and visual hierarchy

Ability to troubleshoot integrations independently

Excellent written and spoken English

Strong attention to detail

Ability to execute quickly without excessive back-and-forth

Video and photo editing skills are a bonus



Work Style & Timeline Expectations

We move quickly and strategically. You should be comfortable completing a full funnel customization — landing page, order page, bumps, upsells, downsells,?
s, automations, and integrations — within 3–5 days. We provide clear direction and expect strong, efficient execution in return. Responsiveness during active build periods is essential.



Ideal Candidate

You have experience working with female-focused or premium lifestyle brands and understand what design resonates with accomplished, professional women. You don't need to reinvent the wheel — you need to take what's already working and make it unmistakably ours. You're detail-oriented, fast, and you take pride in delivering polished work.



To Apply, Please Include:

Links or screenshots of GHL funnels you've built or customized (please include funnel stats as well)

Your portfolio (especially any work for women-focused or premium brands)

Your hourly rate or preferred compensation structure

A short paragraph explaining why you're a strong fit for a premium women's brand



Please only apply if you have hands-on experience inside GoHighLevel. Applications without portfolio examples will not be considered.

title: Real Estate Investor Flips Accountant Bookkeeper
description:
Real Estate Investor Flips Accountant Bookkeeper



*PLEASE read & follow instructions on how to apply, otherwise we will not reply*



About Us

We are a US-based CFO & accountant firm specializing in real estate and construction with multiple entities and properties. We are looking for QuickBooks Online specialist who loves auditing books, fixing problems, and handling multiple client files at the same time.



Job Summary

You will act as our audit and clean-up specialist in QuickBooks Online, responsible for reviewing, catching up, and cleaning multiple sets of books simultaneously for real estate investors and construction entities. You will use Locations, Classes, and Projects to properly track transactions and help standardize our processes with clear SOPs.



Key Responsibilities

- Audit multiple QBO files at once to check accuracy, completeness, and proper coding.

- Perform catch-up and clean-up work for several months or years of backlogged books.

- Fix reconciliations, misclassified transactions, balance issues, and structural chart of accounts problems.

- Use Locations, Classes, and Projects for correct tracking by property, project, and department.

- Perform monthly close across multiple entities: reconciliations, review accounts, post adjusting entries, and prepare simple management reports.

- Handle real estate and construction related accounting (rents, deposits, owner statements, materials, labor, projects, etc.).

- Create and update SOPs for audit, clean-up, and monthly close processes so work is consistent and repeatable.

- Coordinate with the owner/team to clarify unclear transactions and resolve discrepancies quickly.



Required Skills & Experience

- 3+ years strong hands on experience with QuickBooks Online.

- 2+ years in real estate investors flips, rehab, rentals, wholesales (NOT just managing tenants admin work)

- Proven background in:

- Catch-up and clean-up projects for messy or backlogged books.

- Auditing books and identifying root-cause issues, not just data entry.

- Managing and switching between multiple QBO files at the same time.

- Solid understanding of reconciliations, journal entries, and financial statements.

- Good Excel/Google Sheets skills for schedules and reconciliations.

- Must be able to work graveyard shift.



Personality & Work Style

- Analytical and enjoys solving complex bookkeeping problems.

- Loves systems, processes, and building checklists/SOPs for recurring work.

- Calm under pressure and able to manage multiple deadlines and books simultaneously.

- Detail-oriented, organized, and very careful with financial data.

- Team player with clear and proactive communication.



Work Schedule & Salary

- Type: Full-time, remote, Philippines-based.

- Schedule: With at least 5 hours overlap with U.S. daytime (9pm-2am PH time)

- Salary: Competitive based on experience 



Benefits

13th month salary equivalent 

Paid Philippine holidays

On the job training & continuous career development



How to Apply (USE 4 or more AP points)

Please include:

1. Your updated resume.

2. A paragraph describing your largest QBO clean-up or catch-up projects (scope and months/years fixed).

3. A brief description of how you organize your workflow when handling multiple books at the same time.

4. Subject: "Your Full Name | REI bookkeeper knows flips"

5. Create a short loom video intro & why you are perfect for this position

title: E-commerce Ads Strategist
description:
We’re looking for someone who can help us scale our paid advertising with a clear, data-driven strategy.



This is not a media buyer who just launches campaigns. We’re looking for someone who understands structure, angles, testing frameworks, and scaling. You will work closely with us to improve performance across paid platforms (primarily Meta).



What You’ll Do:

- Build and refine our paid ads strategy

- Develop testing frameworks (creatives, hooks, angles, audiences)

- Analyze performance data and translate it into clear action steps

- Advise on scaling structure and budget allocation

- Help improve CTR, CPA, and overall profitability



What We’re Looking For: 

- Proven experience scaling e-commerce brands with paid ads

- Strong understanding of creative strategy and buyer psychology

- Ability to read data and make clear decisions

- Experience with Meta Ads (required)

- Strategic thinker — not just tactical executor



What We Offer:

- Long-term collaboration

- Direct involvement in scaling growing brands

- Performance-driven environment

- Access to marketing courses and internal strategy insights

- Competitive compensation (project-based or monthly retainer)



To Apply:

Please send:

- Your rate

title: Image Ad Creative Designer (E-commerce & Lifestyle Brands)
description:
We’re building a growing e-commerce brand that sells personalized art gifts — emotional, meaningful designs made for loved ones, family, friends, and couples.

Each product carries emotion: love, connection, nostalgia, and family warmth.

We’re also building a second brand focused on sleep and wellbeing, so visuals will range from emotional and warm to calm and minimalist.

We’re NOT looking for a photographer or portrait retoucher.

We’re looking for a creative visual designer who can make ad creatives and marketing visuals — not just beautiful pictures, but scroll-stopping content that connects emotionally and sells.



Your Responsibilities:

Design and edit visuals for ads, website banners, and social media.

Create high-performing ad creatives that combine storytelling, emotion, and clean aesthetics.

Edit and enhance product images — combine products with lifestyle photos, people, or emotional backgrounds.

Use Photoshop (and optionally AI tools) to build new scenes or improve content.

Maintain a consistent brand feeling across all visuals.

Understand what kind of visuals perform well in ads — not just what looks nice.

Add short text overlays or motion captions if needed for performance creatives.



You Should Have:

Strong experience with Photoshop and compositing (placing products into lifestyle scenes).

Experience creating visual ads for e-commerce or social media.

Understanding of visual storytelling and emotional marketing.

Ability to work fast and independently with a strong sense of style.

Great eye for color, lighting, composition, and emotional tone.

Optional: experience with AI tools (Generative Fill, Firefly, Midjourney, etc.)



Bonus Skills

Knows how to match visuals with brand emotion (love, family, memory, calmness, sophistication).

Experience designing ads that fit Meta/TikTok styles.

Comfortable mixing UGC + product shots into clean, emotional visuals.

Interest in health, lifestyle, or aesthetic products is a plus.



What We Offer

Long-term collaboration on a project-based structure.

Creative freedom — we value your ideas and direction.

Consistent work with two emotion-driven brands.

Competitive pay based on output and quality.



To Apply

Please send:

A short introduction about yourself.

Examples of ad creatives or marketing visuals you’ve made (not portraits).

Tell us how you usually create emotion or conversion through visuals.

Your rate (per project or per hour).

title: Production Manager/Creative Director/Head of Production - Video - Remote
description:
About Us

37 Projects is the #1 Video Podcast Marketing Service for Health & Performance Brands. We manage every step of the process - from editing and publishing to strategy, branding, and growth - so our clients can focus on recording while we handle the rest.



We are looking for a Production Manager/Creative Director/Head of Production - Video - Remote who will elevate the creative direction of our clients’ podcasts and YouTube channels. This role blends branding, storytelling, and execution. You’ll ensure that every piece of content reflects the client’s brand identity while engaging audiences at scale.



Role Overview

This role is primarily responsible for the creative direction and production quality of YouTube Shorts, podcast trailers, and explainer videos.



The majority of creative weight sits on:

1. Designing high-impact podcast trailers (not editing)

2. Directing Shorts for maximum engagement and retention

3. Guiding explainer-style educational content to be visually and structurally strong



This is not a passive oversight role.

This is a hands-on creative production leadership role.



The person in this role must think like a:

- Producer

- YouTube-native creative strategist

- Short-form content director



Primary Responsibilities (Highest Priority)

1. Podcast Trailers – Full Ownership

You are fully responsible for:

- Watching full podcast episodes

- Selecting the strongest, most emotionally engaging segments

- Structuring the trailer intro

- Designing the creative arc of the trailer



This includes directing:

- What parts to highlight

- Where to cut

- Where to place B-roll

- Where motion graphics should appear

- Where sound effects enhance emotion

- Audio emphasis and pacing



You do not just approve the trailer - you guide the editor step by step on how it should be executed.



The trailer must:

- Hook within seconds

- Represent the core value of the episode

- Feel premium and intentional

- Increase click-through and retention



2. YouTube Shorts – Creative Direction & Optimization

This is a major focus of the role.

You are responsible for ensuring:

- Strong first 3 seconds

- Aggressive but clean removal of filler words

- High visual rhythm

- Optimal length (40–60 seconds sweet spot)

- Strong narrative even in short format



You will:

a) Guide editors on:

- Cuts

- Visual pacing

- Zoom levels

- Subtitle emphasis

- Motion graphics timing

- Icon use

- Sound design

b) Review Shorts before approval for:

- Engagement strength

- Clarity

- Visual polish

- Platform-native feel



The Shorts must feel:

- Fast

- Intentional

- Emotionally sharp

- YouTube-native



3. Educational / Explainer Videos

For explainer-style content, you are responsible for:

- Ensuring visuals support learning

- Confirming that B-roll accurately reflects what the speaker is explaining

- Eliminating generic or misleading visuals

- Maintaining clean information hierarchy

- Making sure the video enhances clarity, not confusion



You guide editors on:

- Where diagrams appear

- When on-screen text supports key points

- When to stay minimal

- When to emphasize



The explainer must feel:

- Structured

- Educational

- Visually coherent

- Strategically paced



Secondary Responsibilities

4. Deadline Awareness & Delivery Discipline

You must ensure:

- Trailers and Shorts are delivered on time

- Video Specialists understand publishing schedules

- Content calendar awareness is integrated into production

If an editor is late:

- You escalate early

- You reprioritize correctly

- You protect publishing consistency

This role has authority to:

- Flag delays

- Push editors when needed

- Enforce prioritization



5. Training & Coaching Video Specialists (Creative QA)

Not the primary weight — but important.

You will train QA to check for:

- B-roll relevance

- Subtitle quality

- Animation timing

- Icon consistency

- Audio-video sync

- Overall creative coherence



The goal: Upgrade QA from “spelling checkers” to “creative quality reviewers.”



6. Client-Specific Editing Guidelines

You will create editing guidelines per client, covering:

- Trailer style

- Shorts pacing

- Explainer structure

- Animation usage

- Caption systems

- Brand-specific do’s and don’ts

These ensure consistency across editors.



7. Asset Development & Reusability (Lower Priority)

In collaboration with a strong After Effects editor, you will:

- Develop reusable motion graphic packages

- Build icon animation systems

- Create lower-third templates

- Build visual systems for Shorts

Assets will be:

- Built in After Effects

- Stored centrally

- Reusable across editors

This supports scale and consistency.



Authority & Positioning

This role is:

- A creative production leader

- A Shorts and Trailer specialist

- A quality guardian

- A production-level decision maker

This person has influence over:

- Video Editors

- Video Specialists

- Creative standards

- Delivery priorities



This role is not administrative. It is strategic and execution-focused.



Success in This Role Looks Like

- High-performing YouTube Shorts

- Stronger trailer retention and click-through

- Clear, structured explainer videos

- Fewer creative revisions

- Faster production cycles

- Stronger brand consistency across clients

title: Part-Time WordPress Tech Support (Ongoing, Agency Work, 3 hrs/week)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are looking for a detail oriented, highly reliable WordPress technical person to join the Empathysites team.



This role will start with about 3 hours per week, split into two 90 minute sessions per week:



• Monday and Wednesday evenings, or

• Tuesday and Thursday evenings (Philippine Standard Time)



You will support ongoing WordPress maintenance, help launch and migrate websites, manage DNS records, and maintain our internal systems and procedures.



We value predictability for time sensitive tasks like site launches. These launches involve disconnecting a client’s previous website and replacing it with a newly built one. Because issues can occasionally arise during this process, especially around DNS and
 records, we prefer to schedule launches early in the U.S. business day so there is time to catch and address anything quickly.



ABOUT US



Empathysites is a United States based done for you website service for psychotherapists. Since our launch in January 2017, we have helped hundreds of therapists build and maintain websites that reflect their values.



We prioritize clarity, compassion, and nonjudgmental support in both our client work and our team culture.



We typically launch 2 to 4 new client sites per month and maintain an established portfolio of active client websites. As we continue to grow, this role has the potential to expand in hours and responsibility.



WHAT WE OFFER



• Remote work, work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection

• Ongoing work, this is not a one time project

• Clear procedures and predictable workflows



RESPONSIBILITIES



Primary responsibilities



• Website launches and migrations

• DNS and
 record setup

• WordPress maintenance and backups



Secondary responsibilities



• Troubleshooting client issues

• Updating internal SOPs

• Performance or security checks



REQUIRED SKILLS



• At least 2 to 3 years working hands on with WordPress sites, including launches, migrations, or maintenance

• Experience working with PhpMyAdmin and Cloudflare

• Familiarity with HTML, JS, and CSS for debugging purposes

• Strong working knowledge of DNS records, propagation, and
 related configurations

• Experience with domain registration and domain transfers

• Experience with SSL certificates

• Experience creating and restoring full WordPress backups

• Awareness of digital security best practices for WordPress



NICE TO HAVE



We can train on these, but they are helpful:



• Experience maintaining multiple sites from a single dashboard (we use MainWP or similar tools)

• Familiarity with PHP and object storage such as Amazon S3 or DreamObjects

• Experience setting up or troubleshooting Google Workspace
 accounts

• Familiarity with Beaver Builder

• Experience using Trello, Google Drive, or Slack

• Experience supporting non tech savvy clients



THE RIGHT PERSON FOR THIS ROLE



• Extremely detail oriented, you follow checklists, catch small errors, and double check everything

• A strong communicator, you update your team proactively and ask for clarification when needed

• Able to follow procedures but also suggest improvements when you see a better way

• Reliable and consistent, your schedule and communication are predictable and professional



HIRING PROCESS



If this sounds like a good fit, we have an immediate opening, though we are flexible on start date.



The hiring process includes:

• A short written application with technical questions

• A brief video interview

• A paid test task

• If it is a good fit, ongoing work after that



HOW TO APPLY



Please send honest details of what you can and cannot do from the required and optional skills lists above.



Also include your favorite movie so we know you read the full post.



In addition, your
 should include:



• A few details about who you are as a person

• Confirmation that you are available at the listed times

• Your answers to the technical questions below



Technical Question 1

A client’s
 stops working after we migrate their site. They were using Google Workspace but now they are missing
s. What would you check and how would you fix it?



Technical Question 2

You are migrating a site from a development URL to a client’s live domain that currently has a Squarespace site. Briefly outline your launch plan and how you would avoid downtime or data loss.



Technical Question 3

After a site migration, a client reports an SSL error and they are using Cloudflare. What are 2 to 3 common causes and how would you troubleshoot?



Technical Question 4

What tools or services do you prefer for managing DNS, deploying WordPress sites, and monitoring uptime or performance?



Technical Question 5

True or False: A CNAME record can be used at the root of a domain.



APPLY NOW



Send your application to 

 with “WordPress Job” in the subject line, or reply to our existing conversation if we have already been in touch.



Thank you.

title: Email Marketing & Launch Copywriter
description:
About Us

We’re a fast-growing education company serving experienced software engineers who want real-world Rust skills and real career outcomes. Our flagship offers are mentor-led, cohort-based programs focused on shipping production-grade projects and landing Rust-heavy roles.



 is one of our main revenue channels. We use it to fill cohorts, book sales calls, and reactivate our warm audience. We’re hiring someone to own this function end-to-end.



Role Overview

You will own the strategy, copy, and execution of
 campaigns that drive launches, bookings, reactivations, and long-term revenue from our list. This is a senior, full-time role for someone who wants clear ownership, measurable impact, and a long-term seat on the team.



You are not “writing some
s.” You are building a repeatable
 machine that keeps our calendar full and our cohorts sold out.



What You’ll Own

1. Launch Campaigns (Cohorts & Fast-Cash Promos)

Plan and write complete launch sequences for our cohorts and promo offers (pre-launch, open cart, objections, FAQ, deadline, last call, sold-out, etc.).

Standardize, document, and templatize launches so they’re easy to clone and improve.



2. Evergreen Nurture & Segmentation

Build and maintain evergreen sequences that warm new subscribers and move them toward a call or application.

Segment based on behavior and stage (new leads, engaged, inactive, past applicants, buyers) so people get the right messages at the right time.



3. Show-Up & No-Show Sequences

Write and optimize sequences that increase show-up rates for booked calls.

Create follow-up for no-shows and no-buys to recover missed revenue and keep good leads in motion.



4. Reactivation Campaigns

Run quarterly reactivation campaigns for cold or inactive subscribers to generate “found” revenue from the list.



What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

- 3 complete launch sequences live, documented, and reusable.

- 1 evergreen nurture sequence live, for new leads.

- Show-up rate on
-sourced calls improved vs. baseline.

- At least 1 reactivation campaign shipped with clear revenue attribution.

- Clear
 playbook (templates, frameworks, naming) the team can understand and reuse.



Requirements

- 3+ years professional B2C
 copy experience.

- Proven track record owning full launch/email sequences (not just individual
s).

- Strong understanding of offer positioning, sequencing, and deadlines for high-ticket educational or coaching products.

- Ability to write in a clear, human voice that resonates with senior, technical audiences.

- Comfortable with at least 3-hour overlap with US pacific time zone, async with a distributed team, and being accountable to numbers (revenue, bookings, show rates).



Bonus

- Experience with technical or software developer audiences.

- Familiarity with platforms like Kartra, ActiveCampaign, or similar.

- Comfortable pulling basic numbers from dashboards/CRMs to see what’s working.



How to Apply

In your application, include:

- A brief personal intro (2–5 short sentences) in your own words.

- 1–2 examples of launch or promo sequences you’ve written (cohort, course, or high-ticket offers).

- A short note explaining how you approach writing launch
s for a high-ticket cohort program.

- Your monthly salary expectation in USD (full-time) and your official
 address.



Application Question (Required):

1. Which part of the
 lifecycle do you enjoy owning most? (launches, nurture, reactivation, post-purchase, etc.) What
 platforms have you worked in?

2. Briefly describe one launch
 sequence you’ve owned end-to-end.

3. In 5–7 bullet points, outline:

- the audience

- the goal of the sequence

- how you structured the sequence (early ? middle ? final
s)

- one decision you made to avoid audience fatigue



Applications that skip any of the above will not be considered.

title: YouTube Video Editor
description:
Hi! We run a growing faceless YouTube channel about pets (dogs, cats, puppies, kittens, and more) and we’re looking for a reliable video editor who can help us create consistent 9–13 minute videos.

This is a long-term role for the right person.

We produce two primary types of videos:

________________________________________

VIDEO TYPES

1. Compilation Videos

Examples: “Big Dog Fails,” “Cats Love Their Owners,” “Pets in Snow” "Funny Horses"

Your role:

• Source high-quality clips that match the topic

• Edit into a cohesive, engaging compilation

• Maintain strong flow, pacing, and viewer retention

________________________________________

2. Info / Story Videos

We’re looking for someone who can take a topic and turn it into a finished video using our format and structure.

This includes:

• Researching the topic using provided direction and keywords

• Writing an engaging script with a strong hook

• Generating a natural-sounding AI voiceover

• Sourcing and editing clips to match pacing and sentiment

• Delivering a clean, cohesive final video

We provide:

• Topic direction and keyword guidance

• Clear formatting examples

• Hook guidance and structure expectations

• Ongoing coaching and refinement

You won’t be starting from scratch — we have a defined style and format. We’re looking for someone who enjoys building content from idea to final output and takes ownership of what they create.

We like our content informative but not dry. A little personality goes a long way.

________________________________________

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

• Deliver final videos in 1080p

• Strong editing skills (cutting, pacing, audio syncing, basic enhancement, transitions, muting/adjusting audio, zoom/pan, etc.)

• Ability to responsibly find and source clips

• Daily communication (quick update + questions + what you’ll work on next)

Bonus:

If you already have subscriptions to stock footage sites with commercial licenses, mention them in your application.

________________________________________

HOW TO APPLY (Important)

To apply, include the word friendly at the top of your message

Please also include:

• If you have any pets, and if so what kind (It’s not necessary to actually have pets currently)

• Your YouTube editing experience (channels/niches)

• Briefly describe a project where you took a video from idea to finished product

• 2–5 relevant samples (YouTube links or portfolio — not everything you’ve ever done – like thumbnails and packaging, etc.)

• What editing software you use

• Your typical turnaround time for a 9–13 minute video

• Your minimum monthly or hourly rate for full-time (40 hours/week)

Rate of pay: $340–$550 per month (depending on experience and output quality)

If selected, we’ll start with a paid test to make sure we’re a good fit. Final hiring decisions will be based on the test.

Thanks — excited to see your work!

title: Operations Assistant
description:
About Proactive Marketing

We not only guarantee the best results for our clients, but we also prioritize building a one-of-a-kind working experience for our team. We are 100% remote, and we encourage our employees to work from anywhere in the world.



We have a strong company culture that focuses on innovation, personal development, leadership, and cultivating a winning environment. We believe that our company is most productive when our employees are fulfilled, challenged, and working to achieve both their personal and professional goals, while constantly striving for their own personal next level.

In today’s world taking initiative is a critical component of success. Therefore, we encourage tea
mbers to take initiative in the direction that they see fit so that they can learn valuable lessons along the way and contribute to relevant team goals. We don’t micromanage and we encourage an environment of responsibility and leadership.

We’re looking for a highly organized, detail-driven Operations Support Specialist to keep our internal systems, tracking, and fulfillment running at a world-class level.



This role is critical. You’ll be the backbone of our operations—ensuring 100?curacy, daily execution, and strong accountability across teams. If you love systems, tracking, follow-ups, and keeping things airtight, this role is for you.

To ensure we place the perfect fit for every position (internal & external) by maintaining flawless tracking, proactive execution, and same-day fulfillment across all operational systems.



Key Outcomes / KPIs

100?curacy on all tracking sheets

Tracking is completed daily without exception

Tea
mbers are held accountable (Slack tagging when updates are missing)

Competencies We’re Looking ForAttention to Detail & Organization



Our systems are interconnected. Your work must always be clean, accurate, and consistent.



Reliability



We must be able to depend on you. Team and client success relies on your responsiveness and follow-through.



Proactiveness



You troubleshoot first. You double-check. You research. You exhaust options before escalating—and when you do ask for help, it’s thoughtful and informed.



Communication



Responsive during business hours via Slack (phone is fine)

Clear updates

Proactive heads-ups if unavailable

Time Management



You manage your workload efficiently and hit daily responsibilities without reminders.



First 30-Day Expectations



Within your first 30 days, you should be able to:



Understand every tracking sheet, its purpose, and data sources

Know who owns which data across departments

Maintain 100% raw data accuracy

Confidently handle:

Twilio A2P registration

Reactivation campaigns

HighLevel workflows & troubleshooting

Ad hoc admin and ops tasks

Support recruitment scheduling and internal coordination

What We Look For in the First 30 DaysCommunication



Clear

Timely

Coachable

Quick to implement feedback

Skillset



100% KPI accuracy

Deep understanding of why we track—not just how

Ability to extract needed data within 25 minutes

Strong organization across Asana, Monday,
, and Slack

Autonomous problem-solving

Culture Fit



Proactive

Punctual

Fast

No drama

Takes full ownership

Honest and accountable

Team player

Not afraid to make mistakes—but owns and fixes them

Work Setup & Schedule



Remote | Full-Time

Flexible schedule with the following requirements:

Responsive during business hours

Agreed-upon daily End-of-Day (EOD) reporting time

Freedom to work from anywhere

Time off allowed with 4 weeks’ notice

Professional Requirements



Clean, professional workspace

Good camera and lighting

Reliable internet connection

Notify at least 24 hours in advance for emergencies when possible

2 weeks’ notice required if transitioning out of the role

May require occasional weekend work during high-push months

This Role Is NOT For You If:



You miss details

You need constant reminders

You don’t like accountability

You struggle with systems or tracking

You avoid ownership

This Role IS For You If:



You love systems and accuracy

You take pride in clean operations

You move fast without sacrificing quality

You enjoy being the person everyone relies on

Job Type: Full-time



Work Location: Remote
