title: Graphic Designer for Therapy Website Images (AI + Brand Style)
description:
ABOUT THE PROJECT



We’re looking for a graphic designer to help create a set of custom images for therapist websites.



This is a one-time project, not an ongoing role. The goal is to build a cohesive image library that feels calm, warm, and emotionally aligned with mental health practices.



You will be working within an existing visual direction. This gig focuses on executing well within a defined style rather than inventing brand concepts from scratch.



ABOUT US



Empathysites is a U.S.-based website service for psychotherapists. Since 2017, we’ve helped hundreds of therapists build websites that reflect their values and feel welcoming to clients.



Our work prioritizes clarity, emotional sensitivity, and thoughtful design choices.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



• Generate custom images using Midjourney or similar AI tools

• Refine and prepare images using Photoshop, Affinity, or similar software

• Create image sets that feel cohesive and consistent in tone

• Follow creative direction and moodboards closely

• Export organized, web-ready files



This project is focused on image creation, not logo design or full brand development.



REQUIRED SKILLS



• Experience using Midjourney or similar AI tools for photorealistic image generation

• Strong image editing skills in Photoshop or similar software

• Ability to match an existing visual style

• Good eye for lighting, color harmony, and emotional tone

• Organized file handling and naming



NICE TO HAVE



• Experience creating images for websites or marketing materials

• Experience working within brand guidelines

• Experience creating image sets, not just single images



THE RIGHT PERSON FOR THIS PROJECT



• Pays close attention to detail

• Can follow direction carefully and consistently

• Communicates clearly and reliably

• Is comfortable working independently and meeting deadlines



PROJECT SCOPE



This is a one-time project with a defined image batch to be created. We'll start with a smaller scale project and if it goes well, you will get the full project.



If collaboration goes well, there may be future project work, but there is no promise of ongoing work.



HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please include what AI image tools you are familiar with what your favorite movie is. Also include the following in your application:



1. A link to your portfolio

2. Your hourly rate or project rate

3. A link to ONE image you believe would fit well on a therapist website and one or two sentences explaining why you chose that image



Send an
 to 
 with [Graphic Design Gig] in the subject - or just reply to our preexisting correspondence if we’ve already been in touch. Follow all the directions listed above under “How To Apply” 



Thank you.

title: Customer Experience Specialist (US Skincare Brand) — Work Directly with the Founder
description:
Hi, I’m Loic, the founder of a US based skincare brand for women 50+.



We are a fast-growing, US-based direct-to-consumer skincare brand. We create premium, high-science body care specifically designed for women 50+ experiencing hormonal skin changes.



We are entering a critical growth phase, and I am looking for a sharp, empathetic, and highly reliable Customer Experience Specialist to be my right hand in managing our customer inbox.



Our brand voice is warm, professional, and deeply empathetic. Our customers are mature women who want to be heard, respected, and taken care of. If you have a robotic, corporate tone, this is not the role for you. If you genuinely love solving problems and turning a frustrated customer into a brand advocate, keep reading.



The Reality of the Role:

You will be the first point of contact for our customers via
.

While I provide detailed Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and
 templates, this is not a brainless copy-paste job. You will need to use judgment to adapt templates, investigate tracking issues, handle refund requests gently, and know exactly when to escalate an urgent issue (like a chargeback threat) directly to me.



What You Will Do:



Inbox Management: Monitor and respond to all customer service
s within 2-4 hours during your shift (US EST hours).



Problem Solving: Handle "Where is my order?", cancellations, returns, and damaged product claims with grace and accuracy.



Data Integrity: Meticulously log order numbers, tracking updates, and issue patterns into our daily tracking spreadsheet.



Defense: Monitor aggressively for chargeback threats or payment disputes and alert me immediately so we can protect the business.



Feedback Loop: Submit a simple weekly report highlighting customer confusion, recurring complaints, or suggestions to improve our SOPs.



Who You Are:



Fluent & Natural English: You write clearly and warmly without sounding like a textbook.



High Emotional Intelligence: Angry customers don't rattle you. You know how to de-escalate a situation.



Meticulous: You double-check tracking numbers and never make a promise (like a refund) without checking the policy first.



Tech-Comfortable: You have experience with Shopify, Gmail, Google Docs, Gorgias, Commslayer and standard e-commerce tools.



Equipped: You have a quiet workspace and highly reliable internet.



What We Provide:



Direct access and communication with me (the Founder). No middle management.



A respectful, supportive environment where your feedback actually matters.



Room to grow into a full-time, expanded role as the company scales.



???? HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully) ????



We ignore all generic, AI-generated applications. To prove you read this and have the attention to detail required for the job, you must follow these exact steps:



1. The Subject Line:

Make the subject line of your application: "Skin CX: [Insert Your Favorite Color]"



2. The Video Intro (Required):

Record a 1 to 2-minute Loom video (or similar screen recording link) introducing yourself. Tell me why you want to work for a skincare brand targeting mature women, and briefly describe a time you turned an angry customer into a happy one. Applications without a video link will be instantly deleted.



3. The Skin Writing Test:

Imagine a customer named Susan
s us: "I bought your Undaria body oil 2 weeks ago and I am furious. The ad said immediate results, but my arms are still crepey and sagging! I want my money back right now, this is a scam."



Write exactly how you would reply to Susan.

(Hint: Remember our brand voice. Acknowledge her frustration, explain gently that while hydration is instant, rebuilding skin density takes 30-45 days, and offer her our 100% refund guarantee if she finishes the bottle and still isn't happy).



Please attach your resume and send your application following the steps above. I look forward to meeting you!



Why this version will get you better talent:

The Loom Video Filter: This is the ultimate AI killer. Lazy applicants or people using bots physically cannot generate a personalized 60-second video speaking directly to "Loic about Skin." You will immediately cut your applicant pool down, but the ones remaining will be top-tier.



The "Trick" Test: Instead of a generic "where is my order" test (which ChatGPT can answer perfectly), the writing test asks them to handle the exact "Hydration vs. Structure" objection you deal with daily. It forces them to actually read the prompt and show real empathy.



The Tone: It sounds like a real founder protecting her business, which attracts A-players who respect strong leadership.

Excellent communication skills – able to have comfortable, friendly conversations in English without being overly formal or technical.

Strong attention to detail and follow-through – “never let it go until it’s solved.”

Demonstrable experience working with Windows systems (client/server) and O365 administration.

Proficiency in advanced troubleshooting methodologies.

Scripting skills, particularly in PowerShell, to automate tasks and improve efficiency.

Experience with VOIP systems and a solid understanding of network infrastructure.

Familiarity with RMM and PSA platforms used in MSP environments (e.g., Datto, Halo).

We are heavy users of Office 365 and Azure, so you’ll need to have solid experience and know the fundamentals or demonstrate skills in something very similar..

Ability to handle difficult tasks, set proper expectations, and deliver solutions within a reasonable timeframe.

Out-of-the-box thinker – proactive, creative, and always looking to improve processes.

Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure client satisfaction.

Ability to “figure things out,” even when facing new or unfamiliar technologies.

title: Elite Video Editor & Animator (After Effects / Midjourney)
description:
I am launching a high-end, faceless YouTube channel in the true-crime and underground business niche. I am not looking to pump out cheap, low-effort daily videos. We are building 1 to 2 absolute masterpieces per month.



I am looking for a highly skilled Video Editor and Animator to partner with long-term.



WHAT I PROVIDE (THE SYSTEM):

You will never have to guess what I want. For every single video, I will hand you:



A fully written, high-retention script.



The final, perfectly paced professional voiceover audio (generated via ElevenLabs).



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES (THE VISUALS):

Your job is the visual assembly and atmospheric world-building.



AI Image Generation: Use Midjourney (or similar elite AI tools) to generate gritty, cinematic, or 2D vector-style images.



Animation: Edit the video in Premiere Pro or After Effects. No static images. You must use slow zooms, pans, and subtle parallax animations to keep the viewer's eyes moving every 3 to 4 seconds.



Typography: Create dynamic, highly engaging subtitles in the center of the screen, highlighting key words to maintain retention.



Sound Design: Add heavy, cinematic background music and subtle sound effects (heartbeats, impacts, whooshes) to build tension.



Thumbnails: Follow a strict, simple visual layout to create high-click-through-rate thumbnails.



THE STYLE REFERENCE:

Before you apply, go to YouTube and search for the channel "The Life Outline".

My videos must look, feel, and sound exactly like this style—dark, realistic, and highly engaging. If you cannot replicate this exact level of quality, do not apply.



REQUIREMENTS:



Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects.



Deep understanding of how to prompt and generate consistent AI art (Midjourney, etc.).



Excellent understanding of YouTube pacing and sound design.



Reliable internet and strong communication skills.



THE HIRING PROCESS:

To ensure we are a perfect fit, short-listed candidates will be given a paid 60-second test. I will provide the audio and script, and you will edit it in the requested style. If your edit matches the quality standard, you are hired for the long term.



HOW TO APPLY:

DM with the word "ARCHITECT" so i actually know you read this.

title: YouTube & Short-Form Content (Adobe Premiere Pro & After Effects)
description:
ABOUT US



We're a comedy content brand based in Auckland, New Zealand with 3.5 million followers across social media. Our content is currently focused on shortform trends with plot twists, remaking viral videos funnier, and slow-motion dramatic skits that has dabbled in the longform space but want to execute more there. We move fast, we make people laugh, and everything we do has a creative angle.



We're looking for ONE experienced, creative, and socially plugged-in video editor to own the post-production side of this operation. This is not an entry-level role. We need someone who has been in the trenches, understands pacing, and genuinely gets what makes people laugh online.

This role starts as a paid freelance test project with the goal of becoming a long-term, full-time position for the right person.



THE MOST IMPORTANT THING TO UNDERSTAND ABOUT THIS ROLE?

Editing comedy is not the same as editing any other content. A cut half a second too late kills a joke. A sound effect dropped in the wrong 
nt ruins a bit. If you've only ever edited corporate videos or travel vlogs, this probably isn't the role for you.

We need someone who lives on the internet, knows what's trending in 
 culture right now, and understands instinctively why something is funny - not just how to make it look clean.

If you know exactly what the "FAAAAH" sound effect is, when to use it, and more importantly when it's been overused - you're already speaking our language.



WHAT YOU'LL DO



This role has a clear weekly workload across two content types:



YOUTUBE - Primary Focus



Each week you'll receive one YouTube video (currently 10–20 minutes final output, potentially longer over time) along with a written edit brief from the talent. The brief will include timestamps, instructions, tone direction, and any specific 
nts to highlight or cut around.



Your deliverables for each YouTube video:

* Full edited YouTube cut — clean, punchy, comedy-timed, with motion graphics and text animations where needed

* Two short-form cuts reformatted from the YouTube video for other platforms (vertical, optimised for social)

* Subtitles and captions included and accurate 

Turnaround: First cut delivered within 1.5–3 days of receiving footage.



SHORT-FORM INSTAGRAM SKITS — Secondary Focus

Each week you'll also receive approximately 5-10 short-form Instagram skit videos (9:16 vertical format). These are simpler edits — but they still need to be sharp, well-paced, and feel native to the platform.

Turnaround: Within 24 hours of receiving footage during your working hours.



MOTION GRAPHICS & ANIMATIONS



This is a core part of the role, not an afterthought. Roughly 20% of every YouTube video will involve custom motion graphics, text animations, and visual effects. The style benchmark is:

* Airrack — absurd VFX, masking, and visual gags

* Ryan Trahan — simple, clean, well-timed animations

* Will Tennyson — clean graphics, natural pacing, personality-driven editing (This is the preferred style)

If you can't look at those three channels and immediately understand the aesthetic, this isn't the right fit.



WORKING RELATIONSHIP



You'll be working inside Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects — these are non-negotiable. No exceptions.

The talent is also an advanced editor. He will review your cut, make final touches directly inside the project file, and occasionally adjust timing, graphics, or colour. You need to be comfortable with your work being opened, refined, and built on — this is a collaboration, not a handoff.

You'll have access to the brand's music libraries and VFX asset libraries via provided login credentials. You're you're welcome to use these and any other libraries that you may have a subscription for. ?

HARD SKILLS (Required)



* Adobe Premiere Pro — strong confidence here, non-negotiable

* Adobe After Effects — animations, masking basics, non-negotiable

* Photoshop basic skills is expected 

* Motion graphics and text animation — basic animation skills or working with templates, non-negotiable

* Short-form content editing — vertical format, platform-native pacing

* Subtitles and captions — accurate, well-timed, cleanly formatted

* File management — organised project files that another editor can open and navigate easily?

HARD SKILLS (Strong Bonus)

* 2D animations and custom graphic design

* 3D is not required but would be an exceptional bonus??

SOFT SKILLS (Required)

* Genuine sense of humour — you understand comedy timing instinctively

* Deeply plugged into internet culture, 
s, and what's trending in the social media space right now

* Self-driven and reliable — you hit your turnaround times without being chased

* Strong communicator — you ask smart questions before starting, not after delivering

* Receptive to direction — you can take a detailed brief and execute it faithfully without ego

* Detail-oriented — nothing ships with errors you could have caught yourself



EXPERIENCE (Required)



We are not looking for a new or junior editor. We need someone who has worked with YouTubers or social media creators before and can demonstrate that experience. A portfolio or showreel is required with your application — applications without one will not be considered. If providing a YouTube link with your work you must be credited on the video as proof

Comedy content experience is a strong bonus. If you've edited comedy skits, reaction content, or 
-heavy videos before, tell us about it.



WORK HOURS



Full-time, 40 hours/week. Flexible hours with reasonable overlap (not mandatory) with NZ business hours (9am–5pm NZST) for communication and feedback turnarounds. 



HOW TO APPLY



Include ALL of the following or your application will not be considered:?

1. Brief intro — who you are, your editing background, and why you're the right fit for a comedy content brand.

2. Your portfolio or showreel — this is non-negotiable. Show us your best work. If you have specific examples of YouTube edits, short-form content, or motion graphics work, highlight those. Comedy content examples will stand out. Please list any content creators you might have worked with before. 

3. Software and tools — confirm you use Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects. List any other tools or plugins you are familiar with??

4. The Comedy Timing Test:?

This is the most important part of your application. Watch this clip: [you will insert a short clip here — a simple talking head or reaction 
nt from one of your videos]?

Tell us:

* Where would you place a cut, a sound effect, or a graphic to make this 
nt funnier?

* What sound effect or 
 reference would you use and why?

There's no single right answer. We want to see how your brain works when it comes to comedy editing. If your answer references something that was relevant two years ago but is completely dead now, that tells us something too.



5. The Culture Test:



We want to know you're actually plugged into what's happening online right now — not six months ago.

What’s one 
 sound that is working on the internet right now? ?What’s one 
 image that is working on the internet right now????

6. Your expected monthly salary in USD.?

7. Your available start date.



We're building something genuinely fun here. If you're a sharp editor who gets comedy, lives on the internet, and takes real pride in making content that makes people laugh — we want to hear from you. ????

title: Video Editor
description:
Video Editor for Growing YouTube Team (Meadows Media Team)



Do you love crafting engaging videos? Are you looking to grow with a creative, fast-moving team?



You’ll be working directly with a small, focused media team managing multiple YouTube channels. While Wrist Unwound is one of our core brands, our team supports several channels—some with hundreds of thousands of subscribers and millions of views.



We are currently managing four active channels and expanding to six or more in the coming months. As we grow, we’re building a team of editors who can grow with us and eventually take ownership of entire content pipelines.



What You’ll Do

• Edit both long-form YouTube videos (8–15 minutes) and short-form content (Reels/Shorts)

• Work within a team of editors, each contributing to different styles and formats

• Follow structured workflows for consistent, high-quality output

• Collaborate on pacing, storytelling, and viewer retention—not just cuts and transitions

• Organize and manage project files for smooth handoffs across the team

• Deliver edits on time with clear communication



What We’re Looking For

• Basic to intermediate video editing skills (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve)

• Strong understanding (or desire to learn) YouTube pacing, retention, and storytelling

• Ability to adapt to multiple editing styles depending on the project

• Reliability, professionalism, and consistent communication

• A mindset focused on growth, feedback, and improvement



Growth and Opportunities --> This is not a one-off role—it’s an opportunity to grow within a developing media team.



As we expand, top performers will have opportunities to:

• Take ownership of full projects or content series

• Help shape editing style and creative direction

• Mentor or lead other editors

• Move into higher-paying roles with increased responsibility



Performance-based raises, bonuses, and expanded roles will reflect your contribution.



Compensation

• Starting pay: $4 USD/hour (trial period)

• Increases based on performance, consistency, and output

• Long-term potential for stable, higher-paying role within the team

• Payment via [PayPal / Wise / etc.]



How to Apply (Read Carefully) To be considered, follow these steps:



Start your application with the phrase: "Sua Sponte"



Include:

a. Your updated resume

b. Links to your portfolio or editing work

c. A short video or written introduction



Answer the following:

a. How many projects can you handle per week?

b. Typical turnaround time (long-form and short-form)?

c. What separates a good edit from a great one?



Task:

Visit the Wrist Unwound YouTube 
oose one video that stands out to you and explain:

• Why it caught your attention

• What you think worked well in the edit



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.



=======================================================



If you want to grow as an editor, be challenged, and be part of something that’s expanding—this is that opportunity.

title: Go High Level Administrator  |  Make.com & N8N Pipeline Builder
description:
???? The Mission

We are a faith-rooted multi-business operation (commercial roofing, virtual assistant services, and growing brands) and we need someone who can make Go High Level actually work ... not just poke around in it. This is a fractional engagement: 1 to 3 months to get all the pipes and wires flowing, then evaluate for ongoing support.



? Required Skills

1. Go High Level (GHL) administration: custom fields, pipelines, workflows, triggers, automations, forms, and landing pages

2. 
 scenario building: webhook triggers, API connections, and data transformations

3. N8N workflow building: self-hosted preferred, API integrations, and data routing

4. Landing page and funnel building inside GHL

5. Integration experience: Dropbox, transcription tools,
/SMS automation, and calendar systems

6. Comfortable reading API documentation and configuring webhooks



? Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

1. GHL App Marketplace and third-party plug-ins (mapping, heat tracking,
 deliverability)

2. Experience with Klaviyo or similar
 deliverability platforms

3. Familiarity with AI/LLM API integrations (Claude, OpenAI)



???? First 30 Days — Deliverables

This is not a vague role. Here is exactly what gets built:



1. Audit current GHL setup. Document what is broken, missing, and working. Deliver a written findings report.

2. Build custom fields: avatar type (Meg / Bill / Kenny / Nance / Val), enthusiasm score / heat index (0–200), material type, solution tier, proposal status, multi-location flag, golden
, lead source, cost per lead.

3. Build pipeline stages matching the 10-phase proposal pipeline from the SOP.

4. Build the transcription pipe: Audio ? Transcription ? Claude API ? Structured JSON ? GHL fields via 
 or N8N.

5. Connect landing pages (
 and 
) to GHL lead capture.

6. Build splash pages for $100/day social media ad campaigns so leads do not evaporate at the click.

7. Import and clean 3,600 building records into GHL as contacts with proper tagging by industry, city, and roof size.

8. Set up follow-up sequences: after proposal sent, after video viewed, after 7-day no response, and after 30-day no response.

9. Implement lead source tracking: Referral, Physical Marketing (flyer/brochure), Door-to-Door, Call-In from Mailer, Digital/Social (by platform), Blog Download. Every lead must have a source and a CPL attached.

10. Set up Wednesday newsletter automation: GHL
 campaign ships at 9 AM CST every Wednesday. Evaluate Klaviyo or similar if GHL
 bounce rates are too high.

11. Implement heat index scoring system (0–200 enthusiasm scale across all contacts). 

12. Implement field mapping/tracking plug-in for geographic lead visualization.



???? Who You Are

1. You have built inside GHL before — not just poked around in it. You have shipped working automations.

2. You think in systems. You see a broken process and immediately start mapping how to fix it end-to-end.

3. You communicate clearly in writing. We are a remote team and documentation matters.

4. You are self-directed. You do not need hand-holding on every task — but you ask great questions when you need clarity.

5. You are comfortable with ambiguity. We are a growing operation and some things are not fully defined yet. That is part of the job.

6. You are aligned with a faith-rooted, purpose-driven business culture. We operate with integrity, care for our people, and want our work to matter.



???? How to Apply

Send the following to our team:



1. A short video (2–5 minutes) walking us through a GHL workflow, 
 scenario, or N8N pipeline you have built. 

Show us your work.

2. Your resume or a brief written summary of relevant experience.

3. One sentence on why this role fits where you are right now.



Applications without a video or work sample will not be reviewed.





We are not looking for someone to figure it out. We are looking for someone who already knows ... and is ready to build.

title: US CPA Tax Firm Client Service Coordinator
description:
We are looking for someone with one of the following:

- 2 years of US CPA Firm experience 



Pay:

Starting at $10hr 



Working Hours

Regular hours: Usually EST/PST/CST Business Hours 

Busy season hours: 10AM to 10 PM US Hours with weekend work



Mission



Own the first 90 days of new engagements from tax filing, tax planning, accounting, etc. Get every client fully onboarded and informed, all tax organizers and documents collected, and keep them informed so they feel guided, not neglected. Your success is measured by speed to “ready for work” and client happiness. 



Responsibilities

Meet with prospects and leads via video calls

Call prospects direct to schedule onboarding calls 

Assist in filling out organizers

Act as customer service rep 





Location

Remote position with dedicated and secure workspace required, free of distractions.



1. New Client Onboarding & Activation

- Receive warm handoff from sales with full notes and call recordings to understand the client

- Schedule and host onboarding / document calls to walk clients through the portal and process.  

- Track each client’s status from “Closed” to “All docs in, ready for tax work.”



2. Tax Organizer & Document Collection (Core Duty)

- For each tax season engagement, review the client’s prior?year return and known facts.  

- Pre?fill the tax organizer as much as possible before the client call (basic info, known entities, prior?year amounts where applicable) so you use call time to confirm, not type.  

- Send organizer + clear checklist of remaining items.  

- Schedule and run “Organizer & Docs” calls to complete missing sections live and ensure uploads happen.  

- Execute a follow?up cadence 
, text, calls) until all required information and documents are received.



3. Client Communication & Basic Support (Core Duty)

- Be the primary point of contact for routine questions about: timelines, portal, organizers, extensions, basic tax terms. Provide comfort calls when the client is lost and making sure clients don’t churn from lack of service

- Proactively send status updates so clients know what’s happening and what’s next.

- Triage and route technical / advice?level questions to CPAs and tax strategists with a clear summary.  



4. Retention & Relationship Management

- Run a 90?day success path for new concierge members (onboarding, implementation check?in coordination with the associate tax advisor, 60? and 90?day touchpoints). 

- Monitor “at?risk” signals (unresponsive, repeated confusion, missed meetings) and book save?the?relationship calls.  

- Promote and remind clients about our Skool community, live calls, and trainings; share recaps and key takeaways.

- Offer feedback check-ins with $7k ARR clients to gauge sentiment and offer to schedule meetings, follow up on deliverables, and general feedback to boost retention 



Software You'll Use:



ProConnect (Intuit) – tax return and extension prep

TaxDome – CRM and secure client communication

QuickBooks Online – for coordinating with bookkeepers

Google Workspace – Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail (we don't use Microsoft Office)

Go High Level





Hiring Process

Apply and record a Loom introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this position.



 that to : 



Prescreen interview (30 minutes)

Technical test (take-home)

Panel/culture interview (60 minutes)

title: Creative Producer (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram)
description:
ABOUT US



We're a comedy content brand based in Auckland, New Zealand, with 3.5 million followers across social media. Our content is trends with plot twists, remaking viral videos funnier, and skits. We're not a corporate media company. We move fast, we make people laugh, and everything we do has a creative angle.



We're looking for ONE sharp, creative, and self-driven person to become the backbone of this operation. You'll handle the research, planning, and creative ideation that makes content happen — so that when the talent shows up, all he has to do is perform.

This role starts as a paid freelance test project with the goal of becoming a long-term, full-time position for the right person.



THE MOST IMPORTANT THING TO UNDERSTAND ABOUT THIS ROLE



This is not a data entry job. This is not just a research job. The most valuable thing you will do is watch what's trending and tell us how WE make a better, funnier version of it.

If you can find a video with 40M views and say "here's exactly why this worked, and here's how we make it funnier with our style" — you're the person we're looking for.

Creative thinking comes first. Organisation is what makes it happen.



WHAT YOU'LL DO?



AREA 1:
 — Viral Video Research (Daily)



Every day, source and deliver 20 viral videos suitable for reaction-style content. These are videos the talent will react to on camera — so they need to be genuinely compelling, funny, controversial, or emotionally charged enough to get a real reaction.

Your first stop for finding these is Reddit and X 
). Secondary sources are
, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok. We want content that's breaking or peaking — not videos that have already saturated every platform.

Deliver daily in a shared spreadsheet or Notion board with:

* Video link

* Platform and metrics (views, shares, comments — whatever is available)

* A brief note on why it's a strong reaction candidate?



AREA 2: INSTAGRAM — Viral Video Research (Daily)



Every day, source and deliver 10 viral videos suitable for us to recreate or shoot our own version of. These are videos we'll put our own twist on — so look for concepts that translate well to our style: trends with plot twists, remaking things funnier, slow-motion dramatic skits.

Again, Reddit and X are your first stop. Then secondary platforms.

Deliver daily in the same shared board with:

* Video link

* Platform and metrics

* A brief note on why this is a strong recreation candidate and what angle we could take?



AREA 3: YOUTUBE — Weekly Concept Pitches & Production Execution



This is the most creative and involved part of the role. It runs on a clear weekly cycle:

Monday — You deliver 5–8 YouTube video concepts. Each concept must include:

* The core idea and angle — what's the video and why will it perform?

* The hook — what grabs the viewer in the first 3 seconds?

* The payoff — what makes them stay until the end?

* Thumbnail concept — what does the thumbnail look like? What's the text, the visual, the emotion?

* Rough script outline — key beats, 
nts, or scenes in bullet-point form

Tuesday — Approvals are returned within 24 hours. 1–2 concepts will be selected.

Tuesday through Friday — You execute. Once a concept is approved, your job is to make it happen. This means:

* Researching and booking locations

* Making calls to NZ businesses (we'll provide a NZ virtual phone number)

* Coordinating any talent or collaborators

* Sourcing props or permissions if needed

* Building a full shoot day schedule so that when the talent arrives, everything is ready

You are the producer. The talent shows up and performs. Everything else is on you.?



AREA 4: CONTENT LANDSCAPE MONITORING (Weekly)



Each week, deliver a brief report on what's gaining traction in our content space broadly — what formats, trends, or styles are picking up 
ntum across platforms. This isn't about tracking specific creators. It's about keeping us ahead of what's coming so we're never late to a trend.

This doesn't need to be long. A sharp, well-organised one-pager with your key observations and any opportunities you see for us is enough.



HARD SKILLS (Required)



* Strong English — written AND spoken (phone calls to NZ businesses required)

* Excellent research skills with Reddit and X as your primary tools, and
, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok as secondary

* Deep familiarity with social media metrics and what actually drives performance at scale

* Experience with Notion, Google Sheets, or similar tools

* Ability to analyse content and extract creative insights — not just surface-level observations

* Basic understanding of video production workflows and shoot day logistics



SOFT SKILLS (Required)



* Creative thinker — you have opinions about content, not just observations

* Proactive and self-driven — you don't wait to be told what to do

* Highly organised — you're managing daily deliverables and a weekly production cycle simultaneously

* Strong communicator — you flag problems early, ask smart questions, and give clear updates

* Reliable — you deliver on time, every time

* Calm under pressure — when a shoot is two days away and something falls through, you solve it



NICE TO HAVE



* Previous experience working with a YouTuber or content creator

* Knowledge of the reaction content space

* Familiarity with NZ culture, slang, or local context

* Experience with production coordination, location scouting, or scheduling

* Capcut or basic editing skills



WORK HOURS



Full-time, 40 hours/week. Flexible hours, but you must have at least 3–4 hours of overlap with NZ business hours (9am–5pm NZST) for communication and phone calls. For Philippines time, this means being available roughly 4am–8am PHT or adjusting your schedule accordingly.



HOW TO APPLY



Include ALL of the following or your application will not be considered:

1. Brief intro — who you are and why you're a good fit for this specific role.

2. Your experience with content research, social media, or production co-ordination work?

3. The Creative Test — this is the most important part of your application:

Find two short-form videos that you believe are going viral right now or have recently. For each video:

* Provide the link

* Provide the social media metrics 

* Tell us why YOU think this video is viral. What's driving it? What made people share it?

* What's one thing that could have made it even better?

* How would YOU remake this video in our style? Give me a rough concept in 3–5 bullet points?

We want to understand how you think about performance and scale, so be specific about the numbers and what they mean to you.?



4. The Attention Test:



We get a lot of applications. Most people don't read this far. To prove you did, answer this question somewhere in your application:

"If you could only eat one fruit for the rest of your life, what would it be and why?"

No right answer. Bonus points if it's funny.?

5. Your expected monthly salary in USD.?

6. Your available start date.



We're building something genuinely fun here. If you're obsessed with what goes viral, you have creative opinions, and you're the type of person who makes things happen behind the scenes — we want to hear from you. ????

title: Senior Tax Associate, Partner's Right Hand
description:
**About the Role**

This is not a tax preparation job. You'll be working directly with the firm's partner on the firm's most complex and sensitive matters international tax, IRS representation, client strategy, and the kind of judgment calls that don't come with a manual. You'll be involved in real consulting work from day one.



We're a US-based international tax firm. Small, selective, high-trust. We don't do volume. Every client engagement is substantive.



**What You'll Do**

Work alongside the partner on all matters he's facing: research, analysis, client communication, IRS correspondence, case strategy, "special projects."



Over time, you'll own significant parts of client relationships and engagements. This is a role where your ceiling is defined by your ability. Lots of upside.



**Who We're Looking For**

We're looking for someone exceptional. Not "strong." Exceptional.



**You should apply if**

    You hold a US CPA, EA, or equivalent qualification, or you don't yet, but you'd consider acquiring it within one year

    You have a real grasp of US tax concepts

    Your instinct when you hit something ambiguous is to reason through it, make a call, and move forward

    Your written English is genuinely excellent. Client-facing excellent.

    You've worked in a professional services environment and understand what "high standards" actually means in practice





**You should not apply if**

    You're looking for a stable, predictable tax prep role

    You want to be told what to do

    You're a fast learner who hasn't yet done the work



**Compensation**

Significantly above market. We'd rather pay for someone exceptional than manage someone adequate.



The Process

Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid assignment (1.25 hours, compensated at $50 USD).



**To Apply**

Send your resume and a note of no more than 5 sentences answering: What's the most complex tax or professional problem you've solved independently, and how did you solve it?



Send to:

• Previous cold calling or appointment setting experience (minimum 1 year)

• Comfortable calling Australian business owners

• Reliable internet connection and a quality headset

• Self-motivated and able to work independently

• Knowledge of SEO or digital marketing is a PLUS but not required

Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM AEST (Australian Eastern Standard Time)



???? COMPENSATION

• Long-term opportunity for the right candidate

 Base pay: $4–$6 USD per hour (depending on experience)

• Bonus: $35 USD per Converted appointment

title: Executive Tech Job Search Research Assistant
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

I am a senior B2B Enterprise Account Executive conducting a targeted job search for fully remote roles in AI, infrastructure, DevTools, data, and related tech sectors. I am seeking a detail-oriented research assistant to support sourcing, qualification, and tracking of high-fit opportunities.

This is not a mass-application role. Quality and alignment matter more than volume.

Responsibilities:

• Identify 15–20 fully remote Enterprise AE roles per week

• Confirm minimum base salary of $150K+

I will handle overall strategy, positioning, and final application submission. Your role is research, filtering, and organization.

Ideal Candidate:

• Experience in tech recruiting, sourcing, or recruitment research

• Strong LinkedIn and Boolean search skills

• Excellent written English

• Ability to assess funding stage and company credibility

• Detail-oriented and responsive

This will begin as a 1–2 week engagement with potential extension.

title: Executive VA with GHL background!
description:
# Executive Virtual Assistant (GoHighLevel Experience Required)

---



## About Us



We are a growing [physical therapy / chiropractic] clinic dedicated to delivering exceptional patient care while scaling our business operations. We use modern systems and automation to run a tight, efficient practice — and we need the right person to help us keep that 
ntum going.



## The Role



We're looking for a sharp, dependable **Executive Virtual Assistant** who will work directly alongside the Clinic Owner on a daily basis. This isn't your typical VA role — you'll be involved in the day-to-day operations of a fast-growing healthcare practice, managing key systems, and helping keep everything running smoothly behind the scenes.



If you're someone who thrives under pressure, takes ownership of tasks without being micromanaged, and wants to grow alongside a company that's scaling — this is your opportunity.



## What You'll Be Doing



- Managing the Owner's calendar, inbox, and daily priorities

- Building and managing workflows, automations, and campaigns inside **GoHighLevel (GHL)**

- Coordinating tasks across the front desk, marketing, and operations

- Organizing and maintaining SOPs, project trackers, and internal documentation

- Handling patient inquiry follow-ups, appointment reminders, and reactivation campaigns

- Tracking KPIs, pulling reports, and keeping leadership informed on key metrics (new patients, show rates, revenue, etc.)

- Anticipating needs and solving problems before they become issues

- Supporting marketing campaigns, promotions, and community outreach efforts



## What We're Looking For



**Must-Haves:**

- Proven experience with **GoHighLevel** (workflows, pipelines, automations, campaigns)

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail

- Critical thinker who can problem-solve independently

- Ability to perform under pressure and manage competing priorities

- Excellent written and verbal English communication

- Trustworthy, reliable, and committed — this role requires discretion and accountability

- Experience working directly with a business owner or executive-level leader



**Nice-to-Haves:**

- Familiarity with Notion, Slack, Google Workspace, or other project management tools

- Background in healthcare, wellness, or service-based businesses

- Experience managing teams or coordinating between departments

- Basic understanding of sales funnels, CRM management, and lead tracking

- Knowledge of HIPAA-compliant communication practices



## Why This Role Is Different



You won't be buried in busywork. You'll be the Owner's right hand — involved in real operations, real growth, and real decisions. As the clinic scales, this role scales with you. There is a clear path to a leadership position for the right person.



## How to Apply



Send your application with:



1. **Your resume** highlighting relevant VA and GHL experience

2. **A short Loom video (2–3 minutes)** introducing yourself and walking us through one GHL workflow or automation you've built

3. **Answer this question in your cover letter:** "Tell us about a time you had to manage a high-pressure situation with multiple priorities. What did you do and what was the result?"



Applications without a Loom video will not be considered.



We're moving fast — if this sounds like you, don't wait.

title: Hiring: Growth Systems & Media Buying Architect (Web, Funnels, Automations & Paid Traffic) — Home Improvement
description:
Hiring: Funnel & Automation Architect (Performance-Weighted, Long-Term)

???? Remote | 30-Day Trial | Ongoing Upside



We’re hiring a Funnel & Automation Architect to design, build, and own our lead-to-appointment infrastructure end-to-end.



This is not a graphic design role.

This is not a basic VA position.



This role is for someone who understands conversion systems as a revenue engine—funnels, booking, SMS automation, tracking, and quality control—and wants performance-based upside tied to real outcomes.



?



???? What You’ll Own (End-to-End)



Funnel & Website Systems

 • Build mobile-first booking funnels (custom builds, not cookie-cutter templates)

 • Create clean, conversion-focused landing pages

 • Optimize for speed, clarity, and booked appointments

 • Platforms may include GoHighLevel, Webflow, or WordPress (conversion > aesthetics)



Automation & Lead Flow

 • Architect and deploy:

 • SMS booking confirmations

 • Appointment reminders

 • Missed-appointment follow-ups

 • Ensure airtight flow from:

Ad ? Funnel ? Booking ? CRM ? Follow-Up



Tracking & Attribution

 • Meta pixel setup & validation

 • Accurate booking and conversion events

 • Clear analytics visibility (no black boxes, no guessing)



SEO & Web Presence Continuity

 • Funnels must not damage SEO

 • Maintain on-page SEO integrity

 • Align website, funnels, and Google Business Profile

 • Support both organic traffic and paid media



Documentation & Scale

 • Document systems so they can be maintained

 • Build once, then optimize—not rebuild endlessly



?



???? Compensation Structure (Read Carefully)



This is a performance-weighted role with guaranteed base + uncapped upside.



Base Pay

 • $250/week (guaranteed)



Performance Incentive

 • $25 per qualified, attended appointment 



++ Milestone Bonuses++



A qualified sit means:

 • Appointment is attended (not canceled / no-show)

 • Prospect meets qualification criteria (homeowner, service area, intent)

 • Booking originates from funnels or automations you built or maintain



???? No caps on upside, subject to quality controls.



?



???? Quality Guardrails (Non-Negotiable)



Incentives pause if:

 • No-show rate exceeds 30%

 • Unqualified appointments exceed 20%

 • Performance reviewed weekly

 • Incentives paid bi-weekly



We optimize for quality revenue, not junk volume.



?



? Who This Is For

 • Builders who think in systems, flows, and leverage

 • Operators who care about conversion math, not vanity metrics

 • Architects who want ownership + upside, not hourly micromanagement



? Who This Is Not For

 • Template flippers

 • “Set it and forget it” VAs

 • Designers who don’t understand lead economics



?



???? To Apply:

Comment “ARCHITECT” or DM with:

 • Platforms you’ve built funnels in

 • One example of a system you owned end-to-end

 • How you think about reducing no-shows and improving show rates



We’re building long-term infrastructure.

If you want short-term gigs, this isn’t it.

title: Sales Analyst (FMCG experience desired)
description:
Sales Admin Analyst.



Premium Australian BPO is seeking an experienced Sales Admin Analyst for our client, a global Fast-Moving-Consumer-Goods (FMCG) company specializing in personal care products and brands.



This Full-Time role offers the flexibility of Working-From-Home (WFH) during AUS business hours. Also offering a market leading salary package- including paid leave and bonuses. Join this global FMCG company, as a key player on their AUS and NZ sales teams.



This role represents an incredible opportunity for both professional and personal growth and to fast-track your career on a global stage.





****Key Responsibilities Include****



* Supporting the National Business Manager (NBM) with key data administrative tasks.

* Inputting key data into Trade Promotion Management (TPM) systems- specifically, Promax- ensuring data integrity and accuracy.

* Accurate transfer of data from various sources into TPM/Promax systems.

* Maintenance of baselines, promotions, pricing, forecasts and ensuring data integrity- what is loaded in Promax matches what is loaded in customer portals / promotional advice forms.

* Providing key insights on data.

* Identifying issues/discrepancies with data.

* Reviewing forecast accuracy versus business plans.

* Attending Pre S&OP Forecast meetings to take action notes and reflect actions/changes in Promax.

* Assisting with data Audit requirements. Data matching from various sources.

* Complete promotional reconciliation weekly or as required (Scan promotions vs accrued Scan monies) and provide written feedback on if the promotion met expectations, was below or above expectations.

* Help prepare comprehensive sales data reports in Excel. Weekly & Monthly Sales Reports categorized by SKU, account, and area, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

* Using Excel for data entry and data analysis. Pivot Tables, V Lookups, Sum & Average.





****Key Requirements MUST HAVES include****



* Strong background in sales and strong understanding of key sales principles. Including maintenance of baselines, promotions, pricing and forecast.

* Expertise in Excel. Advanced functions including Pivot Tables, V Lookups, Sum & Average.

* Excellent communication and comprehension skills.

* Highest level of proficiency in English, both written and verbal.

* Ability to work as part of a cross functional team.

* Meticulous attention to detail.

* Highly Analytical- able to interpret data, provide some analysis and data-driven recommendations.

* Highly organized- able to juggle multiple tasks, meeting timelines and deadlines.

* Attentive, communicative, analytical and energetic. A problem-solver who can work independently and as part of a dynamic team.



****IDEAL candidates have****



* At least 2 years proven previous experience within the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) industry.

*Have experience with Trade Promotion Management Systems (TPM) such as Promax, SAP or Oracle.

* Have experience with Trade Promotion Optimization Tools (TPO).

* Have a degree/background in Business Administration, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Accounting or a related field.



****You Will Be Provided With****

*Comprehensive training in Promax (TPM) and (TPO).

*A work laptop.



****You Will Be Responsible for Providing****

*A monitor

*Fast and Reliable Internet.

*Back-up Internet options

*Back-up Power options.

*Having a designation WFH space- free from distraction.





Please write a short cover letter detailing your relevant experience and skillset. You MUST include your CV as part of your application.

title: Legal Intake Specialist
description:
About Us:

Very Decent Marketer partners with leading personal injury law firms to help individuals who have recently experienced an injury find the legal support they need. As the first point of contact for prospective clients, our role is more than just fielding phone calls - we’re providing a compassionate and reassuring presence during a difficult time. We’re passionate about delivering excellent service, fostering meaningful connections, and ultimately guiding people toward the legal help they deserve.



Position Overview:

As a Legal Intake Specialist, you will be at the forefront of our client outreach efforts. Your primary responsibility is to engage with individuals who have suffered injuries and are exploring their legal options. Through a combination of active listening, empathy, and clear communication, you’ll help them understand how our partner law firms can assist. While empathy and emotional intelligence are crucial in this role, you will also need the confidence and energy to “sell” our services. Your goal is to create a positive first impression, instill trust, and help prospective clients take the next step toward securing legal representation.



Key Responsibilities:



Client Outreach & Communication:

*Speak directly with prospective clients over the phone, listening carefully to their stories and gathering essential information about their case.

*Engage with prospective clients through various written communication channels, including live chat, direct messages on social media platforms, and text messages, ensuring empathy, professionalism, and clear guidance at all times.

*Convey compassion, understanding, and professionalism at all times.



Emotional Support & Guidance:

*Recognize that callers may be in pain, experiencing stress, or feeling vulnerable. Respond with warmth, patience, and reassurance.

*Offer clear guidance on next steps and help them feel confident in their decision to seek legal representation.



Qualifying Leads & Intake Management:

*Assess each caller’s case eligibility based on provided criteria.

*Ask targeted questions to confirm key details and ensure that their legal needs align with our partner firms’ areas of expertise.



Persuasive Communication:

*While maintaining empathy and integrity, use your communication skills to emphasize the value and benefits of securing legal representation through our network.

*Confidently “sell” the advantages of working with our partner law firms, keeping the client’s best interests at heart.



Accurate Documentation:

*Input call details, case summaries, and other pertinent information into our intake management system with a high level of accuracy.

*Maintain organized and up-to-date client records.



Qualifications & Skills:

*Fluent in English with no detectable accent.

*Remote Work Requirements: You own a computer and headset. Ability to maintain a dedicated, quiet, and distraction-free workspace suitable for extended phone conversations, along with a reliable, high-speed internet connection to ensure clear, uninterrupted communication.

*Empathy & Emotional Intelligence: You’re naturally empathetic, genuinely care about others, and can adapt your tone and approach to different emotional states.

*Strong Listening & Communication Skills: You have a knack for making people feel heard, understood, and comfortable. Your voice is calm, reassuring, and confident.

*Persuasive & Results-Oriented: You’re a persuasive communicator who can highlight the advantages of our services and motivate prospective clients to move forward.

*Telephone Experience: You’re comfortable and confident spending the majority of your day on the phone.

*Attention to Detail: You document information accurately and thoroughly, ensuring our partner law firms have all they need to provide top-quality legal support.

*Adaptability & Resilience: You stay focused and effective even when conversations are challenging. You’re able to handle rejection or caller hesitation gracefully.

*Integrity & Professionalism: You represent our company and our partner firms with the utmost professionalism, honesty, and discretion.



PLEASE INCLUDE WITH YOUR APPLICATION: 

A voice recording of you reading the following message - "Hi, my name is [Name]. I am interested in the position of Legal Intake Specialist. I have a computer, a fast internet connection, and as you can hear in this message, I speak English very clearly. I hope to hear from you soon"

title: Time Doctor Admin
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Time Doctor Administrator to manage and monitor our team’s time-tracking activities. The ideal candidate must have hands-on experience using Time Doctor and a strong ability to analyze data, identify discrepancies, and support HR, Finance, and Operations in maintaining accurate and compliant records.



You will ensure that productivity data is reliable, reports are accurate, and company time-tracking policies are followed.



Application Criteria



We’re looking for candidates who have:



Proven experience managing Time Doctor (required) or similar time-tracking tools.

Experience in administrative, reporting, or time-management roles.

Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.

Proficiency in Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, etc.) for data validation and analysis.

Ability to handle confidential data with discretion.

Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate with multiple teams.



Key Responsibilities



Time Doctor Management & Reporting



Generate, review, and validate daily, weekly, and monthly Time Doctor reports.

Ensure accurate logged hours, activity levels, and task tracking data.

Identify and escalate discrepancies, irregularities, and missing/incorrect entries.



Compliance & Monitoring



Monitor contractor attendance and ensure adherence to time-tracking policies.

Flag unapproved manual entries, idle time, or unusual activity.

Maintain proper documentation for adjustments, corrections, and exceptions.



Data Analysis & Productivity Insights



Summarize productivity data and provide insights to HR, managers, and leadership.

Track trends in time usage, activity rates, and project allocations.

Support process improvement and resource optimization initiatives.



Coordination & Support



Serve as the primary contact for Time Doctor issues and report inquiries.

Coordinate with HR, Finance, and Operations to support accurate payroll and invoicing.

Clearly communicate findings and recommend actions when needed.



Benefits:



80-120 Hours of PTO

10-11 Paid Holidays

13th Month Payroll

Paid Philippine HMO plan

Paid Social Security System

Paid Philippine Health

Paid training

Advancement after Proof of Mastery

Performance Goals with advancement compensation

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent



Benefits:



Health insurance

Work from home



Application Question(s):



How many years of work experience do you have managing the Time Doctor software?



Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Support Specialist (Open to Fresh Graduates)
description:
**FRESH GRADUATES WITH A DEGREE IN IT, COMPUTER SCIENCE, OR RELATED FIELDS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY.**



About the position:

We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Technical Support Specialist to join a remote team. This role involves responding to inbound support inquiries, assisting with troubleshooting, and providing clear, accurate guidance to users.



The successful candidate demonstrates strong communication skills, sound judgment, and a commitment to delivering high-quality support.



Responsibilities:

• Monitor and respond to inbound support inquiries in a timely and professional manner

• Troubleshoot basic to intermediate technical concerns and provide appropriate solutions

• Create, update, and manage support tickets using a tracking system

• Escalate unresolved or complex issues when necessary and ensure proper follow-up

• Assess user concerns to deliver relevant and context-aware assistance

• Coordinate with tea
mbers to maintain service quality and consistency

• Document recurring issues and solutions to support process improvement



Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field

• Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply

• Strong English communication skills (verbal, written, and reading)

• Technical proficiency in CSS, HTML, JavaScript, or other programming languages

• Foundational knowledge of technical concepts and troubleshooting methodologies

• Willingness to learn new tools, systems, and processes

• Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills

• Professional demeanor with a customer-focused approach

• Ability to work independently while contributing effectively within a remote team



Work Schedule:

• This is a full-time position in a work-from-home setup. You will be working 8 hours a day, 5 days a week.



TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:



1. Include the phrase "TECHNICAL" in your Subject

2. Send a Cover Letter with a link to your CV/Resume



***APPLICATIONS WITHOUT CVS/RESUMES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Dispatcher
description:
WE'RE HIRING FOR A DISPATCHER

Full-Time | Remote



Are you calm under pressure, highly organized, and comfortable coordinating people and moving parts all day?

If you’re responsive, detail-oriented, and know how to keep operations running smoothly, this Dispatcher role might be the right fit for you.



?



What You Will Do

• Coordinate and dispatch loads to drivers throughout the day

• Communicate clearly with drivers, brokers, and internal tea
mbers

• Monitor routes and provide timely updates as needed

• Resolve issues related to delays, breakdowns, or scheduling conflicts

• Maintain accurate records of loads, routes, and communications

• Ensure daily operations follow company procedures and transportation regulations



?



Who You Are

• Available to work 6:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST (availability during this window is required)

• Fluent in written and spoken English

• Highly organized with strong problem-solving skills

• Able to stay responsive, professional, and calm under pressure

• Solid understanding of U.S. geography and major freight lanes

• Prior experience as a truck driver or diesel mechanic is a plus

• Strong and reliable internet connection



To apply, send your resume along with answers to the questions below. To be considered, please ensure all questions are fully answered.



1)  Have you previously worked in dispatching, logistics coordination, or operations scheduling? Describe your responsibilities and the type of team or drivers you supported.

2) Have you ever coordinated drivers, couriers, technicians, or any field-based teams? If yes, briefly describe your role.

3) Give an actual example when plans changed unexpectedly (delay, schedule issue, client request, etc.). How did you handle it?

4) If a driver reports a delay that may impact delivery time, what would be your first three actions?

5) Share a time you had to manage multiple conversations or urgent requests at once (ex. drivers, clients, or internal teams). What did you do to keep everything on track and avoid mistakes?

6) How familiar are you with U.S. geography or routing tools (Google Maps, dispatch software, load boards, etc.)?

7) Fully comfortable with US CST hours (6am-6pm)? Can you confirm you are comfortable staying online and responsive during this window even if activity varies?

title: Meta Ad Creative Specialist (Reels & Video) – Experienced Only
description:
We are a fast-growing global children’s wellness brand seeking an experienced Meta Ad Creative Specialist focused primarily on creating high-converting ads and Reels.



This role is creative-first. We are looking for someone who understands what makes people stop scrolling and can consistently produce performance-driven ad creatives.



About Us

We are an established e-commerce brand in the children’s mindfulness and wellness space, selling across the USA, Australia, and the UK. We actively test creatives and scale winning ads.



Your Responsibilities



• Create high-converting Meta ad creatives (Reels, short-form video, and static ads)

• Produce multiple hook variations for testing

• Edit engaging vertical video content designed specifically for paid traffic

• Turn raw footage, UGC, or product content into scroll-stopping ads

• Refresh and iterate winning creatives

• Upload creatives into Meta Ads Manager and support campaign launches



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



• Proven experience creating Meta ads and Reels that convert

• Strong understanding of direct-response marketing and hook writing

• Experience creating ads specifically for paid traffic (not just organic content)

• Ability to produce multiple variations quickly

• Experience working with e-commerce brands

• Must provide a portfolio of previous ad creatives

• Must include examples of ads that have performed well



Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Ideal Candidate



• Deep understanding of what makes a strong opening hook

• Knows how to structure short-form video for conversions

• Can balance creativity with performance

• Self-starter who works independently

• Long-term mindset and performance-driven



To Apply
 
 cc' 



Please include:



A link to your portfolio (Canva, Google Drive or website)



Attach 3–5 examples of Meta ads or Reels you have created



A short explanation of what makes a high-converting Reel ad



Your availability (hours per week)



Subject line: Meta Ad Creative Specialist – [Your Name]



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber if the fit is right.



Jacqueline 

Mindful & Co Kids

title: Video Editor For Ecommerce Agency
description:
We're a fast-growing e-commerce agency in year 7 that helps brands scale through high-converting UGC and paid social content. We need another Video Editor who can keep up with the pace and bring fresh ideas every single day.



Why You'll Love This Job:



- Work on content for multiple exciting e-commerce brands across different niches

- Creative freedom to execute your own ad concepts, not just follow briefs

- Clear systems and briefs to keep your workflow organized and efficient

- Long-term role with real room to grow as the agency scales



What You'll Do:



- Complete 2-3 video edits per day across UGC and Meta ad formats

- Execute creative briefs with fast turnaround and strong attention to detail

- Develop your own ad concepts and bring creative ideas to the team

- Add captions, transitions, and hooks that stop the scroll

- QA your own work before submission (typos, pacing, formatting, all of it)

- Collaborate with the creative strategy team to continuously improve performance



Who We're Looking For:



- Experienced in video editing for Meta, TikTok, or UGC content (1+ year minimum)

- Fast, reliable, and able to hit a consistent daily output

- Strong creative instincts with an eye for what performs in e-commerce

- Detail-oriented and self-managing

- Great written English communication skills

- E-commerce or DTC background is a strong advantage



Hours & Location:



- Remote

- Full-time (~40 hours/week)

- Must be available during North American business hours for team communication



Looking forward to meeting you!

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Vacation Rental Admin
description:
Overview



We are a growing short-term rental and co-hosting business managing a portfolio of 6–7 vacation rental properties across multiple markets. Our focus is delivering an exceptional guest experience through strong hospitality, efficient systems, and attention to detail.



We use a combination of automation tools and software platforms to streamline operations, and we are looking for a highly organized, proactive Virtual Assistant to help oversee daily operations, support guest communication, and maintain backend systems.



Work Schedule



Full-Time (40 hours/week)



U.S. Hours: 1:00 PM – 10:00 PM PST



Key Responsibilities

Operations & Guest Management

Manage guest communication across multiple booking platforms

Respond to guest inquiries and issues professionally and promptly

Use messaging templates and personalize when needed

Coordinate with vendors for maintenance or guest-related issues

Schedule and confirm cleaners for turnovers

Track and ensure all turnovers are completed properly

Administrative & Organizational Support

Calendar management across multiple businesses

 inbox management and organization

Organize and maintain Google Drive across multiple entities

Upload and organize receipts and expense documentation

Assist with bookkeeping support (data entry, tracking revenue/expenses)

Monitor and verify revenue and payouts

Systems & Process Improvement

Create, document, and improve SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

Track workflows and ensure systems (PMS, automation tools) are functioning properly

Identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements

Business Support Tasks

Purchase supplies for properties as needed

Conduct vendor research to find better pricing and services

Assist with social media (posting property photos, basic content)

Support
 marketing campaigns

Compare insurance policies (apples-to-apples analysis)

Track and flag specific timeframes for insurance renewals

Ad Hoc Tasks

Handle miscellaneous operational and administrative tasks as needed

Support new property onboarding or setup

Required Skills & Qualifications

Strong English communication (written and verbal)

High attention to detail and organization

Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively

Experience with short-term rentals, property management, or hospitality (preferred)

Familiarity with tools like PMS systems, Google Workspace, and task managers

Tech-savvy and able to learn new systems quickly

Reliable internet and work setup

To ensure you have carefully read this job post:

 Start your application message with the word “SUNSET.”

Applications without this will not be considered.

What We’re Looking For

We are looking for someone who:

Takes ownership and responsibility

Is proactive, not reactive

Can grow with the company into a larger operations role

Cares about delivering a great guest experience



Growth Opportunity

This role has the potential to grow into a full operations management position as the business expands.

title: Senior Product Manager (AI BI Platform)
description:
About the Role



We’re building a state-of-the-art AI-powered BI and querying platform, and we’re looking for a Senior Product Manager to take full ownership of the product and drive it to the next level.



This role is responsible for shaping product strategy, defining and shipping new functionality, and ensuring our platform delivers real value to customers. You’ll work closely with engineering, data, and customers to translate needs into shipped features — and you’ll use AI tools as a core part of your workflow, not an afterthought.



This is a hands-on, high-ownership role for a PM who is comfortable making decisions, iterating quickly, and building in a fast-moving environment with live customers.



What You’ll Do

Product ownership & strategy

Own the product roadmap and day-to-day prioritization

Define what “great” looks like for an AI BI platform and drive execution toward it

Balance customer needs, technical constraints, and long-term vision



Customer-driven development

Engage directly with customers to understand workflows, pain points, and edge cases

Translate customer feedback into clear product requirements and iterations

Support existing customers while building net-new functionality



AI-native product development

Use AI platforms and tools to prototype, test, and refine product ideas

Leverage AI-assisted tools to accelerate PRDs, UX iterations, and analysis

Think critically about how AI should (and should not) be used in customer-facing features



Cross-functional execution

Partner closely with engineering to scope, ship, and iterate on features

Work with data and analytics to define metrics and evaluate product performance

Ensure clarity of requirements, acceptance criteria, and success metrics



Shipping & iteration

Drive features from concept to launch to iteration

Monitor usage, performance, and customer feedback post-launch

Make informed tradeoffs and adjustments based on real-world results



What We’re Looking For



Core experience

5+ years of experience in product management, ideally for data, analytics, or SaaS platforms

Proven ownership of a product or major product area from idea through launch and iteration

Strong ability to translate ambiguous problems into actionable plans

Experience working closely with engineers on technically complex products

Comfort making decisions with incomplete information



AI & modern tooling (key requirement)

Strong experience using AI platforms and tools such as:

AI-assisted coding, prototyping, or workflow tools

LLM-based tools for analysis, ideation, and iteration



Ability to evaluate AI outputs critically and apply them responsibly in production products



Nice to have

Experience with BI, analytics, or data platforms

Exposure to AI-powered or ML-driven products

Familiarity with SQL, data models, or analytics concepts (hands-on not required)

Startup or small-team experience with high ownership

Technical background or strong technical intuition



What Success Looks Like

Customers see clear, continuous improvement in the platform

Features ship quickly and solve real problems

The product roadmap reflects both customer needs and long-term vision

Engineering execution is aligned and efficient

AI capabilities are used thoughtfully and meaningfully, not as gimmicks



Why This Role

Full ownership of a core product in an AI-first company

Direct influence on customer experience and company direction

Opportunity to shape how AI is applied to real-world BI workflows

Work in a small, empowered team where decisions turn into shipped product
