title: Executive Assistant
description:
WE’RE HIRING: Executive Assistant

Full Time | Remote | US Hours



Are you a highly seasoned Executive Assistant who thrives in organized chaos and knows how to support a high-visibility CEO with calm authority?

If you’re discreet, proactive, and able to manage both professional and personal priorities without constant direction, this role might be the right fit for you.



What You Will Do

• Manage the CEO’s inbox, calendar, scheduling, and meeting preparation

• Act as a trusted gatekeeper with internal teams and external contacts

• Coordinate complex travel plans, including last-minute changes

• Track deadlines, commitments, and follow-ups to ensure nothing is missed

• Support personal logistics such as appointments, reminders, and important dates

• Assist with projects, publishing initiatives, and one-off executive priorities

• Coordinate across departments, including operations, finance, and creative teams



Who You Are

• 7+ years of experience supporting senior executives, founders, or public-facing leaders

• Highly professional, discreet, and calm under pressure

• Strong judgment with the confidence to push back diplomatically when needed

• Proactive, solutions-oriented, and able to anticipate needs

• Comfortable managing both personal and professional domains seamlessly

• Highly responsive and dependable, with flexibility outside standard business hours

• Experienced working remotely and staying aligned across time zones



To apply, send your resume along with answers to the questions below. To be considered, please ensure all questions are answered in full.

1. Walk me through a day where everything felt urgent. How did you d
 what actually got the CEO’s attention first?

2. How do you d
 when to act independently versus when to loop the CEO in?

3. Tell me about a time you had to push back on someone requesting the CEO’s time. What did you say and why?

4. What information do you automatically treat as non-shareable, even internally? Can you give an example?

5. Describe a last-minute change — travel, schedule, or event — and what you did first.

title: SEO Strategist
description:
*KINDLY READ THE JOB DESCRIPTION & THE APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY.*



EJF is a property management company headquartered in Washington, DC. We are looking for ROCK STAR SEO STRATEGIST for our growing team. A successful candidate will enjoy solving problems, is responsible, organized, detail oriented, and reliable.



Job purpose: 



We are seeking a Senior SEO Lead based in the Philippines to support and scale the organic search strategy across our portfolio of property management brands. This is a full-time role reporting to the Marketing Director and focused on driving structured, measurable organic growth. 



This position will be responsible for developing the SEO roadmap, identifying high-impact opportunities, and creating scalable frameworks that enable our internal team and VAs to execute effectively. 



This is a strategic role with hands-on technical depth, operating in partnership with Marketing, Business Development, and Operations to influence lead generation and brand visibility. 



The SEO Lead will serve as the primary subject matter expert for organic search while collaborating cross-functionally to align SEO initiatives with broader business goals.



Duties and responsibilities:

1. Centralized SEO Strategy & Leadership 



• Develop and maintain a unified SEO roadmap across all brands and domains, aligned with Marketing and Business Development priorities. 

• Prioritize initiatives based on projected traffic value, qualified lead potential, and strategic growth impact which will translate to long term ROI and revenue impact. 

• Translate business goals into scalable search strategies 

• Advise the Marketing Director on: 

o Competitive landscape shifts 

o Algorithm updates and SERP changes 

o Emerging search opportunities 

• Lead quarterly SEO planning and performance reviews, presenting insights, opportunities, and recommended actions to Marketing leadership. 



2. Technical SEO Ownership (In Collaboration with IT and Web Development) 



• Monitor site health across all properties and proactively lead implementation of technical SEO improvements in coordination with IT and web development teams. 

• Oversee: 

o Core Web Vitals & performance optimization 

o Crawlability, indexation, and site architecture 

o Schema markup and structured data strategy 

o Technical audits and remediation plans 

• Run regular technical crawls and monitoring using: 

o Screaming Frog 

o Google Search Console 

o GA4 

o PageSpeed Insights / Lighthouse 

 

3. Content Engine Leadership (Scaling with VAs) 



• Design and implement SEO content frameworks, standards, and quality control systems that enable the existing VA team to execute effectively at scale. 

• Build and document: 

o Content frameworks 

o On-page SEO standards 

o Internal linking strategies 

o Topic clustering and content hierarchy 

• Audit and optimize content output for: 

o Search intent alignment 

o SERP competitiveness 

o Topical authority 

o Provide structured training guidance and ongoing QA review to ensure SEO best practices are consistently applied across VA-produced content 

• Use tools such as: 

o Ahrefs 

o SEMrush 

o Surfer SEO / Clearscope 

 

4. Local SEO Dominance 



• Lead strategy for Google Business Profiles across all regions. 

• Develop and execute strategies to improve Map Pack visibility in key property management markets. 

• Manage: 

o GBP optimization 

o Review strategy 

o Local citations and NAP consistency 

o Local landing page structure and implementation in coordination with IT/web development as needed. 

• Utilize tools such as: 

o BrightLocal / Whitespark 

o Google Business Profile Manager 

 

5. Analytics, Attribution & Conversion Insights 



• Analyze and report on SEO performance in relation to business outcomes. 

• Track and report on: 

o Organic leads and conversion paths 

o Call tracking and attribution (CallRail) 

o SEO-influenced revenue reporting in collaboration with Marketing and Business Development (HubSpot attribution). 

• Use behavioral insights tools (Hotjar / Microsoft Clarity) to inform UX and CRO improvements 

• Develop dashboards and executive-level reporting that provide clear visibility into SEO performance, trends, and optimization opportunities. 

 





Qualifications:

Experience

• 5–8 years of hands-on SEO experience.

• Proven success in technical SEO, content SEO, and local SEO. 

• Experience collaborating with or influencing cross-functional stakeholders. 

• Experience designing and executing SEO programs - not just completing tasks.





Job Skills:

Technical & Tool Proficiency



Strong working knowledge of:

• Ahrefs

• SEMrush

• Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

• Google Search Console (GSC)

• Screaming Frog SEO Spider

• PageSpeed Insights / Lighthouse

• BrightLocal or Whitespark

• Google Business Profile Manager

• Surfer SEO or Clearscope

• CallRail

• HubSpot SEO attribution

• Hotjar or Microsoft Clarity



Working conditions:

• Remote ready.

• Able to work EST hours.

• Comfortable working with a time tracking system (Hubstaff).



How to apply:



1. Please check out the company website before submitting an application: 
.

2. Send an
 attachment with your updated resume in PDF format.

3. Please indicate your rate.

4. Please send a link to your video recording introducing yourself & your relevant experience based on the job description, and include your OnlineJobs.PH profile link.



Kindly send your application to 
 the subject line, kindly indicate the position SEO Strategist - your name.



*Applicants who will apply through onlinejobs.ph will not be considered.

*Shortlisted applicants will be contacted by
 for interview scheduling.

Looking forward to working with you!

title: WordPress developer
description:
Overview

We are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented WordPress Developer who doesn't just build pages but understands how to make them rank and convert. Your primary goal will be to bridge the gap between technical development, user experience (UX), and search engine performance.



You will be responsible for maintaining our site’s health, improving Core Web Vitals, and turning Google Search Console (GSC) data into actionable site improvements.



Key Responsibilities

Performance & SEO: Audit and improve site speed, mobile responsiveness, and Core Web Vitals to ensure a "Green" status in GSC.



Google Search Console Management: Regularly monitor GSC for crawl errors, indexing issues, and manual actions. You will be expected to fix 404s, schema markup errors, and usability issues.



UX & Conversion: Implement UI/UX tweaks to reduce bounce rates and improve the user journey.



Technical SEO: Manage on-page elements including 
 (JSON-LD) implementation, XML sitemaps, and robots.txt optimization.



WordPress Maintenance: Handle theme/plugin updates, security hardening, and troubleshooting "white screen" or database errors.



Required Skills & Qualifications

WordPress Mastery: Deep experience with PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript within the WordPress ecosystem.



SEO Tools: High proficiency in Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and SEO plugins (RankMath, Yoast, or SEOPress).



UX Principles: Ability to identify "friction points" on a page and redesign elements for better flow.



Core Web Vitals: Proven track record of optimizing LCP, FID, and CLS.



Attention to Detail: You must be someone who notices a 2px misalignment or a missing meta description.





How to Apply (The "Secret Word" Test)

To prove you have read this entire post and have high attention to detail, please follow these instructions:



Subject line must be: "WP Developer for [Your Company Name] - [Your Favorite Fruit]"



Include a link to your portfolio or 3 live websites you have significantly optimized for SEO/Speed.



Briefly describe one specific technical issue you found in Google Search Console and how you fixed it.

title: Paid Social Media Buyer (Meta & TikTok) – High Volume
description:
Job Title: Performance Media Buyer & Creative Strategist – Beauty Sleep Club

Salary: $1,500 month (Full-Time)

Location: Remote (Philippines Preferred)

Website: 

The Mission

Your goal is to scale Beauty Sleep Club’s customer acquisition engine profitably. You will manage high-volume spends across Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, and Pinterest. We are not looking for someone to "manage" ads; we want someone to pioneer them. You must be obsessed with data and even more obsessed with high-velocity creative testing.

Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Creative Velocity: Successfully launch and test 100+ new creatives per week across all platforms.

Efficiency: Maintain and lower the target CAC (Cost Per Acquisition) even as daily spend increases.

Strategic Growth: Devise and test 10 new creative concepts per week based on market trends and competitor analysis.

Reporting: Deliver a comprehensive weekly report highlighting best-performing ads, spend distribution, and actionable creative insights.

Core Responsibilities

Full-Funnel Management: Architect and optimize campaign structures on Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, and Pinterest.

Creative Feedback Loop: Identify winning "hooks" and "angles" and report them directly to the design and video teams for rapid iteration.

Competitor Intelligence: Conduct deep-dive research into competitor ads to extract successful patterns for us to model and improve upon.

Trend Spotting: Stay ahead of social media trends and "viral" ad formats, translating them into creative concepts for Beauty Sleep Club.

Campaign Optimization: Manage daily bidding, budget scaling, and audience testing to ensure maximum ROI on every dollar spent.

Technical Skills Required

Cross-Platform Mastery: Proven track record of scaling spend on Meta and TikTok (Snapchat/Pinterest experience is a massive plus).

Data Fluency: Deep understanding of e-commerce metrics (ROAS, MER, nCAC, LTV, and Thumb-stop rates).

AI Tool Integration: Proficiency in using AI tools to analyze data and assist in creative conceptualization.

Creative Eye: The ability to look at a video and understand why it is or isn't converting.



How to Apply

Please send a message with the subject line "Scale the Sleep Club" and include:

A screenshot or case study of an ad account you scaled from $10k/month to $100k+/month spend.

Your "formula" for a high-converting Meta ad hook in the beauty/wellness space.

A description of how you manage the testing of 100+ creatives without "breaking" the algorithm.

title: AI Operations Lead & Executive Assistant (Real Estate Systems)
description:
Note: This position was previously posted and has been substantially revised to better reflect the direction of the business and the level of thinking required for the role. If you applied before, please read this version carefully before reapplying.



EARLY-STAGE ROLE WITH LONG-TERM GROWTH: Join a purpose-driven real estate company in its foundational phase. This is a unique opportunity to build systems, shape operations, and grow with the business from the ground up.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

I am a U.S.-based real estate investor building a purpose-driven housing company. Lotus Root Homes is in its early build phase. Some tasks may be exploratory or less structured as we create foundational systems.



I am looking for a SYSTEMS-FIRST operator – someone highly reliable, curious, and detail-oriented who can help me:

* Audit, document, and clean operational workflows

* Automate repetitive tasks

* Organize CRM and
 communications

* Build the company website

* Ensure follow-ups, deadlines, and operational loops are never missed



Responsibilities and compensation will grow based on your proven results and impact in expanding the business’s efficiency.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who enjoys building operational infrastructure and creating systems that allow the business – and its founder – to focus on growth.

----------------------------------------------------------------

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (SYSTEMS & AI FOCUS):



* AI Workflow Architecture: Identify bottlenecks and implement AI-driven solutions using tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, Zapier, or 
.



* CRM & Data Integrity: Own and maintain our CRM (HubSpot, Streak, or similar). Build processes to reduce manual entry and keep data clean and structured.



*
 Campaign Management: Plan and manage outreach campaigns. Automate sequences, track engagement, and manage follow-up needs so no opportunity is missed.



* Database & Lead Intelligence: Use AI tools to research, enrich, and organize property and partner data.



* Market Intelligence: Leverage Perplexity and other LLMs to research California rental regulations and market trends.



* SOP Engineering: Create and maintain a living library of Standard Operating Procedures so the business can scale efficiently.



* Website Support: Build and maintain the company’s basic website on SquareSpace, including structure, pages, and content setup.



------------------------------------------------------------------------

REAL ESTATE & ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:



* Coordinate property-related tasks using Furnished Finder, TurboTenant, Zillow, and Redfin.



* Manage executive
, calendars, and open loops to ensure nothing falls through the cracks.



------------------------------------------

REQUIRED SKILLS & MINDSET:



* Operator Mindset: Instinctively improves systems rather than simply executing assigned tasks.



* AI Fluency: Comfortable using structured prompting, research workflows, and automation tools.



* Real Estate Familiarity: Experience supporting U.S. rental properties (California context is a plus).



* Communication: Near-native American English proficiency with clear, professional correspondence.



* Attention to Detail: Follows instructions carefully and thinks logically through tasks.



* Initiative & Curiosity: Comfortable with ambiguity, asking clarifying questions, and contributes to foundational projects.



----------------------------------------------------

WORK SCHEDULE & COMPENSATION:



* Full-time: 40 hours per week.

* Overlap: Minimum 2 hours with PST (California) business hours.

* Rate: $6–$8 USD/hour, based on proven results and demonstrated ability to build systems and automate processes. 

* Growth: Responsibilities and compensation will increase as your work improves business efficiency.



---------------------------------------------

HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully):



To be considered, follow these instructions exactly. 



* Subject Line: AI Operator – [Your Favorite AI Tool]



* Include the following in your application:



   1. Research Tool Preference: What is your favorite AI tool for research (not writing), and why?



   2. Operator Example: Briefly explain why you consider yourself an “Operator” rather than just an assistant. Describe a task you noticed was repetitive, time-consuming, or inefficient – and how you redesigned or automated it to save time or improve results. Be specific about steps taken and measurable outcomes.



   3. Internet Speed and Backup Plan: A screenshot of your internet speed and your specific backup plan for power or internet outages.



Note: Following instructions carefully is part of the evaluation process. Applications that do not follow the subject line instructions or address all requested items will not be reviewed.

ssage logs and note them down for the team to use when creating content.

title: BUSINESS OPERATIONS ASSISTANT
description:
OPERATIONS ASSISTANT (LEAD GENERATION BUSINESS)



APPLICATION REQUIREMENT – READ FIRST



You MUST submit a custom video explaining:



• Why you are a good fit for this specific role

• Your experience handling client communication

• Your ability to manage live text-based interactions

• Your willingness to grow into an operations management role



No generic or repurposed videos will be considered.

Applications without a custom video will not be reviewed.



You must also submit your resume.



YOUR APPLICATION WILL NOT BE REVIEWED IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS.



JOB OVERVIEW



We are seeking a full-time Operations Assistant for a growing lead generation business. This is a long-term role designed to groom the right candidate into an Operations Management position.



The role begins with ownership of our business survey process and client interactions, and gradually expands into higher-level operational responsibilities.



This is not a temporary role. We are looking for long-term commitment, dedication, and full attention.



If you work multiple jobs and cannot be responsive and timely during assigned hours, you will be let go immediately.



POSITION STRUCTURE



-Part-time remote role with the opportunity to transition to full-time based on successful execution of responsibilities and demonstrated trust.

-4 hours per day part time; 8 hours per day full time

-Must work during U.S. EST business hours

-Off on all US holidays and Philippine holidays

-Communication via Slack



All tasks have structured SOPs and video training guides. You must be willing to watch, learn, and execute.



On-the-job learning is crucial. I will teach everything, but you must be coachable..



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES (Phase 1)



Own the business surveys process from start to finish



Communicate directly with clients via text-based system (live interactions required)



Follow up with clients completing surveys



Use templated responses when appropriate, but also draft customized responses depending on situation (NO AI)



Manage client expectations professionally



Handle sensitive client communications responsibly



Track interactions and workflows using Airtable and text software



Maintain professional, clear written English at all times



FUTURE RESPONSIBILITIES (Phase 2 – Growth Track)



Managing Google Business Profiles



Drafting client
s



Managing WordPress websites



Setting up and managing Twilio flows



Supporting internal operational systems



Assisting in process improvement and documentation



This position is being groomed toward operations management for the right candidate.



MUST-HAVES



Excellent written and verbal English (heavy emphasis on writing)



Professional, positive, solution-oriented mindset



Ability to manage live text conversations in real-time



Strong client management skills



High attention to detail



Willingness to watch training videos and follow SOPs precisely



Honest and trustworthy (you will handle sensitive business information)



Willing to provide a copy of national identification card



Self-disciplined and able to work independently



TOOLS (Experience Preferred, Not Required – We Will Train)



Airtable

Canva

AI prompting systems

Twilio

Google Workspace

WordPress



COMPENSATION & STRUCTURE



Part-Time to Full-time position

Trial period to assess performance and fit

Payment via Paypal

Long-term growth opportunity into Operations Management

Performance-based advancement



IMPORTANT NOTICE



This role requires:



• Live availability during assigned hours

• Full attention and dedication

• Strict adherence to training and SOPs

• No AI usage for client-facing communications



If you are juggling multiple jobs and cannot be responsive during working hours, do not apply.



We are a company that genuinely values and takes care of our people. You will be respected, supported, and invested in, but we also hold high expectations for performance, accountability, and professionalism. We offer performance bonuses and observe both U.S. and Philippine holidays.

title: Senior SEO Strategist
description:
Lil Shameless Plug is a 12-year-old, woman-owned marketing agency looking for a detail-driven, technically strong Senior SEO Strategist to support a small portfolio of active client accounts.



This is a part-time strategic execution role (approximately 40 hours per month).



This is not a Director-level, client-facing, independent strategist role.

The founder owns overall SEO direction and client communication.



You will:



Prepare priorities

Execute agreed strategy

Monitor site health

Make intelligent recommendations

Keep work visible and organized



If you love clean audits, smart prioritization, and structured implementation — but don’t need to be the loudest voice in the room — this role is for you.



What You’ll Be Responsible For:

Technical & On-Page Oversight

Monthly SEMrush audit review

Identifying crawl and indexing issues

Prioritizing technical fixes (not fixing everything blindly)

Managing internal linking structure

title: Amazon Seller Central Customer Support Specialist
description:
We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Amazon Seller Customer Support Representative to manage customer communications and protect account health across Amazon Seller Central and other e-commerce platforms. This role plays a critical part in maintaining strong seller performance metrics, ensuring fast response times, and delivering professional customer experiences.



The ideal candidate has direct experience supporting Amazon seller accounts, understands Amazon policies and escalation workflows, and is comfortable working independently. This position requires consistent daily coverage, including light but mandatory weekend and holiday check-ins to ensure timely responses and account protection.



Responsibilities:



Customer Communication & Case Management

Respond to customer messages primarily through Amazon Seller Central, as well as other platforms as needed

Maintain strict response time SLAs to protect seller metrics and account health

Handle inquiries related to orders, shipping, tracking, delivery delays, returns, refunds, replacements, and product questions

Provide basic troubleshooting and escalate complex or high-risk cases appropriately

Maintain professional, empathetic, and brand-aligned communication at all times

Amazon Account Health & Escalation Management

Monitor and manage buyer feedback, reviews, and customer complaints

Proactively resolve customer issues to prevent negative feedback and account impact

Escalate high-risk cases including A-to-Z claims, chargebacks, safety complaints, and account health threats

Support NCX (Negative Customer Experience) reduction efforts and protect key performance metrics

Assist with Amazon internal escalation processes following proper escalation logic



Operational Support & Compliance

Follow established SOPs for messaging, tone, escalation, and documentation

Maintain accurate internal notes and case documentation for tracking and accountability

Flag recurring issues related to listings, fulfillment, products, or operations

Support FBA reimbursement processes and identify eligible reimbursement opportunities

Assist with safety investigations and compliance-related case handling as needed



Coverage & Availability

Provide daily customer support coverage during assigned working hours

Perform mandatory weekend and holiday check-ins (minimum one hour per day) to monitor inbox and respond to urgent messages

Ensure consistent availability to maintain uninterrupted customer communication and account protection



Requirements:



Minimum 2 years of customer support experience in e-commerce environments

Direct hands-on experience using Amazon Seller Central

Strong understanding of Amazon account health metrics, including NCX and ODR

Experience managing Amazon returns, feedback, A-to-Z claims, and customer escalations

Familiarity with FBA reimbursement processes and Amazon internal escalation workflows

Strong written English communication skills with professional and empathetic tone

High attention to detail and ability to follow SOPs precisely

Ability to work independently and manage priorities with minimal supervision

Reliable internet connection, computer, and consistent availability

Experience supporting additional marketplaces such as Shopify, Walmart, or similar platforms is a plus

Experience working with high-volume catalogs or operational support teams is a plus

Familiarity with Amazon safety investigations and compliance processes is a plus

Strong organizational and documentation skills is a plus



Work Schedule & Availability:

This role requires 7-day-a-week, year-round coverage to ensure timely customer responses and account protection.



Weekdays:

Work during assigned daily working hours



Weekends & Holidays:

Minimum of 1 hour total per day



Purpose of Weekend/Holiday Coverage:

Monitor customer inbox and account messages

Send auto-replies or templated responses as needed

Flag urgent or high-risk issues for escalation



This requirement ensures uninterrupted customer support and protects overall account health. While weekend and holiday coverage is limited in duration, consistent availability, reliability, and responsiveness are essential for success in this role. Candidates must be able to commit to this structure.

title: Virtual Assistant (Customer Service + Operations)
description:
We’re hiring a Customer Service VA who can handle customer support + general VA operations. This role is a blend of Virtual Assistant + Customer Success / Client Support, so you must be comfortable working with systems, people, and priorities daily.



IMPORTANT: Only apply if you have proven experience in BOTH operations and customer service.

Role Overview



You’ll be the front line for client communication and internal coordination — ensuring customers are supported quickly, requests are tracked properly, and operations run smoothly behind the scenes. You’ll keep our inboxes, CRM, and workflows organised so nothing slips.



Responsibilities



Respond to customer enquiries via
/chat/WhatsApp in clear, professional English

Triage requests, gather the right details, and route to the correct tea
mber

Track open queries and follow through until resolution (no dropped threads)

Handle scheduling and client reminders (calls, deadlines, document requests)

Maintain a friendly, calm tone — especially with frustrated clients

Maintain CRM hygiene (update contacts, tags, pipeline stages, notes, next steps)

Support workflow coordination: task tracking, follow-ups, and deadline reminders

Organise shared inboxes and create “inbox zero” systems (labels, templates, rules)

Prepare simple reports/updates (e.g., weekly support summary, response times, issues)

Document processes (SOPs) as you go to improve consistency

Task tools (Asana/Trello/ClickUp/Notion or similar)



Skills & Requirements



Strong customer service background (handling customer queries, follow-ups, resolution)

Strong operations/VA background (trackers, admin systems, workflow coordination)

Fluent English (written and spoken) with a professional tone

Highly organised: you track details, deadlines, and follow-ups without being chased

Calm under pressure, solution-oriented, and confident communicating with clients

Discreet and trustworthy (you’ll handle sensitive client info)



Work Setup



Home-based with stable internet and own computer

UK business hours (or overlap required, depending on team needs)

title: General Virtual Assistant (Executive, Admin & Customer Support)
description:

title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Long term (morning shift)
description:
TITLE:

Digital Marketing Coordinator (aka; Advertising, Media & Communications Manager)



BUSINESS:

Our business is a dream to work for…

• We provide content promotion and lead generation to global personalities and professionals.

• Our focus (and soon to be your focus) is to help global personalities and professionals succeed by driving attention to their most powerful educational content and drive leads to their business to increase their sales. To do this, we recruit the best video editors, graphic designers, content writers, paid ad media buyers and more.



ROLE:

This role is perfect for you, if…

• You are looking to work in a role of an experienced Digital Marketing Coordinator

• You want to work on multiple clients marketing campaigns, working with media buyers/graphic designers/video editors/content writers

• You have confidence and enjoy speaking professionally with clients (written and verbal)

• You want to work remotely, full time (40 hours) a week - Monday to Friday

• You’re interested in Day Shift hours, during Melbourne, Australia business hours

• You have a University Level Education

• And, you already have advanced skills in building (or running) paid digital advertising campaigns



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your responsibilities will include…

• Build and execute comprehensive project plans for marketing campaigns

• Coordinate with internal and external delivery teams, including clients, graphic designers, content writers, video editors, content writers, media buyers and developers

• Enforce end-to-end message congruency from the ad creative, ad copy, landing page copy, resource, etc

• Define the #1 pain point being solved by the campaign and ensure it hits the desired target market

• Identify project issues, roadblocks or missing requirements quickly and resolve proactively

• If necessary, re-write and optimise content - such as; ad copy, funnel copy,
 copy, etc

• Ensure a campaign has the highest chance of success prior to going live

• Document and handover all campaign, funnel and ad resources to media buyer for them to manage post go-live

We will provide training on how to execute each item above, as long as you are the type of person who has the will to learn and master it.



REQUIREMENTS:

To be considered for this position, you are required to:

• You need to have a proven solid work experience as a digital marketing coordinator of at least 2+ years

• You need to have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 processor and 8gb of RAM

• You need to have a 2nd computer screen in your home office

• You need to have a fast and reliable Internet connection, with access to a back-up

• You have leadership abilities, decision-making skills, and problem-solving capabilities.

• You have proven experience as a content writer in lead generation, or project manager in a lead generation, or operated in a digital marketing environment.

• You have a results-driven mindset with a commitment to achieving project objectives.

• You have a strong attention to detail and highly organised

• You have a friendly, upbeat and team focused attitude

• Most importantly, you desire to learn and obtain new responsibilities



SOFTWARE & TOOLS:

• Zoom - video meetings (internal team and client communication)

• Loom - screen recording software (internal team and client communication)

• Slack - internal communication tool

• ClickUp - task management software

• Google
 (gmail)

• Google Drive

• Google Sheets

description:

---

You'll be managing multiple ad accounts daily, testing new creatives, tracking performance, and keeping everything organized and reported accurately. - Experience managing multiple ad accounts at once



---

Please include a short note about your experience with paid ads, your computer specs, and your internet speed. Applications without this will not be reviewed.

Experience with personalized or print-on-demand products is highly preferred.

description:

ATTENTION - ALL APPLICATIONS MUST GO THROUGH THIS LINK:

###

----



We’re looking for a Quality Manager to join our team in the Philippines! This is a home-based role with no graveyard shifts.



As a Quality Manager at Ethnolink, you'll play a vital role in our multicultural communications industry, working to eliminate any quality issues appearing in translations delivered to clients. In this role, you will work closely with the Production team, including Project Managers and Typesetting Specialists, to ensure that the final files have been translated accurately and meets customer delivery expectations. You must fully understand the requirements for the service and have a sense of responsibility towards our potential and existing customers as well as the competition. The goal is to preserve our reputation by ensuring that our translation service is accurate, high quality and exceeds the various industry standards for all the translation work that we offer.



Responsibilities:



Pre-Translation

• Pre-translation - review source content including for spelling, grammar issues, typographical errors, any missing content, hyperlinks, phone number, version control, differences between final PDF and translation file (eg. IDML)

• Identify images and other items that contain text for translation and extract the text

• Quality checking of bilingual templates and CAT tool uploads against source files.

• Format Word and PPT files to facilitate translation, later typesetting, and to ensure they meet accessibility standards



Post-Translation

• Proofread all translated documents against proofreading guidelines (for grammar, punctuation, and spelling errors, as well as ensuring all numbers, number of bullet points are there etc)

• Check for consistency in design, style, formatting, and layout across multilingual projects, including written documents, web and mobile app content, audio, and video projects

• Where required, format all translated documents to mirror the original source document

• Provide feedback to the Production team regarding quality issues

• Create and maintain style guides and linguistic assets, (translation glossaries and translation memories) for individual clients

• Support management with investigations regarding translation quality feedback from clients

• Prepare translations ready for use in HTML including testing of content for social media, in HTML and in WYSIWYG editors

• Track and report on quality metrics to management



Desired Skills & Qualifications

• At least 2 – 3 years’ experience in the same role

• Proven multi-tasking skills, ability to work under strict deadlines and perform well under pressure

• Fast learner and the ability to pick up new skills and technologies

• Common sense with exceptional problem-solving skills

• Strong grasp of the English language, both written and spoken.

• Attention to detail

• Experience using Microsoft Office tools; experience CAT tools and Adobe suite is a plus

• Excellent interpersonal skills; capable of working autonomously as well as with different personalities.

• Alignment with Ethnolink’s core values.



Why Join Us:

• Full-time with no graveyard shifts

• A relaxed and focused culture

• Supportive and focused team culture



If you or anyone you know is interested, feel free to refer or apply!

title: Full-Stack AI Automation Architect
description:
About Us



We are a growing agency that helps businesses automate everything — lead generation, marketing, client onboarding, internal operations, content creation, and more. We work with law firms, insurance agencies, financial advisors, IT companies, and other professional service businesses. Our edge is that we do not just offer one service. We look at a business, identify every process that is repetitive, manual, or slow, and we build AI-powered systems that handle it automatically.



We need someone who thinks in systems. Someone who hears "I spend 3 hours a day doing X" and immediately knows how to make it happen in 3 minutes. Someone who is obsessed with connecting tools, building workflows, and using AI to eliminate busywork across every part of a business.



This is not a "set up a Zapier zap" role. We build complex, multi-step, AI-driven automation systems that run entire business operations. If you have only built simple two-step automations, this role is not for you. If you have built systems that made people ask "how the hell does this work?" — keep reading.



What You Will Do



Your job is to look at any business process — ours or our clients' — and figure out how to automate it. The scope is broad on purpose. Here are the categories of work you will own:



AI-Powered Business Automation (40% of your time)



You will design and build automated systems that replace manual work across every part of our business and our clients' businesses. This includes but is not limited to:



•

Lead generation pipelines: Automated scraping, enrichment, AI-powered hyper-personalization, and campaign deployment — so leads flow in without anyone touching a spreadsheet.



•

Client onboarding workflows: When a new client signs up, automated sequences that collect their information, set up their accounts, send welcome materials, and schedule kickoff calls — without a human doing any of it.



•

CRM and pipeline management: Automated lead categorization, follow-up scheduling, deal stage updates, and alert systems that notify the right person at the right time.



•

Document and proposal generation: AI-powered systems that take client data and automatically generate custom proposals, reports, or deliverables.



•

Internal operations: Automated reporting dashboards, task assignment systems, performance tracking, and anything else that currently requires someone to manually update a spreadsheet or send a Slack message.



You will use whatever tools the job requires — Make (Integromat), n8n, Zapier, custom Python/Node.js scripts, Google Apps Script, or direct API integrations. You pick the right tool for the job.



AI Content & Social Media Automation (25% of your time)



You will build and manage automated content creation and distribution systems. This includes:



•

Automated video generation: Using platforms like HeyGen, Synthesia, Pictory, or similar tools to generate AI avatar videos, repurpose long-form content into short clips, and produce video content at scale without a production team.



•

Social media scheduling and posting: Building automated pipelines that generate social media content using AI (captions, hashtags, image selection), schedule posts across multiple platforms, and adapt content format for each channel (LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok,
, X).



•

Content repurposing engines: Systems that take one piece of content (a blog post, a podcast episode, a video) and automatically break it into 10-20 pieces of social content — different formats, different platforms, different angles — all generated and scheduled without manual work.



•

AI-powered copywriting pipelines: Automated systems that generate blog posts,
 newsletters, ad copy, and landing page content using AI, with human review checkpoints built into the workflow.



You should be familiar with tools like Buffer, Hootsuite, or Later for scheduling, and AI video tools like HeyGen, Pictory, or Opus Clip for automated video creation. If you have experience with Canva API or similar design automation, even better.



Client-Facing Automation Solutions (20% of your time)



This is where it gets interesting. We sell automation services to our clients — law firms, insurance agencies, financial advisors, and other businesses. You will build custom automation solutions that we deliver as a product. Examples:



•

A law firm that manually tracks case deadlines ? you build an automated system that pulls court dates, sends reminders to attorneys, and escalates overdue items.



•

An insurance agency that manually sends renewal reminders ? you build an automated pipeline that identifies upcoming renewals, generates personalized outreach, and tracks responses.



•

A financial advisor that manually creates quarterly reports ? you build a system that pulls portfolio data, generates AI-written commentary, and produces branded PDF reports automatically.



•

A property management company that manually coordinates maintenance requests ? you build a system that receives requests, categorizes urgency with AI, dispatches vendors, and sends status updates to tenants.



The point is: you will constantly be solving new problems for new types of businesses. You need to be the kind of person who gets excited when someone describes a manual process, because you already see how to automate it.



Proactive Problem-Solving & Innovation (10% of your time)



This is the most important part of the job description. We want you to constantly ask us what we are doing manually and tell us how to automate it. If you see us doing something by hand, we expect you to come to us and say "I can build something that does that in 10 seconds." We want you to be so good at this that we start to wonder what we even do all day because you have automated everything.



You will also stay current on new AI tools, automation platforms, and integration possibilities. When a new tool launches that could save us time or money, you bring it to us. When a client mentions a pain point in a call, you are already thinking about the workflow that solves it.



Documentation & Maintenance (5% of your time — but always on)



You will document every automation you build — what it does, how it works, what triggers it, and how to troubleshoot it. When something breaks, you fix it fast. You will also build monitoring systems that alert you before things break.









Required Experience & Skills



Advanced automation platform experience is non-negotiable. You must have proven experience building complex, multi-step automations using at least two of the following: Make (Integromat), n8n, Zapier, or custom Python/Node.js scripts with API integrations. "Complex" means 10+ steps, multiple conditional branches, error handling, and integrations with 3+ different platforms in a single workflow. You should be able to show examples.



You must be an API expert. Reading documentation, authenticating (OAuth, API keys, Bearer tokens), making requests, parsing JSON responses, handling pagination, managing rate limits, and building retry logic. If a tool has an API, you should be able to connect it to anything else within hours, not days.



You must have deep experience with AI/LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, or similar). This goes beyond basic prompting. You should understand structured output formats (JSON mode), function calling, prompt chaining, context window management, and how to build quality control layers that catch bad AI output before it reaches a customer. You will use AI as a core component in almost every automation you build.



You must have experience with AI-powered content and video generation tools. This includes platforms like HeyGen, Synthesia, Pictory, Opus Clip, or similar for automated video creation, and experience integrating these tools into larger automated workflows via their APIs.



You must be proficient with Google Workspace automation — Google Sheets, Google Apps Script, Google Drive API, and Gmail API. A huge amount of our work flows through Google products, and you need to be able to build sophisticated automations within that ecosystem.



You must think like a consultant, not just a technician. When someone describes a business problem, you should immediately start mapping out the automation architecture in your head. You do not wait to be told what to build — you identify opportunities and propose solutions.



Strong English communication is required. You will be on calls with clients explaining what you built and why. You need to be able to translate technical automation concepts into simple business language.









Preferred (Bonus) Skills



Experience with cold
 platforms (Smartlead, Instantly) and their APIs. Experience with CRM platforms (HubSpot, GoHighLevel, Salesforce) and their automation capabilities. Experience with webhook-based event processing and real-time data pipelines. Familiarity with cloud functions (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions) or similar serverless environments. Experience building Slack/
 bots or notification systems. Experience with web scraping (Apify, Puppeteer, BeautifulSoup). Experience with database design and management (Airtable, Supabase, Firebase, or SQL). Experience building client-facing dashboards or reporting tools. Knowledge of social media APIs (Meta, LinkedIn, TikTok, X).



How to Apply



In your application, answer these five questions:



1.

Describe the most complex automation system you have ever built. What business problem did it solve, what tools did it connect, how many steps were involved, and what was the measurable impact (time saved, revenue generated, errors eliminated)?



2.

A law firm tells you they spend 5 hours per week manually sending follow-up
s to leads who filled out a contact form on their website. Walk me through exactly how you would automate this end-to-end, including which tools you would use and why.



3.

Have you built any automated content creation or video generation systems? If yes, describe what you built, what AI tools you used, and how the content was distributed. If no, describe how you would approach building an automated system that takes one 30-minute podcast episode and turns it into 15 social media posts across 4 platforms.



4.

Show me a Loom video (preferred) or detailed screenshot walkthrough of an automation you built that is currently running in production. Walk me through the logic, the tools, and how you handle errors.



5.

What is the most creative automation you have ever built or seen? Something that made you think "that is genius." Describe it and explain why it impressed you.



Do not send a generic cover letter. Applications that do not answer all five questions will not be reviewed.

What You’ll Do

Monitor issues, suspensions, or inconsistencies

Align content with search intent

Process & Execution

Real experience managing Google Business Profiles

Detail-oriented and organized



Nice to Have (Not Required)

(roofing, HVAC, restoration, gutters, etc.)



How We Work

title: Algorithm-Savvy Bookkeeper for Double tool, QuickBooks-Zapier-Google Drive Integration
description:
We are a Real estate company seeking an algorithm-savvy bookkeeper to help us streamline and automate our accounting and rental properties processes using Double previously known as keeper, QuickBooks Online, Zapier, and Google Sheets. If you have a knack for creating efficient workflows and enjoy integrating multiple platforms, we’d love to hear from you.



Scope of Work

1. Double ? QuickBooks Integration

• Link Double to QuickBooks for automatic invoice and receipt imports.

• Set up rules and categories in QuickBooks that match with Double entries.

• Ensure auto bank reconciliation is seamless with transactions from Double.

2. Bank Feeds in QuickBooks

• Connect business bank accounts to QuickBooks.

• Create efficient categorization rules that match the Dext entries.

• Implement auto-reconciliation features where possible.

3. QuickBooks ? Google Drive via Zapier

• Set up an automatic data feed from QuickBooks to a Google Sheets budgeting template.

• Ensure real-time or scheduled synchronization to the process current.

4.Track update for Google Sheet

• Develop a SOP workflow for our VA

• Includes each task to be complete daily to keep up with workflow.

• Has a column to mark the tracker of all completed task done.

• Shows invoices, receipts and paid bills all saved in google drive monthly by date (fetched automatically from QuickBooks via Zapier).

• Tracks the remaining  to statements that still need to be uploaded keeping task update

• Outlines what VA should look at to keep job up

•
 management

• develop rules for
 forwarding

• Calculate the total time VA should spend to keep thigs on schedule for the bookkeeper to do a month end closeout.



Ideal Candidate

• Strong background in QuickBooks Online, Double previously known as keeper and Zapier integrations.

• Experience working with real estate rental properties based accounting.

• Ability to think algorithmically and build automated, rules-based workflows.

• Proficiency in Google Sheets, Google drive including advanced formulas and data organization.

• Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.



?

We look forward to partnering with an expert who can bring our bookkeeping workflow to the next level by automating our business workflows..

title: Marketing & E-Commerce Specialists (Multiple Roles – Remote, PH)
description:
Join Little Nation’s Global Marketing Team (Remote, PH Based)



About Us

Little Nation is one of Australia’s fastest-growing kids’ lifestyle brands. We design and market innovative products like bikes, scooters, furniture, and play gear — and we’re expanding into New Zealand and the UK.



We’re building a dedicated PH marketing team to work alongside our AU Marketing Manager. Every role is supported by clear SOPs, Asana workflows, and structured playbooks — so you’ll always know exactly what success looks like.



Open Roles (Full-Time, Remote, PH Based)



1. Marketplace Manager

Manage Amazon AU/UK and other marketplaces.

Oversee listings, SEO, reviews, promotions, and compliance.

Coordinate with AU Ops & Product teams to optimise marketplace performance.



2. Paid Media Support Specialist

Assist in building and QA’ing ad campaigns (Google, Meta, TikTok, Pinterest).

Upload creative assets, check campaign setups, apply brand-safety rules.

Follow daily, weekly, and monthly optimisation checklists.



3. Growth & Engagement Specialist

Execute daily engagement scripts (comments, replies, DMs).

Run giveaways, competitions, and community-building initiatives.

Support advocacy seeding and positive brand mentions.



4. UGC & Content Operations Specialist

Harvest, tag, and manage UGC across TikTok, IG, YouTube.

Handle rights approvals, licensing workflows, and asset storage.

Support Content Creator with cross-channel repurposing.



5. Ambassador Manager

Recruit, onboard, and manage brand ambassadors.

Coordinate content briefs, review submissions, and track deliverables.

Build strong community relationships and ensure ambassador activity aligns with marketing goals.



What You’ll Do

Work inside a SOP-driven system (no guesswork, every task has a playbook).

Use tools: Asana, Slack, Canva, Klaviyo, Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager, Amazon Seller Central.

Collaborate daily with the AU Marketing Manager and cross-functional teams.

Focus on measurable outputs — clear KPIs, checklists, and reporting.



What We’re Looking For

Strong written English and communication skills.

High attention to detail — accuracy is critical.

Experience in at least one of the role areas (ads, engagement, UGC, ambassadors, marketplaces, influencers).

Proactive, organised, and eager to learn.

Work 9 to 5 PHT. Our office is in Perth, Australia GMT+8



What We Offer

Stable, long-term remote role with career progression.

Competitive PH salary package + 13th month pay + holidays.

Fully documented training

Work with a global brand across AU, NZ, and UK.

Work with an established PH based team.



How to Apply

Send your CV + short cover letter.

Include a relevant work sample (TikTok/Reel, ad copy/design, dashboard/report, or marketplace listing).

Apply via OnlineJobs.ph with subject line:

“Marketing Team – [Role You’re Applying For]”

SUPPORT RESPONSIBILITES:

- Creative Content Curation for Social Media  

- Video and Still Ad creatives for PPC and paid media  

- Advanced photo manipulation  

- Other Creative Work as required



Workload will vary depending on business needs. Some weeks are heavier/lighter than others. Consistent output and meeting deadlines are critical.  



REQUIRED SKILLS:  

- Excellent video editing skills (Premiere, Capcut) is REQUIRED  

- Excellent design skills (Photoshop/Illustrator/Canva or similar) is REQUIRED  

- Excellent understanding of social media creatives is REQUIRED

PREFERRED SKILLS (but not required):

PERKS:  

- Flexible hours with clear deadlines and deliverables 

- Paid time off with advance notice 

- Performance-based raises and bonuses tied to clear goals and metrics 

- Long-term growth opportunity within the company

- Philippine regular and special non-working holidays observed  



ABOUT THE COMPANY & ME:  



Since 2017, we have operated multiple e-commerce brands, selling across Amazon, Shopify, Etsy, and eBay in North America. This role will focus primarily on our core brand, with room to expand into additional brands over time. 



We operate with a performance mindset. We move quickly, test consistently, and evaluate creative work based on measurable results. 



Our team is small and focused. We prioritize accountability and long-term collaboration. We are seeking the RIGHT FIT - someone who is proactive, accountable, and motivated to grow with the company over the long term.





TO APPLY FOR THE JOB / APPLICATION PROCESS:

title: Technical Account Manager (TAM)
description:
Location: Irvine, CA (Hybrid)

Company: Atomic Technology Solutions

Reports To: Service & Operations Leadership



Position Overview

Atomic Technology Solutions is seeking a highly skilled Technical Account Manager (TAM) to serve as the strategic and technical owner of assigned client accounts.



This individual will:

Oversee client infrastructure health

Recommend technology improvements and upgrades

Conduct monthly license audits

Ensure accurate billing alignment

Lead Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)

Advocate for client needs internally

Maintain executive-level relationships

Ensure long-term client satisfaction and retention

This is a client-facing leadership role requiring fluent, professional English communication and the ability to translate complex technical topics into business value.



Core Responsibilities

1?? Infrastructure Health & Strategic Oversight

Perform regular reviews of client environments including:

Microsoft 365

Servers & virtualization

Networking

Security stack

Backup & disaster recovery

Identify aging infrastructure and lifecycle risks

Recommend hardware refreshes and modernization

Proactively identify security gaps and compliance risks

Develop and maintain a documented technology roadmap for each client

Ensure environments follow best practices and security standards

This role must think proactively, not reactively.



2?? Monthly License & User Audit (Critical Responsibility)

Conduct monthly Microsoft 365 and software license reviews

Validate:

Active employee counts

Terminated employee deactivations

Unused licenses

Over-licensed or under-licensed accounts

Coordinate with client HR or management to reconcile user changes

Ensure:

Client is not overpaying

Company billing aligns with actual usage

Identify upsell opportunities when growth occurs

Document all licensing changes in PSA

This protects both client trust and company revenue integrity.



3?? Client Advocacy & Satisfaction Ownership

Act as the voice of the client internally

Escalate recurring issues affecting client satisfaction

Identify operational pain points

Ensure service quality meets expectations

Maintain regular communication cadence

Build strong executive relationships

The TAM “owns the client experience.”



4?? Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)

Prepare structured QBR presentations including:

SLA performance metrics

Ticket trends

Security posture review

Infrastructure health

Licensing overview

Roadmap recommendations

Present findings in business language

Propose improvements and budget planning

Track follow-up action items

QBRs must be strategic, not just reporting sessions.



5?? Project Oversight & Coordination

Define project scope based on roadmap

Coordinate with engineering teams

Ensure timelines and client expectations are managed

Communicate project status clearly

Conduct post-project review and documentation



6?? Relationship Management

Maintain ongoing communication with assigned accounts

Build trust with decision-makers

Anticipate future needs

Increase client retention and long-term contracts

Support contract renewals and expansion opportunities

Required Qualifications

5+ years MSP or IT services experience

Strong Microsoft 365 expertise (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, Entra ID)

Infrastructure & networking fundamentals

Security best practices understanding

Experience leading executive-level client meetings

Excellent project coordination ability

Fluent, professional-level English (written and spoken)

Strong presentation skills

High attention to detail

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Client retention rate

License audit accuracy rate

Infrastructure health improvements

QBR completion & effectiveness

Client satisfaction score (CSAT)

Reduction of client escalations

Revenue growth from proactive recommendations



Personality & Soft Skills Required:

Highly organized

Strategic thinker

Detail-oriented

Confident communicator

Proactive mindset

Business-focused, not just technical

Strong ownership mentality

title: Remote Accountant for New Zealand Business

title: Senior Lending Intelligence & Bank Relationship Specialist (Philippines Only – Remote)
description:
READ FIRST – Not a Basic VA Role



We are hiring someone in the Philippines with real lending experience and real banking connections.



This role is for someone who has:

 • Worked inside a bank, credit union, lending company, or broker office (USA)

 • Built relationships with branch managers, relationship managers, or business banking reps

 • Seen high-limit approvals happen firsthand

 • Wants long-term stability, growth, and performance-based income



If you have experience working with banks like Chase, Fifth Third, or similar U.S. institutions — especially handling business credit cards or business lines of credit — this opportunity is for you.



?



What We Are Looking For



We want someone who:

 • Has access to or relationships with branch managers or business banking representatives

 • Understands how approvals are influenced for:

 • $50K+ business credit cards

 • $75K–$100K business lines of credit

 • High-limit unsecured funding

 • Has firsthand knowledge of approval behavior (not theory)



Examples of the types of approvals we are targeting:

 • $50,000+ business credit cards

 • $100,000 business lines of credit

 • High-limit unsecured credit through relationship banking



If you have worked around these approvals, we want to speak with you.

Compensation Structure



This is not just a fixed salary role.



You will receive:

 • Competitive base pay

 • Commissions when clients get approved

 • Large bonuses when clients secure high funding amounts

 • Long-term growth opportunity



This position is designed for someone who wants a professional home — a place to grow, be valued, and build something long-term.



If you perform well and help drive approvals, your income grows with it.



Responsibilities

 • Document real lender approval patterns based on your experience

 • Help identify which banks are currently approving higher limits

 • Leverage relationships with bank reps or branch managers when appropriate

 • Track approval tendencies by:

 • Credit score

 • Income

 • Business revenue

 • Bank deposits

 • Assist in structuring borrower profiles to increase approval odds

 • Build and maintain an internal lender intelligence database



Required Background (Must Have At Least One)

 • Former Bank Loan Processor

 • Former Loan Underwriter

 • Business Banking Assistant

 • Relationship Manager Support Staff

 • Lending Operations Staff

 • Broker Submission Manager



We are not hiring entry-level virtual assistants for this role.



Major Advantage (Priority Consideration)

You will receive priority if you:

 • Have direct contact with business banking reps

 • Have access to branch managers

 • Previously assisted with high-limit approvals

 • Worked inside U.S.-based banks or credit unions

 • Can explain how business lines of credit are actually approved



Screening Questions (Required – Be Specific)

 1. Have you worked directly with branch managers or relationship managers? Explain your role.

 2. What is the highest business credit card limit you personally saw approved?

 3. What borrower profile typically qualifies for $50K+ business credit cards?

 4. What does a borrower need to qualify for a $75K–$100K line of credit?

 5. Do you currently maintain any banking contacts?



Generic answers will not be considered.

How to Apply



Submit:

 • Your resume

 • Answers to all screening questions

 • Your WhatsApp number

 • Your
 address



Applications missing any of the above will not be reviewed.

Final Note



We are building a serious funding operation. This role is for experienced professionals who understand how approvals truly work and want to grow with a long-term team.



If you have real insider knowledge and real banking relationships, this opportunity can be highly rewarding.

title: Admin Assistant
description:
Virtual Assistant – Admin & Lead Manager



We are seeking someone with a confident, authoritative voice capable of communicating clearly, giving direction, and maintaining command presence in all interactions.



Florida Defensive Training



Florida Defensive Training is a fast-growing training and education company based in Florida. We’re looking for a full-time Virtual Assistant to manage our leads, messages, and CRM so no opportunity is ever missed.



If you love organization, sales support, and helping businesses grow, this role is for you.



Your Mission



Your job is simple but extremely important:

Make sure every lead is contacted, followed up with, and properly managed inside GoHighLevel.



You will be the first point of contact for people interested in our training programs.



What You’ll Do



Respond to inbound SMS,
, and chat messages in GoHighLevel (GHL)



Follow up with new leads to make sure they don’t go cold



Occasionally call leads to answer questions and qualify interest



Update and manage the GHL pipeline (New Lead ? Contacted ? Interested ? Booked ? Closed)



Apply tags, notes, and updates to contacts



Send booking links and guide leads toward scheduling



Flag hot leads for the sales team



Keep everything clean, organized, and up to date



Schedule



Full-time



Monday–Friday



9:00 AM – 8:00 PM EST (Varies)



Fast response time during these hours is required.



What We’re Looking For



Experience using GoHighLevel (GHL) (preferred)



Comfortable with lead follow-up and sales conversations



Strong English writing and communication



Confident on the phone



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Able to follow systems and SOPs



Reliable internet and quiet work environment



This Is NOT a Generic VA Job



You won’t be doing random admin work.



You will be working directly with leads, bookings, and revenue.

The better you perform, the more the business grows.



How to Apply



To apply, please submit:



Your experience with GoHighLevel (or any CRM)



Your internet speed



Your availability (confirm 9–8 EST)



A short message you would send to a new lead who just filled out a form but didn’t book



Include the word “MIAMI” somewhere in your application so we know you read this post



A short video introducing yourself (1–2 minutes) REQUIRED!



Applications that do not include “MIAMI” and a video introduction will not be reviewed

title: Senior Email Support Specialist (Remote, Full-Time)
description:
Important: MUST Have Senior Experience in
 Sales/Support (English written) 

Company: Event Branding UK (
)

Location: Work from home – must be available to work 08:00-15:00 UK time (13:00-00:00 PH time), Monday–Friday

Salary: Competitive



Why we’re hiring

Event Branding UK is the leading British supplier of custom-printed flags, gazebos and outdoor branding for exhibitions, sporting events and festivals. Our shared inbox receives 1–3 customer
s every single minute – enquiries, quotations, order updates and after-sales questions.



We are looking for an elite
 handler who can keep pace, keep calm, and keep customers delighted. If you thrive on zero-inbox discipline and you write immaculate, persuasive English, we want to hear from you.



Key responsibilities

Own the inbox: monitor, triage and respond to ~400–500
s per day, maintaining a zero-backlog by end of shift.

Convert enquiries into sales: craft clear quotations, identify upsell opportunities and close deals.

Deliver five-star service: resolve shipping, artwork and product queries quickly and courteously.

Coordinate internally: liaise with our design studio and production team to secure proofs, lead-times and status updates.

Document everything: log interactions in Shopify / Freshdesk (or similar) with meticulous detail.

Improve the workflow: suggest templates, canned responses and automations that shave seconds off every reply.

Overtime available: Unlimited providing the work is there.

title: Go High Level Expert + Executive Assistant
description:

GoHighLevel + Executive Assistant (Operations Manager) Job Description

Overview

This role combines GoHighLevel (GHL) management at the agency and subaccount levels with executive assistant responsibilities. It requires strong problem-solving, organization, and communication skills to execute tasks efficiently, maintain documentation, and ensure accountability.



Job Details

Hours: 3 hrs/day (M-F), 10 AM - 1 PM MST (Increases over 6 months)

Pay: Starts at $5/hr, increasing monthly up to $10/hr by Month 6

Payment: Weekly, every Friday

???? GoHighLevel (GHL) Tasks



Manage agency & subaccount setups (Launch Operations, Snapshots, etc.)

Create & update websites, automations, pipelines, dashboards,
 campaigns

Organize leads, client onboarding, and reporting

???? Executive Assistant Tasks

s, handle scheduling & client communication

Live 15-min huddle

Loom video update

Slack summary

Escalation & Urgent Issues:

Submit questions via GHL form (batch non-urgent ones)

Use Slack only for urgent matters

If urgent, handle it first, then notify Tanner

Qualifications

? GHL expertise (agency & subaccount level)

? Proactive, takes ownership, problem-solver

? Excellent written/spoken English

? Organized, detail-oriented, accountable

? Comfortable with Loom for documentation

Growth & Future Opportunities

More hours & responsibilities based on performance

Pay increases monthly for the first 6 months

Potential to grow into higher operational roles

How to Apply

???? Book an interview & submit:



A Loom video introducing yourself & your experience in GHL/EA tasks

A brief written summary of your EA experience

Confirmation of job understanding

???? Looking for a proactive leader to streamline operations!

title: WordPress Developer & UI/UX Specialist (Elementor)
description:
WordPress Developer & UI/UX Specialist (Elementor)



Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term



We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented WordPress Developer to join our growing team. Your main responsibility will be building and optimizing WordPress websites using Elementor while ensuring strong user experience and clean, professional design.



This is a long-term role for someone who values stability, consistency, and growth.

Ensure websites are responsive and mobile-friendly

Troubleshoot bugs and technical issues

Maintain website speed, security, and performance

Create clean, user-friendly page layouts

Improve navigation and conversion flow

Ensure consistent branding and visual quality

Optimize pages for usability and engagement

Structure pages following SEO best practices

Implement proper heading hierarchy (H1–H6)

Optimize page speed and Core Web Vitals

Ensure clean URL structure and internal linking

Implement on-page SEO elements (title tags, meta descriptions, alt text)

Support schema markup and structured data when needed

Collaborate with SEO team to improve rankings and visibility



-Requirements



Strong experience with WordPress & Elementor

Experience improving website speed and performance

Strong attention to detail

title: Remote Financial Operations & KPI Manager
description:
Location: 100% Remote (US-Based Healthcare Company)

Shift: USA, Mountain time, to start however once trained can easily work days in the phillipines, but need at least 2hrs a day overlap to CEO Meeting Daily

Role Type: Full-Time / Long-Term



The Mission

We are a fast-growing, psychiatric healthcare group in the US. We are refocusing on Operational Excellence.



We don't need a theorist; we need a Financial Architect. This role replaces a departing CFO and focuses on the "engine room"—tracking numbers, managing payroll, paying bills, and building the dashboards that tell us exactly where the business stands every Monday morning. If you love building clarity from chaos and turning raw data into actionable insights, we want to talk to you.



???? Your Key Responsibilities

The Pulse (KPIs): Own the weekly KPI dashboard (Revenue, Payroll %, Provider Productivity, Collections, and AR).



The Books: Full-cycle QuickBooks Online management, including meticulous bank reconciliation and expense categorization.



The People: Audit payroll, analyze labor costs, and ensure "hours worked vs. revenue generated" stays in balance.



The Flow: Manage accounts payable (bills) and ensure financial data integrity across multiple clinic locations.



The Future: Assist the CEO and fractional CFO with budgeting and forecasting models.



The Standard: Help design and document Financial SOPs so our operations are scalable and "bulletproof."



???? Required Skills & Experience

US Healthcare Experience: You must understand US Medical Billing/RCM (the gap between "date of service" and "date of collection").



QuickBooks Pro: Advanced experience in QBO, specifically using Class Tracking for multi-location reporting.



Sheets/Excel Wizard: You should be comfortable with Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs/XLOOKUPs, and building clean, visual dashboards.



Detail Obsession: You find the $10 discrepancy that everyone else misses.



Communication: Fluent written and spoken English. You can explain why a number is down, not just that it is down.



Proactive Nature: You don't wait for the CEO to ask for a report; you have it ready before they think of it.



???? Ideal Candidate Profile

You are calm under pressure and comfortable with a fast-moving CEO.



You value discretion—handling sensitive psychiatric practice data and payroll requires a high level of integrity.



You prefer "building the system" over just "following a list."



???? How to Apply (Strict Requirements)

Failure to follow these steps will result in your application being ignored.



Resume: Updated PDF version.



Loom Video (2–3 mins): Briefly explain your experience managing US healthcare financials, your proficiency with QuickBooks, and one specific time you found a cost-saving or error that others missed.



The Proof: Provide a screenshot or link to a KPI Dashboard you have built (please redact/blur any sensitive previous client info).

If you’re passionate about thoughtful design, continuous growth, and meaningful creative work, we’d love to see your portfolio.



Thank you,

title: Virtual Assistant (SEO Agency) | $800/mo + | US Hours
description:
Virtual Assistant (SEO Agency) | $800 USD+/mo | US Hours



$800 USD/month | 13th Month Pay 



Remodel Titans is a US-based agency that helps kitchen and bathroom remodeling contractors dominate local search. We're niche-focused, systems-driven, and growing fast.



The Role

We're looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support our SEO team. No SEO experience required — we'll train you on everything. What we need is someone reliable, organized, and sharp enough to follow systems without letting things slip.

You'll be working inside our SOPs and ClickUp workflows, handling tasks that keep our client accounts running smoothly. You'll have a team around you, clear instructions for every process, and leadership that actually supports you.

This is a great fit if you're the kind of person who thrives with structure, takes pride in getting the small things right, and wants to build real skills in a growing industry.



What You'll Be Doing

- Following SOPs to complete SEO-related tasks across multiple client accounts

- Updating and managing tasks in ClickUp — keeping statuses, due dates, and details accurate

- Assisting with Google Business Profile updates, citation management, and basic on-page tasks

- QA checks on content, links, and deliverables before they go to clients

- Organizing files, tracking deadlines, and flagging anything that looks off

- Supporting the SEO team with research, data entry, and reporting tasks



What We're Looking For

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail — you don't miss things

- Experience working in ClickUp or similar project management tools

- Comfortable following SOPs and structured workflows

- Reliable and consistent — you show up, you follow through

- Strong written English

- Available to work US Eastern Standard Time hours

- Comfortable with time tracking

- No SEO experience needed — we provide full training



Bonus Points If You Have

- Any exposure to SEO, digital marketing, or agency work

- Experience as a VA supporting a team or managing tasks across multiple clients

- Familiarity with ClickUp and Google Workspace



What You'll Get

- $800 USD/month base salary

- 13th-month pay

- Full SOPs and training for every single process — no guesswork

- Supportive team that wants you to succeed

- Long-term stability with a growing agency

- Real opportunity to grow into an SEO specialist role as you learn



How to Apply

Apply with at least 10 apply points, answering the following questions — in this order. Please include the words "blue coconut" somewhere in your application.

1. What is the link to your CV (with necessary viewing permissions)?

2. Do you have experience using ClickUp or another project management tool? Briefly describe how you used it.

3. Tell us about a task or project where your attention to detail really mattered. What did you do to make sure nothing was missed?

4. What does "being reliable" mean to you? Give a specific example from a past role.

5. BONUS (optional): Record a loom video introducing yourself and show us how you stay organized.
