title: Executive Assistant and Sales Right Hand to CEO
description:
Executive Assistant and Sales Right Hand to CEO

Proactive. Relentless Follow-Through. Trusted Partner.



We run multiple companies in the legal and financial services space. The mission is simple, help business owners succeed and build companies they can actually sell. The founder is a lawyer and finance guy by training, but you would never guess it. He is approachable, down to earth, and focused on results without the fluff, fake polish, or corporate nonsense.



This role is about being his right hand. You will protect his time, keep priorities straight, and make sure nothing important is forgotten. You will handle the calendar and inbox, but even more critical, you will manage follow-ups with referral partners, prospective customers, and key relationships so 
ntum never dies.



A normal day means filtering the inbox and calendar so the noise disappears and the right meetings get scheduled. You will sit in on calls or catch the notes, then turn them into clear follow-ups that live in the CRM and stay alive until complete. You will act as the founder’s second brain when it comes to high-value referral partners, prospects, and customers. You will nudge, remind, and track so relationships don’t fade and opportunities don’t slip. Communication will flow through Slack, where you will capture ideas, tasks, and follow-ups before they vanish.



You will keep a close eye on the sales pipeline. We already have systems for the routine stuff, but your focus will be on the high-value opportunities where personal attention is everything. Ahead of meetings, you will pull quick research on people and companies so the founder shows up sharp. You will also work with tea
mbers, contractors, and vendors to keep important projects moving forward.



This role is for someone who is proactive, structured, and relentless about follow-through. You thrive in a support role where success means the CEO never has to wonder whether something got done. You are comfortable with modern tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and CRMs, but you do not need to be a tech wizard.



This is not for someone who waits for instructions or hesitates to speak up. It is not for someone who only wants to be told what to do instead of acting as a true partner.



This is a full-time remote role. Ideal candidates are based in the Philippines with overlap in Mountain Time. Pay is based on experience, with bonus potential tied to performance. The founder is a foodie and loves cooking meals from scratch, so when you respond, tell us your favorite thing to eat. If you don’t answer that, you will not be considered. You will work directly with the founder as his right hand, making sure that every commitment, relationship, and opportunity gets the follow-through it deserves.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
We are seeking a highly organised, proactive, and technologically fluent Virtual Executive Assistant to support two busy professionals across their clinical, academic, business, and household responsibilities. This role requires someone who can confidently manage complex schedules, coordinate childcare logistics, streamline administrative workflows, and progressively take on higher?level business administration tasks.

A key component of this role is providing robust administrative support for both careers, including academic scheduling, professional documentation, inbox management, and—over time—upskilling into administrative support for a small company, including billing, bookkeeping, and liaison with accountants.

The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic environment, anticipates needs, and uses AI tools to automate and optimise workflows.



Key Responsibilities

1. Executive & Administrative Support

- Manage and triage shared and individual
 inboxes.

- Coordinate clinical, academic, and professional calendars, ensuring seamless integration with household logistics.

- Prepare, track, and submit:

- Salary packaging documentation

- Continuing professional development claims

- Professional development paperwork

- Receipts and compliance documentation

- Support academic and non?clinical commitments, including:

- Maintaining a weekly schedule of research, administration, and project work.

- Ensuring protected time is allocated prior to key meetings and governance responsibilities.

- Manage recurring accommodation bookings and related travel logistics.



2. Business Administration & Financial Operations (desired)

The role includes progressive responsibility for business administration, including:

- Bookkeeping: maintaining accurate financial records, categorising expenses, and preparing summaries.

- Liaising with accountants: coordinating documentation, responding to queries, and ensuring compliance.

- Supporting a small property?related business, including:

- Document preparation

- Expense tracking

- Communication with external stakeholders

- Preparing and submitting relevant tax exemption applications and maintaining associated records.

Training and upskilling will be supported, with the expectation of increasing autonomy over time.



3. Rostering & Weekly Logistics

- Build and maintain the childcare roster, ensuring:

- Alignment with clinical and academic work hours.

- Consideration of variable availability of both professionals.

- Childcare provider hours average 30 hours/week over a month (20–40 acceptable).

- Arrange additional support if schedules clash.



4. Household Operations & Meal Planning

- Develop weekly meal plans for:

- Dinners and lunches for the household and live?in childcare provider.

- Children’s lunches and snacks

- Create shopping lists and coordinate grocery orders.

- Hire and manage a gardener, including lawn repair and general maintenance.

- assist with ad hoc need for trades or repairs



5. Children’s Commitments & Family Events

- Manage children’s schedules, including:

- appointments such as dentist, health care providers

- extra-curricular activity coordination.

- school communications

- Birthday party RSVPs.

- Gift purchasing

- assist with project management of children’s birthday parties.

- Organise date nights, weekends away, and family holidays, including itinerary planning and travel bookings.



6. AI?Enhanced Productivity & Automation

The ideal candidate will confidently use AI tools to:

- Automate recurring tasks (e.g., meal planning, inbox triage, reminders, document drafting).

- Optimise rostering and scheduling using AI?assisted calendar logic.

- Draft
s, summaries, and documents with high accuracy.

- Create templates, checklists, and workflows that reduce manual effort.

- Support research, compare options, and generate recommendations.

- Maintain structured knowledge bases (e.g., Notion, OneNote, or similar).

- Identify opportunities to streamline operations using AI?driven solutions.



Key Skills & Attributes

- Strong administrative capability, with the ability to support two demanding professional careers.

- High proficiency with AI tools and digital productivity platforms.

- Ability to manage complex, multi?layered schedules with competing priorities.

- Excellent written and verbal communication.

- High level of discretion and confidentiality.

- Experience with bookkeeping or willingness to upskill quickly.

- Proactive problem?solver with excellent judgment.

- Comfortable coordinating childcare logistics and household operations.

- Ability to work independently and anticipate needs.

- Takes initiative and asks for help/assistance when needed



What Success Looks Like

- Professional administrative needs are handled smoothly and proactively.

- Business administration becomes increasingly efficient as the assistant upskills.

- The weekly roster runs predictably, with childcare, exercise, and work commitments aligned.

- Academic and governance obligations are consistently met without last?minute pressure.

- Household operations feel seamless, with meals planned, shopping organised, and commitments tracked.

- AI tools are used intelligently to reduce friction, automate tasks, and create clarity.

- The household experiences more ease, time, and headspace.



Time commitment: 20 hours per week, can be flexible with scheduling as minimal face-to face contact, most communication will be through whatsapp and
.

title: Senior Video Editor | Adobe Premiere | Animal Rescue Mini Documentaries | Full Time | $1,200+ USD per Month
description:
We are hiring a full time Adobe Premiere Senior Video Editor with at least 5 years of experience to create 3 to 4 minute animal rescue mini documentaries for our growing YouTube channel.



Pay: $1,200+ USD per month, negotiable based on experience

Full time - Remote - Long term position

 

About Us

We create short, emotionally powerful rescue stories that document animals being rescued, rehabilitated, and adopted. Our goal is to inspire action and grow a loyal audience.

 

Responsibilities

• Edit 3 documentary-style videos per week (3–4 minutes each)

• Transform interview-based story outlines into polished mini documentaries by selecting and integrating the strongest rescue footage

• Proactively identify gaps in footage and request additional materials as needed

• Select music that enhances emotional impact

• Add captions and provided graphics

• Perform basic color correction

• Receive feedback, collaborate on creative direction, and suggest ideas to improve retention and overall quality

Requirements

• At least 5 years of YouTube editing experience

• Strong editing and storytelling skills

• Proficiency in Adobe Premiere

• Reliable high-speed internet and your own editing setup

• Solid understanding of YouTube retention and audience engagement

• Reliable, communicative, and able to work independently

• Animal lover with genuine interest in rescue content

Nice to Have

• Experience with L
 and Premiere Productions

• Thumbnail design experience in Photoshop

 

How to Apply

Follow these instructions carefully. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

1. Start your application with "rescue stories"

2. Send 2–3 video samples that showcase emotional storytelling

3. Answer: What is the most important part of a YouTube video?

4. Include your upload and download speeds from a recent speed test

5. Include your desired monthly salary in USD



We’re looking for a creative partner who cares about animals as much as we do. If you can make someone cry happy tears in under 4 minutes, we want to hear from you.

title: Google Ads/PPC Manager
description:
Job description:

About LionHead Digital:

LionHead Digital is a leading digital marketing agency that helps criminal defense, personal injury, and family law firms grow through advanced SEO, Local SEO, Local Service Ads, Google paid ads, custom web design, and AI-powered intake systems. For more than 9 years, we have supported law firms across the United States with a full suite of digital marketing services that are built to drive real cases and measurable revenue.

We operate like an internal marketing department for our clients, tracking every lead, reporting verified leads each month, and showing firms exactly which leads turned into qualified cases. This focus on transparency, accountability, and signed case reporting sets us apart from typical agencies.

Our vision is to become the most elite and trusted law firm digital marketing partner in the United States, serving one thousand law firms within the next decade.



Role Overview

The Google / PPC Ads Manager owns the end-to-end strategy, execution, optimization, and performance of paid media campaigns (primarily Google Ads, but may include other PPC platforms as defined).

This role is responsible for turning approved strategy and budgets into qualified leads, controlled CPLs, and scalable results, while maintaining clear communication with Operations, Client Success, and leadership.

This is a performance-driven, data-heavy role that sits between Strategy, Fulfillment, and Client Success.



Primary Objective

Drive consistent, profitable lead generation through well-structured, optimized PPC campaigns while maintaining accuracy, transparency, and accountability in reporting and execution.



Core Responsibilities

1. Campaign Strategy & Setup

Own PPC strategy once a client is marked Fulfillment-Ready

Review client goals, market, budget, and signed scope

Build campaign structure aligned with services, locations, and intent

Set up campaigns, ad groups, keywords, conversion tracking and events, bidding strategies and budgets, ensure campaigns are compliant with platform and industry policies

2. Account & Asset Validation

Validate access to:

Google Ads account

Google Analytics / GA4

Conversion tracking (GTM, website, forms, calls)

Review landing pages for relevance, clarity, and conversion readiness

Flag missing assets, tracking gaps, or structural issues before launch

Coordinate fixes with Dev, SEO, or Ops as needed

3. Campaign Launch & Optimization

Launch campaigns based on approved timelines

Monitor performance daily during early launch phase

Optimize keywords and match types, Ad copy and extensions, budgets and bids, search terms and negative keywords, ensure CPL, lead quality, and spend pacing remain within targets

4. Performance Monitoring & Reporting

Track and analyze key PPC metrics:

Spend, CPL, conversions, CTR, Quality Score

Maintain accurate reporting dashboards and notes

Flag underperformance early with a clear action plan

5. Cross-Team Coordination

Work closely with CSMs for client context and feedback, SEO / Content for keyword alignment and messaging, Web / Dev for landing page improvements, Operations for capacity and prioritization

Ensure changes are documented and aligned with client expectations

6. Process Adherence & Improvement

Follow documented PPC SOPs and playbooks

Maintain clean account structure and naming conventions

Identify recurring issues (tracking, approvals, lead quality, budget limits)

Propose improvements to campaign frameworks, QA checklists, Reporting templates, Automation and rules

7. Internal Marketing

Plan, launch, and optimize Internal Google Ads / PPC campaigns (lead generation, hiring, offers, brand initiatives)

Align internal campaign goals with leadership and Operations

Manage budgets, tracking, and performance reporting for internal campaigns

Apply learnings from client campaigns to improve LionHead’s paid media strategy

Ensure internal campaigns follow the same QA, tracking, and optimization standards as client work



Key Success Metrics:

Cost Per Lead (CPL) vs target

Lead volume consistency

Conversion tracking accuracy (zero broken tracking)

% of campaigns launched on time

Reduction in wasted spend (irrelevant search terms)

Client satisfaction related to paid media performance

Performance of internal PPC campaigns (CPL, conversions, spend efficiency)

Consistency and accuracy of tracking for internal campaigns

Key Expectations

Performance Ownership & Accountability:

Take full ownership of PPC performance, ensuring campaigns consistently meet or exceed agreed CPL, lead volume, and quality targets.

Data-Driven Decision Making:

Make optimization and scaling decisions based on performance data from Google Ads, GA4, conversion tracking, and CRM feedback—not assumptions.

Strategic Execution:

Design and manage scalable, intent-driven campaign structures aligned with client goals, budgets, and market realities.

Clear Communication & Reporting:

Communicate performance insights, risks, and action plans clearly to Client Success, Operations, and leadership.

Results-Oriented Mindset:

Focus on measurable outcomes that directly impact lead quality, client retention, and revenue growth.

Autonomy & Ownership:

Operate independently with strong judgment, proactively identifying issues and opportunities without needing constant oversight.



Requirements

3-5+ years of hands-on Google Ads / PPC management experience (agency or in-house).

Proven experience managing multiple accounts with measurable performance results.

Deep expertise in Google Ads campaign structure, bidding strategies, keywords, match types, and Quality Score optimization.

Strong understanding of conversion tracking, GA4, GTM, call tracking, and CRM attribution.

Experience managing budgets responsibly and optimizing spend efficiency.

Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and translate insights into clear actions.

Strong communication and documentation skills.

Experience working cross-functionally with SEO, Web, Content, and Client Success teams.

Ability to stay current with PPC platform updates, policy changes, and best practices.



Benefits & Perks:

Competitive Compensation: Attractive base salary with quarterly and end-of-year performance bonuses

Generous PTO: Paid time off and holidays for a great work-life balance.

Employee Recognition Programs:

Employee of the Month Award with incentives.

Employee of the Year Award - winner receives an all-expenses-paid vacation for themselves and their family.

Team Culture: Supportive, high-performance team that values results, efficiency, and continuous learning.

Impactful Work: Your strategies will directly contribute to law firm success, and your contributions will be valued and rewarded.



Next Steps:

ed immediately upon completion of the Behavioral assessment:

title: Personal & Business Financial Operations Manager
description:
I am an entrepreneur based in Maryland, USA. My wife and I are looking for a highly organized and financially intelligent professional to help us build structure around our personal and business finances.



We get paid consistently. Revenue is not the issue.



The issue is structure.



We need someone who can help us:



• Create clear monthly budgets

• Allocate income intentionally

• Build a loan payoff strategy

• Track spending and savings

• Implement financial dashboards

• Organize business financial tracking

• Separate personal vs business cash flow properly

• Help us build a long-term wealth plan



This is not just bookkeeping.



This is financial architecture.



We want someone who:

• Understands budgeting deeply

• Can build structured allocation systems

• Thinks long-term (wealth building, debt elimination, investing)

• Is proactive and strategic

• Can meet weekly on Zoom

• Can build and maintain clean spreadsheets / dashboards

• Has strong English communication skills



Bonus if you:

• Understand US tax basics

• Have worked with entrepreneurs

• Understand budgeting software like Monarch, YNAB, QuickBooks, etc.

We use Monarch



?



Responsibilities:

• Develop structured loan payoff plan

• Track savings goals

• Create allocation system for income

• Provide weekly financial review reports

• Flag inefficiencies and leaks

• Help us implement discipline + structure

title: Cold Email Campaign Manager (High-Volume B2B Outreach)
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing B2B lead generation agency that helps professional service firms (insurance agencies, law firms, IT companies, financial advisors, and property maintenance companies) fill their pipeline with qualified prospects. We send high-volume, hyper-personalized cold
 campaigns across multiple industries and we need someone who can own the entire
 operation from list building to lead delivery.



This is not a "send 500
s a week" role. We operate at scale — tens of thousands of
s per day across hundreds of inboxes. If you have never managed infrastructure at this level, this role is not for you. If you have, keep reading.



What You Will Do Every Day



Campaign Operations (60% of your time)



You will manage the end-to-end cold
 process for multiple clients across different industries. This includes building targeted lead lists using B2B data platforms, writing and loading
 sequences into the sending platform, scheduling campaigns across rotating inboxes, and monitoring deliverability metrics (open rates, bounce rates, spam complaints) daily. You will manage 100+ sending inboxes and ensure every one stays healthy.



Deliverability Management (20% of your time)



You will own inbox warming, domain health, and sender reputation across all accounts. This means monitoring inbox placement rates, rotating underperforming domains, managing DNS authentication records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and proactively pausing or replacing inboxes before they damage the overall sending reputation. You will run deliverability tests weekly and report results.



Lead Processing & Delivery (10% of your time)



When prospects reply, you will categorize responses (interested, maybe later, not interested, out of office, wrong person) and deliver qualified warm leads to clients via Google Sheets or CRM. Speed matters — warm leads must be delivered within 2 hours of reply during business hours.



Reporting & Optimization (10% of your time)



You will maintain a weekly performance dashboard for each client showing
s sent, open rates, reply rates, positive reply rates, and meetings booked. You will run A/B tests on subject lines, opening lines, and CTAs, and make data-driven recommendations to improve performance.









Required Experience & Skills



You must have hands-on experience with at least two of the following cold
 sending platforms: Smartlead, Instantly, Lemlist, Woodpecker, or Mailshake. You should be comfortable managing campaigns with 50+ active sending accounts simultaneously.



You must understand
 deliverability at a technical level — not just "warm up your inbox" but the actual mechanics of SPF/DKIM/DMARC configuration, inbox rotation strategies, and how to diagnose and fix deliverability drops.



You must have experience with B2B lead data platforms for building targeted prospect lists. You should know how to filter by industry, company size, job title, geography, and other criteria to build high-quality lists that match a client's ideal customer profile.



You must be proficient in Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, data cleanup formulas) since this is how we track leads and report to clients.



Strong written English is required. You will be writing and editing
 copy that goes to American business owners — it must sound natural, not templated.









Preferred (Bonus) Skills



Experience with Clay or similar data enrichment tools for adding personalization layers to lead lists. Experience using AI (ChatGPT, Claude) to generate personalized
 icebreakers at scale. Familiarity with Google Workspace admin for managing multiple inboxes. Experience with Zapier, Make, or n8n for workflow automation between platforms.









How to Apply



In your application, answer these four questions:



1.

What is the largest number of sending inboxes you have managed at one time, and what sending platform were you using?



2.

Describe a time when your
 deliverability dropped significantly. What caused it and how did you fix it?



3.

What is your process for building a lead list of 10,000 business owners in a specific industry and geography?



4.

Show me an example of a hyper-personalized cold
 you wrote (or generated with AI). What data points did you use to personalize it, and where did you get that data? If you cannot share a real example, write one right now for a fictional insurance agency owner named Mike Thompson who runs a 12-person agency in Dallas, TX.



Do not send a generic cover letter. Applications that do not answer these four questions will not be reviewed.

title: Social Media & Content Strategy Manager
description:
Focus: Organic growth, thought leadership, and high-quality execution



About the Role

We are looking for a Social Media Manager who can translate complex ideas about neuroscience, trauma, and behavior change into clear, compelling, and emotionally intelligent content. This role supports a personal brand rooted in credibility, depth, and long-term trust, not trends or gimmicks.



This is not an influencer or 
 account.

This is a thought leadership brand in neuroscience, performance, and emotional intelligence.



You will be responsible for helping shape and execute a content strategy that grows an audience organically and positions the founder as a trusted voice in the field.



Core Responsibilities

- Content Strategy & Planning

- Build and manage a weekly content plan aligned with brand pillars

- Translate high-level ideas into clear post concepts

- Identify repeatable content formats and series

- Support long-term visibility and audience trust, not short-term virality



Content Creation & Editing

- Draft captions and short-form scripts

- Shape educational and emotionally resonant posts

- Repurpose content across platforms (Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)

- Ensure tone is grounded, warm, intelligent, and human



Brand Voice & Positioning

- Maintain consistency with founder’s voice and values

- Protect emotional safety and credibility in messaging

- Avoid hype, fear-based marketing, or shallow trends

- Help position the brand as authoritative and trustworthy



Performance & Optimization

- Track saves, shares, comments, and profile growth

- Identify what resonates and refine strategy

- Recommend what to repeat, what to drop, and what to evolve

- Focus on learning systems, not vanity metrics



Audience Growth (Organic)

- Identify aligned collaboration opportunities

- Support podcast clips, reposts, and distribution strategies

- Help content travel through trusted networks

- Assist with outreach to aligned creators or platforms



Who You Are

You likely have:

- 2–3 years experience managing social media for a brand or thought leader

- Strong writing and synthesis skills

- Comfort with educational or science-based content

- Ability to turn complex ideas into clear, relatable language

- Emotional intelligence and respect for sensitive topics

- A calm, organized working style

- High integrity and transparency in your work



You are not:

- Trend-obsessed

- Focused on gimmicks or shock tactics

- Dependent on templates without thinking

- Overly promotional or salesy



Must-Have Skills

- Excellent written English

- Strong conceptual thinking

- Content planning and structure

- Basic analytics understanding

- Ability to take feedback and iterate

- Organized and self-directed

- Comfortable working with a founder-led brand



Bonus Skills

- Background in psychology, neuroscience, or wellness

- Experience with personal brands or experts

- Light video editing or Canva skills

- Experience repurposing long-form into short-form



Important Notes:

This role is for someone who wants to grow into strategic content leadership, not just schedule posts. You will be working with sensitive material about trauma, beliefs, and behavior change. Emotional maturity and good judgment are required.



Send your application with the subject: Social Media Manager Application - [Full Name]

title: Social media marketing manager
description:
Role Summary

The Virtual Assistant is responsible for the execution, management, and reporting of all 

digital marketing systems for the business. This role does not involve strategy creation, branding

recorded content provided by leadership.

Primary focus areas:

• YouTube (long-form, shorts, ads)

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES OVERVIEW

The VA is accountable for:

• Building and maintaining YouTube infrastructure

• Monitoring performance and reporting results

• Ensuring consistency, compliance, and execution accuracy

YOUTUBE – BUILD, MANAGE, SCALE

YouTube Channel Management

Channel Setup & Optimization

The VA is responsible for:

• Channel optimization (banner, bio, links)

• Write descriptions with keywords and links

• Add relevant tags

• Create thumbnail in Canva

• Add chapters/timestamps

• Schedule publishing

YouTube Shorts (3–5 per week)

• Upload to:

o YouTube Shorts

o Instagram Reels

o TikTok

• Maintain posting consistency

YouTube Ads Management

Ad Types

• Set geographic targeting (approved service areas only)

o View rate

Weekly:

• Videos posted

• Watch time

• Subscriber growth

Monthly:

• Best-performing videos

• Shorts performance

• Ad spend vs results

• Recommendations for optimization (not new ideas)

Google Ads Account Setup

The VA is responsible for:

• Structuring the Google Ads account correctly

• Separating campaigns by intent

• Connecting landing pages

• Ensuring all conversion tracking works properly

Google Ads Campaign Types

1. Search Ads – Seller Intent

• Keywords focused on selling homes

• Traffic sent to home valuation or seller consultation pages

2. Search Ads – Buyer Intent

• Keywords focused on buyers

• Traffic sent to buyer consultation pages

3. Brand Protection Campaign

• Business name

• Team name

• Individual name

• Common misspellings

Purpose: prevent competitors from capturing branded traffic.

Google Ads Execution Responsibilities

Setup

• Keyword research (local, high intent)

• Campaign and ad group creation

• Writing compliant ad copy

• Adding extensions (call, location, lead form where approved)

• Setting geographic targeting

• Setting ad schedules

Ongoing Management

• Weekly search term review

• Adding negative keywords

• Bid adjustments

• Budget pacing

• Pausing low-performing ads

• Scaling winning keywords and ads

Conversion Tracking (Required)

The VA must ensure tracking for:

• Form submissions

• Phone calls

• Booking confirmations

• Thank-you page views

Tools:

• Google Ads

• Google Analytics

• Google Tag Manager

No ads run without confirmed conversion tracking.

Google Ads Reporting

Weekly:

• Spend

• Leads generated

• Cost per lead

• Top converting keywords

Monthly:

• Campaign comparison

• Buyer vs seller performance

• Conversion rates

• Optimization actions taken

SOCIAL MEDIA – POSTING & 

DISTRIBUTION

Platforms Managed

•

• Instagram

• TikTok

• YouTube Shorts

Posting Expectations

• Flag leads for follow-up

• Maintain brand voice consistency

TOOLS THE VA MUST USE

REPORTING & COMMUNICATION

• Issues or flags

Monthly Deliverables

• Platform growth

• Optimization actions taken

PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS

The VA is evaluated on:

• Consistency of execution

• Accuracy of setup

• Lead delivery reliability

• Reporting clarity

• Proactive optimization (not new strategy

title: Bookkeeping & Accounting Assistant
description:
Bookkeeping & Accounting Assistant (Part-Time, Remote)

We are a US-based e-commerce and operations company seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Bookkeeping & Accounting Assistant to support our finance team.

This role focuses on bookkeeping, reconciliation, and accounting support. It is not a CFO, controller, or decision-making role. Tasks are structured, repeatable, and process-driven.

The position will begin with clearly defined responsibilities and gradually take over additional bookkeeping and accounting tasks as systems and workflows are documented.

________________________________________

Primary Responsibilities

•	Record and categorize transactions accurately

Nice to Have

________________________________________

Hours & Schedule

Please briefly describe your bookkeeping experience and the accounting software you have used.

title: Content Writer (Healthcare Articles) – Pulse Digital Health
description:
Pulse Digital Health (www.pulsedigital.health) is a specialist digital agency focused on healthcare clinics and medical brands in the UK. We are looking for a highly skilled Content Writer with strong healthcare writing experience and native?level English to create clear, engaging, and accurate articles for our clients.



Role overview

You will write high?quality, patient?friendly and clinician?appropriate articles for healthcare clients, covering medical conditions, treatments, procedures, and clinic services. This is an article?based role: you will be paid per article (or per 100 words), and you will work closely with our SEO and strategy team who will provide topics, briefs, and key points to cover.



Key responsibilities

- Write clear, accurate, and engaging healthcare articles based on detailed briefs (conditions, treatments, clinics, and patient information).

- Take complex medical information and turn it into content that is easy for patients and the public to understand while remaining accurate and responsible.

- Follow brand voice, style, and tone guidelines for different clinics and healthcare providers.

- Incorporate SEO guidelines provided by our SEO team (keywords, headings, structure, internal links) in a natural and reader?friendly way.

- Fact?check content using reputable clinical and healthcare sources and ensure claims are appropriate and responsible.

- Revise content based on feedback from our team or clients and maintain high editorial standards.



Requirements

- Proven experience writing healthcare or medical content (for clinics, hospitals, health brands, or health publishers).

- Native?level English, with excellent grammar, clarity, and flow.

- Strong portfolio of healthcare?related articles or similar content (please include links or samples).

- Ability to follow structured briefs and write to specific SEO and formatting guidelines.

- Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy and sensitivity in medical topics.

- Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple article assignments.



Working arrangement and payment

- Freelance / per?article arrangement.

- Remote role, collaborating with the Pulse Digital Health team.

- Payment is per article or per 100 words (to be agreed based on experience and quality).



How to apply

Please send:

- Your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile.

- 3–5 samples of healthcare or medical articles you have written (links or attachments).

- A brief description of your healthcare writing experience (types of topics, audiences, and clients you have worked with).

- Your expected rate per article and/or per 100 words (please be specific in your application).



Applications without clear healthcare writing samples and a clear expected rate (per article or per 100 words) will not be considered.

title: SEO Manager (Healthcare Clients) – Pulse Digital Health
description:
Pulse Digital Health (www.pulsedigital.health) is a specialist digital agency focused on healthcare clinics and medical brands in the UK. We are looking for an experienced SEO Manager to lead and execute SEO for multiple healthcare clients.



Role overview

You will own SEO strategy and implementation for a portfolio of healthcare clients, managing projects from initial audit and strategy through to ongoing optimisation, reporting, and performance improvements. You’ll collaborate with our content writer and wider team, but you will be the person ultimately responsible for SEO results.



Key responsibilities

- Develop and implement end?to?end SEO strategies for multiple healthcare clients (on?page, off?page, and technical).

- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and opportunity identification aligned with each client’s services and locations.

- Perform SEO audits (technical, on?page, site structure) and create clear action plans.

- Brief and collaborate with our content writer on SEO?led content topics, outlines, and optimisation requirements (you do not need to write content yourself).

- Optimise landing pages, service pages, and blog content for rankings, traffic, and conversions.

- Manage and monitor technical SEO issues (indexation, crawlability, page speed, internal linking, schema, etc.) and coordinate with developers when needed.

- Set up and maintain performance tracking using tools such as Google Analytics/GA4, Google Search Console, and other SEO platforms.

- Produce regular performance reports for clients, with clear insights and recommended next steps.

- Take full ownership of SEO projects from start to finish, ensuring tasks are prioritised, delivered on time, and aligned with client goals.



Requirements

- Minimum of 2 years’ hands?on SEO experience, ideally in an agency or across multiple websites.

- Strong analytical skills, comfortable working with data, performance reports, and identifying actionable insights.

- Demonstrated experience managing SEO projects end?to?end (audit, strategy, implementation, reporting).

- Solid understanding of on?page, technical, and off?page SEO best practices.

- Experience with common SEO and analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics/GA4, Google Search Console, keyword research tools, rank tracking tools).

- Strong organisational and project management skills; able to manage multiple clients and deadlines.

- Good written and spoken English, especially for communicating insights and recommendations clearly.

- Experience with healthcare, medical, or local service businesses is a plus (but not essential).

- Agency experience strongly welcomed.



Working hours and arrangement

- Full?time (5 days per week) or part?time (4 days per week) options available.

- You must be able to work during UK office hours.

- Remote role, working closely with the Pulse Digital Health team.

- Please note that this should be your main job, not a job on the side.



How to apply

Please send:

- Your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile/portfolio.

- A brief description of your most relevant SEO experience (especially with service?based or healthcare clients, if applicable).

- 2–3 examples of projects where you managed SEO from start to finish and the results achieved.

- Your expected monthly pay (for 4?day or 5?day per week arrangements, specify both if you are open to either).



Applications without a clear expected pay will not be considered.

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 1a
description:

/cro-shopify-web-developer/



CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

title: Assistant for Law Firm
description:
We are a fast-growing, high-paced immigration law firm specializing in business, investor, and employment-based immigration cases. Our firm is dedicated to providing exceptional client service and efficient legal solutions for individuals, entrepreneurs, and companies navigating the U.S. immigration system.  



Position Overview:



We are seeking a long-term, proactive, and highly organized Virtual Assistant to support our legal and administrative team. The ideal candidate will take initiative, think critically, and help identify opportunities to improve efficiency and client experience as the firm continues to grow.



Key Responsibilities:



 • Communicate professionally with clients, potential leads, and business partners via phone,
, and video calls.

 • Schedule client consultations, attorney meetings, and follow-up appointments using online calendar tools (e.g., Google Calendar).

 • Call and qualify potential leads by gathering initial information about their immigration needs and relaying details to the legal team.

 • Maintain and update client management systems (e.g. CRM tools).

 • Track communication logs and ensure follow-up tasks are completed promptly.

 • Provide administrative support for case management, including intake coordination and basic document collection.

 • Proactively suggest and implement process improvements that enhance client engagement and business development.

 • Handle ad hoc administrative tasks to assist attorneys and paralegals in daily operations.



Requirements:



- Previous experience in a law firm or professional administrative role preferred.  

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

- Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities.  

- Comfortable making outbound calls and engaging with clients and leads.  

- Knowledge of immigration law terminology is a plus but not required; training will be provided.  

- Proficiency with Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, and CRM or case management software.  

- Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace for client calls.  



Ideal Candidate Attributes:



- Professional, polite, and confident demeanor.  

- Quick learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment.  

- Detail-oriented and self-motivated with minimal supervision.  

- Positive attitude and commitment to client satisfaction.  



We are looking for someone to join the team on a long term basis.

title: Experienced Graphic Designer / Photo Retoucher
description:
We’re hiring an experienced Graphic Designer and Photo Retoucher with real estate experience who understands how to create clean, professional, high-converting visuals across digital and print.



This role is for someone who knows how to design with clarity and purpose. You understand branding, layout, hierarchy, and how visuals influence attention and trust, especially in real estate marketing.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have real estate design experience and understand what makes listings visually credible and market-ready? Do you know how to design social posts and brochures that look clean, professional, and on-brand without overcomplicating them? Do you move fast when timelines are tight and still pay attention to spacing, alignment, and small details?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Social & Digital Design

- Design YouTube branding assets including thumbnails, banners, and episode graphics.

- Create Instagram listing posts, announcements, ads, and story graphics.

- Develop and maintain branded social templates for consistent output.



Print Design

- Design real estate yard signs and signage.

- Create listing brochures and marketing flyers.

- Prepare clean, print-ready files with correct sizing and bleed settings.



Real Estate Photo Editing

- Edit listing photos for lighting, color correction, and clarity.

- Clean up images by removing distractions and enhancing presentation.

- Ensure final images look professional while remaining realistic.



Brand Consistency & Organization

- Maintain consistent fonts, colors, and layout standards

- Ensure all visuals align with company branding

- Organize design files clearly for future use



Requirements:

- Proven experience in real estate graphic design, required

- Strong portfolio showing real estate social and print work, required

- Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Lightroom), or similar tools

- Strong understanding of layout, spacing, and visual hierarchy

- Experience preparing print-ready files

- Experience editing real estate photos

- Ability to work quickly without sacrificing quality

- Strong communication skills

- Ability to follow brand guidelines

- A stable, high-speed internet connection

- Growth mindset



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Light motion graphics

- Understanding of social media performance metrics

- Basic copy awareness (headline spacing, readability, CTA placement)



NOTE: This is a project-based role with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Graphic Designer with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

As a Project Coordinator, you’ll play a vital role in supporting our B2C customers, helping individuals access high-quality translations for personal documents, applications, and life events. This role combines customer service and project management: you’ll guide customers through their request, clarify requirements, prepare quotes, and coordinate the translation process end-to-end. Your daily activities will involve intricate collaboration with clients, translators, and our internal Production team to facilitate seamless translation projects.



This role is fast-paced. You’ll handle a high volume of small, quick-turnaround projects, responding to customer enquiries, preparing quotes, and ensuring each job is delivered accurately and on time. You will leverage your meticulous coordination and communication skills to manage project resources, maintain excellent client relationships, and ensure our operational and financial systems are up-to-date and accurate.





Key Responsibilities

• Respond to online chat enquiries, phone calls, and
s in a timely and helpful manner, ensuring that all client requests are acknowledged and actioned efficiently.

• Provide an exceptional level of customer service by being prompt, professional, and courteous in all client interactions.

• Prepare quotes, process payments, and clarify any missing information needed to begin the job.

• Manage a high volume of small translation jobs, each with short turnaround times and precise requirements.

• End to end project coordination of translation projects, including managing project scope, deadlines, resource assignments and project budgets.

• Coordinate with translators and other vendors ensuring that they have all the necessary information and resources to complete assignments.

• Continually monitor project progress, making adjustments as necessary to ensure project completion within timelines and budgets.

• Manage most project types reasonably autonomously.

• Ensure compliance with industry standards - ISO-17100 and ISO-18587.

• Support the quality management process, including proofreading documents and reviewing video synchronization.

• Use appropriate tools and systems to analyse files and prepare them for translation, and to convert and publish translated files.

• Participate in daily, weekly and monthly meetings with the Production team, to ensure that projects are being effectively managed.

• Develop and maintain business relationships with assigned clients and ensure that their experience with is world-class.

• Input data accurately and in a timely fashion into our operational & financial systems.

• Escalate any issues or roadblocks in a timely manner to the relevant stakeholders or management.

• Proactively communicate with clients to provide updates, confirm requirements, and clarify queries to ensure accuracy and satisfaction.

• Work regular weekend and evening (AU-time) hours.





Desired Skills & Qualifications

• At least 1–2 years of experience working in the translation and localisation industry

• Operations or project coordination experience

• Strong communication skills and excellent grasp of the English language, both written and spoken

• Excellent phone,
 and instant messaging communication skills, with a focus on providing prompt, professional and friendly client service

• High responsiveness to client enquiries across online chat, phone, and
 channels

• Excellent time management skills and the ability to work autonomously as well as collaboratively within a small team

• Exceptional interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with different personalities and stakeholders

• Attention to detail and a well-organised, detail-oriented approach to managing tasks and projects

• An understanding, appreciation and passion for cultural diversity

• Familiarity with current technologies such as desktop sharing, cloud services and VoIP

• Knowledge of online calendars and scheduling tools (e.g. Google Calendar)

• High proficiency with Google Suite applications and Microsoft Office

• An ability to learn and grow quickly

• Alignment with our core values

title: Web Design and Development
description:
Position Summary:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Web Designer and Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, coding, and modifying websites, from layout to function, according to the company’s specifications. Strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation.



Scope of Work:



Discovery Phase:

Review current website analytics and performance metrics.

Identify target audience personas and user journey maps.

Perform a competitive analysis of industry peers' websites.

Branding and design specificationS / Assets sharing



Planning Phase:

Develop a project timeline key milestones and deliverables with a number of hours and dates.

Define the website's information architecture and sitemap.

Create wireframes and mockups for key pages based on user requirements.

Determine the technology stack and content management system (CMS) to be used.



Design Phase:

Design a custom website layout that reflects the brand identity.

Ensure the website design is responsive and accessible across all devices.

Obtain feedback from the CEO (or other Company Rep) and make necessary revisions.



Development Phase:

Convert approved designs into functional web pages using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Integrate the website with a CMS (WordPress) for easy content management.

Develop custom features and functionality as outlined in the project requirements.

Implement responsive design techniques to ensure compatibility across devices and browsers.



Content Migration:

Transfer existing content to the new website, ensuring accuracy and consistency.

Optimize content for search engines (SEO) using relevant keywords and meta tags.

Create new content as needed to fill gaps identified during the discovery phase.



Testing and Quality Assurance:

Conduct thorough testing of the website's functionality, performance, and compatibility.

Fix any bugs or issues identified during testing.

Ensure compliance with web standards and accessibility guidelines (e.g., WCAG).



Training and Documentation:

Provide training to key Company Reps on how to use the CMS to manage website content.

Create documentation outlining website maintenance procedures and best practices.



Launch and Deployment:

Coordinate with web hosting providers to deploy the new website.

Implement redirects for any changed URLs to preserve SEO rankings.

Monitor website performance post-launch and address any issues as needed.

Deliverables:



Project plan and timeline.



Website wireframes and mockups.

Custom website design.

Fully functional website with CMS integration.

Content migration and optimization.

Testing and quality assurance reports.

Training materials and documentation.

Post-launch support and maintenance plan.

title: Social Ads Platform Manager
description:
We run a high-performance marketing agency. We move fast. We manage real budgets. Mistakes cost revenue.



We’re hiring a Social Ads Platform Manager who can fully own Meta ads inside an agency environment.



This is not an assistant role. This is ownership.



What You’ll Own



• Meta Ads Manager strategy, structure, and execution

• Campaign builds, naming conventions, targeting, and tracking

• Pixel, CAPI, event tracking, and troubleshooting

• QA before anything goes live

• Weekly performance reporting with actual insights

• Fixing problems before clients see them



Writing converting sales copy is a part of this job!



You are responsible for accuracy. Wrong locations, broken tracking, or lazy setups are not acceptable.



What We’re Looking For



• 3+ years running Meta ads inside an agency

• Experience managing multiple client accounts at once

• Deep understanding of conversion campaigns, lead gen, retargeting, and scaling

• Strong grasp of attribution, tracking, and backend setup

• Clear communicator who can explain performance without fluff

If you need hand-holding, this isn’t the role.



Bonus Points



• Google Ads experience

• GoHighLevel familiarity

• Experience in healthcare, legal, or high-ticket service industries



What You Get



• Quarterly profit-sharing bonuses

• Three weeks paid vacation

• The week between Christmas and New Year’s off

• All major U.S. holidays off

• Autonomy and real upside



We are building toward a $1M+ agency with high standards.

We need someone who treats client ad accounts like their own business.



If you want full ownership and the expectation of excellence, apply.

title: Creative Designer (Static Ads) — DTC Performance
description:
Your designs don’t just look good, they convert.

We’re looking for a creative designer who thinks in hooks, angles & outcomes — not just visuals.

You’ve got the skillset of a designer, and the mindset of an athlete.

If that sounds like you, read on.



This is NOT a “make it pretty” role: This is a performance design role.



What you’ll do

- Design high-converting static ads for Meta (primary channel)

- Translate hooks & angles into scroll-stopping visuals

- Think in ONE avatar – ONE desire – ONE dominant hook

- Iterate fast based on performance feedback, not opinions



You’re a fit if you:

- Have proven DTC e-commerce experience

- Understand Breakthrough Advertising (awareness levels, desire > features)

- Instantly recognize strong vs weak hooks

- Design for scroll-stop, clarity, and belief

- Think like a creative strategist, not a decorator

- Have a portfolio of paid social ads that performed

- Experienced with AI tools 



- BIG PLUS: if you can also video edit 



Can visually express:

- the benefit

- the problem

- the product

- or the product in action



You’re NOT a fit if you:

- Only focus on aesthetics

- Need long explanations to design

- Can’t come up with your own ad formats & structures

- Can’t independently research competitors & winning angles

- Prefer “creative freedom” over systems

- Don’t care about CTR, hold rate, or CPA



Tools

- Photoshop / Figma (Canva only if you’re elite with it)



What you get

- Performance-focused team

- Clear briefs & expectations

title: Researcher
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and intellectually curious Researcher to accelerate the development and validation of new ideas. This role involves establishing robust research practices, synthesizing findings into clear documentation, and providing insights that unify strategic decision-making across subsidiaries.



Adaptability is essential as you'll collaborate across diverse fields to help address global challenges in a dynamic, international environment. You will work closely with internal experts and directly participate in creating detailed economic and statistical models





Responsibilities



- Plan, coordinate, and execute research projects to inform strategic decisions using internal automation tools, external platforms, and manual research

- Manage multi-stakeholder documentation and projects across various development stages

- Extract insights from call recordings, interviews, videos, and articles to update vision documentation and subsidiary operating plans

- Produce clear, detailed, and accessible documentation for internal use

- Create detailed spreadsheet models incorporating economic, financial, and agricultural inputs provided by domain experts

- Perform price sensitivity analyses, scenario planning, and financial forecasting with consideration of variables such as inflation, appreciation, depreciation, and operational risks

- Collaborate closely with agricultural and economic domain experts to ensure accuracy and practical application of models





Requirements



- Excellent written, spoken, and visual communication skills in English

- Proficiency with spreadsheet tools (Google Sheets, Excel) and basic data visualization

- Ability or willingness to quickly learn statistical modeling tools such as Google Collab, Jupyter Notebooks, Python, or R

- Proven capability in building structured, logically sound, and easily auditable spreadsheet or notebook-based models

- Creative and flexible in problem-solving, capable of independently managing and structuring intensive workloads

- Attentive to details and highly proactive in communicating progress, obstacles, or needs for assistance

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and proactively seek feedback from colleagues

- Sociable and effective in collaborating with a diverse, global workforce





What we offer



- Flexible remote work environment

- Competitive compensation based on experience

title: Marketing Manager
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a smart, creative Marketing Manager who knows how to make things happen across digital platforms — someone who can lead campaigns, manage content, and grow engagement across B2B and B2C markets.



You’ll take ownership of our digital presence across HubSpot,
, Instagram, and LinkedIn, driving campaigns that attract leads, engage partners, and strengthen our brand. You’ll also coordinate with designers, copywriters, and contractors to deliver high-quality, consistent marketing that moves the needle.



Key Responsibilities

 • Develop and execute marketing strategies across B2B (dealers, partners, enterprise clients) and B2C (direct consumer and service brands) channels.

 • Manage and optimise campaigns in HubSpot, including
 automation, lead scoring, landing pages, and workflows.

 • Oversee social media channels 
, Instagram, LinkedIn) — content planning, scheduling, and reporting.

 • Manage digital advertising (Meta Ads, LinkedIn Campaign Manager, Google Ads) to drive awareness and conversion.

 • Coordinate updates and content on the WordPress website — either directly or via external web contractors.

 • Collaborate with internal teams and external consultants to produce case studies, videos, product materials, and campaign assets.

 • Track and report on marketing performance using HubSpot dashboards and analytics.

 • Maintain consistent brand messaging across all digital and physical channels.



About You



You’re equal parts creative and analytical — comfortable writing posts or ads one day, then digging into campaign performance the next. You’ve got a practical understanding of what works in modern digital marketing and you’re not afraid to get your hands dirty.



You’ll bring:

 • 3+ years of experience in marketing or digital communications (ideally with both B2B and B2C exposure).

 • Strong working knowledge of HubSpot (campaigns, automation, CRM integration).

 • Experience running and 
 campaigns across
, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

 • Solid understanding of WordPress (content management, SEO basics, plugin management).

 • Ability to brief and coordinate creative contractors (designers, videographers, copywriters, etc.).

 • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 • Strong sense of ownership and follow-through — you like seeing ideas come to life.



Nice to Have

 • Experience in the health, technology, or SaaS industries.

 • Familiarity with paid search (Google Ads) and remarketing campaigns.

 • Graphic design or video editing skills (Canva, Adobe suite, or similar).



Why You’ll Love It Here



You’ll join a team that values initiative, creativity, and results. We’re in a growth phase, so there’s room to make your mark — shaping how we show up online, how we talk to our customers, and how we drive business through smart, consistent marketing.



How to Apply



If this sounds like you, apply with:

 • Your CV and a short cover letter

 • A voice introduction of yourself recorded via 
 — just a quick minute telling us who you are and why you think this role fits you. Keep it casual, we just want to get a feel for your personality.

title: Contact Centre - Personal Services
description:
****Applicants must reside in Metro Manila****



We operate an emergency answering service for the elderly.



To be successful in this role you will need to have

- Fluent English, (Written and verbal)

- Familiarity with Australian/American culture

- Attention to detail

- Strong work ethic

- Good internet connection

- Live in Manila



Please respond to this advertisement with:

- Your Resume/CV

- Voice introduction of yourself through ----------

- Where you are based in Philippines



A little more about the role below.



About Us

The business operates, a 24-hour personal emergency call centre supporting ageing Australians and those living with a range of impairments.



About the Role

We are seeking Telephone Assistants who are passionate about aged care. You will have a caring nature, endless patience, and outstanding English communication skills that allow you to establish instant rapport with the client. You must be able to provide reassurance and support with kindness, while remaining friendly, calm and providing clear instructions when needed. An understanding of Australian and American culture would be a ---------- addition to answering incoming calls in response to a medical alarm activation, you will also be required to make outgoing calls to clients to check on their welfare, give reminders, or provide information about the services we provide.



The role suits anyone meeting the criteria and wanting a flexible role working from home anywhere in Australia. Nursing or medical students are welcome to apply.



Who are our Clients

The elderly, young adults, people needing assistance, those living independently, vulnerable adults, those with mental health issues, people recovering from surgery or injury, those aging in place, children and parents, friends and carers. These clients might be living at home or in a retirement village setting.



Job Type

This role is permanent carrying out regular shifts weekly including day, afternoon and night shifts between 4 hours and 8 hours in length.



Location and Equipment Needed

You would be required to work from a secure quiet location without interruption or background noise. A good internet connection is essential along with a reliable desktop or laptop computer.



Duties and Responsibilities

You will be required to carry out the following:

- Answer incoming calls within 10 seconds

- Follow appropriate scripts and instructions

- Triage calls according to the procedure to determine whether an ambulance is required

- Enter all call notes into the web-based ticketing system

- Provide Concierge service for clients (e.g. arranging appointments or transport)

- Provide medication reminder calls to clients

- Carry out customer on-boarding processes including explaining how the Rosie service operates

- Carry out on-line research

- Maintain a clean and safe workspace, and abide by work from home workplace health and safety policies and procedures

- Work in a shift work environment

- Other general administration tasks as directed by management.



Qualifications and Skills

The following qualifications and skills are required:

- Up to date Police Check (required prior to employment) - local police

- Excellent English communication skills, spoken and written

- Professional phone manner

- Strong computer/IT skills

- Familiarity with Microsoft Office programs

- Fast accurate typing

- Empathetic, patient and understanding

- Excellent customer service commitment

- Aged care experience desirable but not essential

- Contact centre experience highly desirable

- Clerk and administrative assistant experience desirable but not essential

- First Aid certificate or equivalent is desirable but not essential

- General understanding of business operations.



Training

All training will be given either in person or via the Microsoft Teams ---------- Candidates for the roll must be able to meet minimum proficiency standards in the following areas:

- Computer Platform Training - Theory and Practice Competency

- Telephone Triage - Theory and Practice Competency

- Privacy, Dignity and Confidentiality Training – Theory and Practice Competency

- Telephone Communications - Theory and Practice Competency

- Operations Manual Training - Theory and Practice Competency



Renumeration and Work hours

Part time staff will work based on rotating shifts and will be paid on the following basis:

- 8-hour or 4-hour shifts

- You must be at your desk and available to take calls and carry out assigned tasks for these shift times



Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all candidates and employees. We are committed to providing a selection process and workplace free of all forms of discrimination and harassment. Our employment choices are based entirely on the job requirements without regard to race, age, sex, colour, religion or belief, family or parental status. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind.

title: Airbnb & Property Management Rockstar | OwnerRez Expert (PST Shift)
description:
Are you an Airbnb Property Management Rockstar who is fast, efficient, and tech-savvy?



We are an established, San Francisco Bay Area-based property management firm with nearly 8 years of success in the Short-Term Rental (STR/Airbnb/VRBO) and Long-Term Rental (LTR) industry. We have built a reputation for excellence, and we are looking for a seasoned professional to join our stable, high-performing team.



We don’t just need "customer service"—we need an Airbnb & Property Management Expert who understands the mechanics of the industry, moves quickly, and never lets a detail slip through the cracks.



Why Join Us?

Proven Stability: Work for a company with an 8-year track record in Airbnb and LTR management.

High-Speed Environment: We value efficiency. If you are fast and productive, you will thrive here.

Professional Standards: We have clear processes in place—no "startup" guesswork.

100% Remote: Long-term, stable remote work from your home office.



The Requirements (Strict)

Please do not apply if you only have general Call Center/BPO experience. We require specific Airbnb and Property Management expertise.

Direct Experience: Minimum 2+ years managing Short-Term Rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and Long-Term Rentals.

PMS Mastery: Advanced proficiency in OwnerRez is highly preferred. You should know how to navigate workflows, triggers, and guest communication within the platform.

Operational Speed: Fast-thinking, fast-typing (60+ WPM), and able to handle multiple guest issues simultaneously.



Tech Stack: Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT), Time Doctor, and dual-monitor setups.



Your Responsibilities

Airbnb & Guest Management: Manage inquiries, bookings, and high-stakes resolution cases across Airbnb, VRBO, and direct sites.

Property Oversight: Coordinate check-ins/outs, send lease agreements, and monitor security.

Logistics & Maintenance: Schedule cleaning teams and review quality assurance photos.

Listing Optimization: Maintain and optimize Airbnb listings to ensure maximum occupancy and 5-star reviews.



Compensation & Benefits

Base Pay: Starting at $5/hour (Negotiable for extensive experience).

Schedule: Pacific Standard Time (PST) | Includes Weekends

Paid Leave: Accrued leave credits after 1 year.

Bonus: Performance-based bonuses.



How to Apply

To filter for the high-attention-to-detail candidates we need, please follow these steps exactly:



 your Resume to 
 Introduction: Record a brief intro highlighting your specific experience with OwnerRez, Airbnb, and STR/LTR management. (Share via Dropbox/Google Drive link).

Subject Line: Must be: [Property Management Specialist] – (Last Name, First Name)

Bonus: End your
 by telling us who the current Prime Minister of the United Kingdom is.
