title: Part time social media growth oleraror
description:
We are building a global authority brand in impact design and regenerative design. Our mission is to change how we build by replacing harmful building materials with healthy organic circular alternatives.



Our advantage is unique: a curated library of 400 plus vetted regenerative and sustainable materials, combined with a multi sensory design approach integrating sound, scent, light, and emotion. Your job is to turn this expertise into a disciplined short form content engine that builds authority and converts into opportunities: consulting, collaborations, partnerships, and speaking.



Platform focus

Primary platform is LinkedIn. The same short videos are repurposed to Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts.



This is not a posting role. This is a growth role.



Weekly deliverables

2 to 3 short videos per week, 30 to 60 seconds each

Posted on LinkedIn, then repurposed to Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts

Hooks, captions, titles, on screen text, and clear calls to action

Weekly performance recap and next week improvements



Availability

You must have daily overlap with Central European Time and be able to coordinate with the UK and UAE when needed. Preferred working window is CET 09:00 to 11:00 for coordination, approvals, and publishing.



Requirements

Proven track record scaling social accounts with real examples and links

Strong short form editing and storytelling skills

Understands hooks, retention, repurposing, and iteration

Comfortable extracting content from a founder brand using voice notes, interviews, talks, and project material

Must use AI and lightweight automation to increase output in a 6 hour per week role. This includes hook and script drafting, subtitles, repurposing, scheduling, and weekly analytics summaries. No generic AI content.



Compensation and bonus

$6 per hour for a 4 week trial at 6 hours per week. After the trial, $8 per hour if deliverables and quality are met. Bonus: $150 per new client closed for design and consulting services only, attributed to social media, paid after contract signature and first payment received. No bonus applies to product sales, including the 3D printed furniture line.



HOW TO APPLY  REQUIRED

To be considered, reply with all items below. Applications without these will not be reviewed.



1 Proof links

Share 3 links to accounts you personally helped grow. For each include: starting metrics, current metrics, time frame, posting cadence, and your exact role.



2 Monetisation or leads

Share 1 example where content produced leads or sales. Explain the conversion path.



3 References

Share 1 testimonial or LinkedIn recommendation and permission to contact 1 previous client.



4 Confirm test

Confirm you are open to a small paid 48 hour test for finalists only: five hooks, one script, and one edited short using our footage.



5 AI workflow

In 8 lines, describe your AI and automation workflow for a 6 hour per week role: tools you use, what you automate, and how it saves time.
salary: $6 per hour for a 2 week trial at 6 hour

title: SALES CLOSER - HIGH VOLUME
description:
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES



Make 250 cold calls per day



Speak with:



Builders



Real estate agencies



Childcare centres



Pharmacies



Commercial businesses



Residential clients



Qualify leads and book or close sales



Follow scripts and handle objections professionally



Work 40+ hours per week



WORK SCHEDULE



Start time: 5:30 AM Philippines time



Monday to Friday (additional hours may be required)



COMPENSATION



Base pay: $400 USD per month



Paid weekly: $100 USD



Salary increases available based on performance



Long-term opportunity for high performers



REQUIREMENTS



Sales or cold calling experience preferred but not mandatory



Strong English communication skills



High work ethic and consistency



Comfortable with rejection and call volume



Stable internet connection and quiet workspace



Available to start immediately



DO NOT APPLY IF



You are uncomfortable with cold calling



You cannot handle rejection



You require constant supervision



You are looking for an easy role



APPLICATION PROCESS (MANDATORY)



Do not apply unless you follow the instructions below.



All applicants must send a WhatsApp message to:


Answer all questions clearly and honestly:



What is the highest number of cold calls you have made in one day?



Why are you willing to make 250 cold calls per day?



How do you handle rejection repeatedly?



Describe your previous sales or call centre experience.



What time will you wake up daily to start work at 5:30 AM PH time?



What makes you different from most applicants?



Are you seeking comfort or growth? Explain.



Can you start immediately?



Applications without answers to all questions will be ignored.



If your answers meet our standards, you will be interviewed immediately to determine fit.

title: Credit Officer
description:
About the Role

You’ll be working with our Accounts Receivable team in Australia, helping to manage customer accounts, follow up on payments, and handle blocked orders. You’ll also help with account reconciliations, resolving payment issues, and making sure our customers pay on time.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage assigned customer accounts and follow up on payments

• Review blocked orders and help get them released quickly

• Negotiate payment plans with customers

• Send out statements and reminders

• Fix account errors and answer customer questions

• Flag high-risk customers and suggest next steps

• Work closely with the Credit Supervisor and team in Australia



What You Need

• 5+ years of experience in credit or collections

• Great English communication skills (written and spoken)

• Strong attention to detail and time management

• Able to work independently and solve problems

• Experience using ERP or accounting systems

• Knowledge of credit risk and collections processes



If you’re experienced, reliable, and ready to work with a great team, we’d love to hear from you!

Please send your resume and a short cover letter telling us why you're a great fit.

title: Real Estate Cold Caller – Wholesale Investing (Acquisition Focused)
description:
We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company looking for a disciplined and results-driven Cold Caller to generate motivated seller leads.



This is a wholesale investing role. You must be comfortable speaking with distressed or motivated property owners and qualifying them properly.



This is not a script-reading job. We need someone who understands how to control conversations and uncover motivation.



Your Responsibilities:



• Outbound cold calling to motivated seller lists

• Build rapport quickly

• Identify seller motivation

• Qualify using: Motivation, Timeline, Condition, Price

• Set qualified appointments for acquisition manager

• Log detailed notes in CRM

• Follow up consistently with warm leads

• Provide daily KPI report



Requirements:



• Prior experience in wholesale real estate cold calling (required)

• Strong objection handling skills

• Experience using multi-line dialers

• Experience with CRM systems

• Excellent English communication

• Stable internet and quiet work environment

• Must be available during U.S. business hours

• High level of accountability and communication





Compensation:



Hourly + performance bonus for signed contracts.



Long-term opportunity for the right candidate.



Paid Trial Period:



We will begin with a paid trial period (3–5 days) to evaluate performance, consistency, and communication.



If the trial is successful, this will turn into a long-term position with performance bonuses.



To Apply:



Please send:



Resume



Voice recording sample



Sample cold call with a motivated seller 



Your best month numbers (calls, conversations, appointments, contracts)



What dialers and CRM tools you have used



Applications without voice samples will not be reviewed.

title: TikTok Shop Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced TikTok Shop Manager to manage and scale our TikTok Shop. This

role involves product listing, compliance, inventory management, customer communication, and

driving consistent sales growth.

Responsibilities

TikTok Shop Management

- Manage TikTok Shop dashboard

- List, edit, and optimize products

- Ensure compliance with TikTok Shop policies

- Monitor and resolve violations

Product Listing & Optimization

- Upload products with optimized titles and descriptions

- Manage pricing, bundles, and promotions

Inventory & Orders

- Track inventory levels

- Manage fulfillment, returns, and refunds

Customer Communication

- Respond to customer messages

- Handle complaints and inquiries

Sales & Growth

- Drive sales using TikTok Shop features

Requirements

- Inventory management experience

Success Metrics

- High compliance rating

title: Elite Sales Closer / High-Income Commission Role – Unlimited Earning Potential
description:
We are hiring a highly confident, persuasive, and driven Elite Sales Closer to join our fast-growing team.



This is not a basic sales role. This is a high-performance position designed for individuals who are hungry, fearless, and motivated by income, results, and growth.



You will be handling extremely easy-to-close residential services along with commercial opportunities. Demand is strong, pricing is competitive, and conversions are high for the right communicator.



If you are confident on the phone, understand influence, and enjoy closing deals, this role can generate exceptional weekly income.



Compensation Structure:



• Base Pay: $100 per week (stability pay)

• Commission: 2.5% – 5% on every sale closed

• Commercial Incentive: $5 per confirmed commercial appointment



Commission activates after your first 5 sales each week.



Realistic Earning Potential (High Performers):



This role is intentionally structured to heavily reward closers.



High-performing tea
mbers regularly achieve:



• $500 – $1,000+ per week in commissions

• Strong closers can exceed $1,500+ per week

• Monthly bonuses available at volume milestones

• Top performers can scale into very high income levels



There is no earning cap. Income is purely tied to performance and output.



Targets & Bonuses:



• Minimum weekly target: 15 sales



Performance accelerators:



• Hit 18 sales ? Bonus reward

• Hit 20 sales ? Higher bonus

• Hit 25 sales ? Major weekly bonus



• Monthly milestone: 100 sales bonus



This structure rewards consistency, speed, and execution.



Daily Expectations:



• Book minimum 3 appointments per day

(Residential sales OR Commercial bookings)



Simple activity requirement. Strong earnings follow consistent action.



Who This Role Is Designed For:



We are ONLY looking for individuals with a strong sales mindset.



You must be someone who:



• Is confident and persuasive

• Has excellent spoken English

• Has no fear of rejection or objections

• Is highly driven by income and results

• Does not procrastinate

• Is not lazy

• Can work independently without being chased

• Understands that effort = income



This role is ideal for competitive personalities who enjoy winning and being rewarded for performance.



Important Note:



This is a performance-driven position. Those who take action, follow scripts, and stay consistent succeed quickly.



Those who hesitate, avoid calls, or lack urgency will struggle.

title: Virtual Assistant - Graduate/Entry Position
description:
At Sylaba Translations, we offer highly personalised, professional multilingual translation services, plain language editing, and training programs.



We are a small company based in Australia, with Operations and Marketing teams based in the Philippines. We are a very close-knit group of like-minded people looking for the next addition to the team.



As a Project Coordinator, you will be responsible for the following:

- Managing translation projects from beginning to end.

- Setting priorities and delivering quality results on time.

- Communicate effectively whilst responding to stakeholder needs and expectations across a geographically dispersed network.

- To act with discretion and integrity in managing sensitive and confidential information

- Well-developed organisational skills, knowledge, and experience in successfully setting priorities and delivering quality results within allocated timeframes and managing self-imposed and given deadlines.

- Analytical abilities with the ability to obtain accurate conclusions and apply innovative initiatives while contributing to change and business improvement strategies.



Required attributes:

- Excellent customer service via phone calls and
s. 

- Capable of dealing with frequent constructive or negative feedback. 

- Good coping mechanisms working in a fast-paced and high-stress environment. 

- Willingness to work overtime to assist tea
mbers in completing projects. 



What’s in it for you:

- A 3-month probation period, followed by full-time employment. 

- Works hours from 9am to 6pm AEDT/AEST, including 1-hour unpaid break. 

- Monday to Friday, weekends off. 

- A 2–3-hour time difference between Australian and Philippines time.

- Australian public holidays off and paid after the probation period.  

- 2 weeks of paid annual leave post-probation period.

- Training will be  provided.



If you’re interested in applying for this position, please respond to the following questions and
 them to 
 along with your CV in PDF form, and write "Project Coordinator” in the subject line:



1) Please provide a work-related example of each of the attributes we are looking for in a candidate.



• Excellent customer service via phone calls and
s. 

- Capability to deal with frequent constructive or negative feedback. 

- Good coping mechanisms working in a fast-paced and high-stress environment. 

- Ability to work overtime to help tea
mbers to finish projects. 



2) What would be the most basic documents we do for our clients? Why do you think that is?



3) If you were given a document above, what steps would you take to complete the service and ensure a happy customer?

5) Please state your preferred wages in PHP per month. 



Please note that only candidates with the best answers will be provided with the opportunity to move on to round 2 of interviews. 



We look forward to your response. Thank you for applying.

title: Advanced Drop Shipping Manager
description:
We are looking for an Advanced Dropshipping Manager with proven experience scaling profitable dropshipping stores. This role requires deep knowledge of product research, supplier management, order fulfillment, customer support systems, ad-to-fulfillment workflows, and platform compliance.



This is not an entry-level role. We are seeking someone who understands how to build, optimize, and scale dropshipping operations efficiently while minimizing risk, chargebacks, and platform issues.



?



Key Responsibilities



Store & Platform Management

 • Fully manage and optimize dropshipping stores (Shopify, TikTok Shop, or similar)

 • Ensure compliance with platform policies and payment processor rules

 • Monitor store health, disputes, chargebacks, and account risks

 • Implement SOPs for smooth daily operations



Product Research & Validation

 • Identify winning products using data-driven research

 • Analyze trends, competitor stores, and ad performance

 • Test products efficiently and scale proven winners

 • Remove underperforming or high-risk products



Supplier & Fulfillment Management

 • Source reliable suppliers (agents, private suppliers, or warehouses)

 • Negotiate pricing, shipping times, and quality control

 • Monitor fulfillment speed, tracking accuracy, and delivery success

 • Handle supplier issues, delays, and replacements



Order & Inventory Operations

 • Oversee order processing and fulfillment workflows

 • Track inventory levels and prevent stock shortages

 • Manage refunds, returns, and reshipments

 • Reduce delivery complaints and refund rates



Customer Support & Experience

 • Set up and manage customer support systems

 • Ensure fast, professional responses to customer inquiries

 • Handle escalations, disputes, and unhappy customers

 • Maintain high customer satisfaction and low chargeback rates



Sales & Scaling

 • Optimize product pages for conversions (pricing, bundles, upsells)

 • Collaborate on ad scaling strategies (TikTok, Meta, etc.)

 • Improve AOV, conversion rate, and customer retention

 • Scale stores while maintaining profitability and stability



Analytics & Reporting

 • Track KPIs: ROAS, CPA, profit margins, refund rate, delivery time

 • Identify bottlenecks and growth opportunities

 • Provide regular performance reports and actionable insights



?



Requirements

 • Proven experience managing successful dropshipping stores

 • Strong understanding of Shopify, TikTok Shop, or similar platforms

 • Experience with private suppliers or fulfillment agents

 • Deep knowledge of disputes, chargebacks, and risk management

 • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

 • Ability to work independently and scale operations efficiently

title: Assistant Property Manager with Contracts and Proposals Experience
description:
The Contracts and Proposals Specialist supports the Business Development team by preparing, reviewing, coordinating, and managing contracts and business proposals related to properties, owners, and real estate services. This role will work closely with internal teams to ensure all contracts and proposals are accurate, compliant, and aligned with company and regulatory standards. The position is fully remote and requires strong attention to detail, organization, and deadline management. 

This role also requires a higher degree of independent ownership across contract tracking, renewals, amendments, and cross-functional coordination



Responsibilities: 



Contracts Management: 

- Draft, review, and revise contracts such as property management agreements, and service contracts, lease-related addendums, NDAs, and amendments. 

- Ensure contracts comply with company policies, local real estate regulations, and property-specific requirements. 

- Coordinate contract reviews and approvals with Legal and leadership. 

- Track contract terms, renewals, expirations, and key obligations for managed properties. 

- Maintain organized digital contract files and contract trackers. 



Proposals: 

- Collaborate with Business Development Specialist to gather scope of work, pricing, and supporting documentation. 

- Customize proposals for property owners, HOAs, and commercial or residential clients. 

- Ensure proposals meet client requirements and submission deadlines. 



Real Estate and Property Operations Support: 

- Coordinate with internal teams on contract-related billing terms and service scopes. 

- Maintain proposal templates, contract templates, and content libraries specific to property management. 



Cross-Functional Coordination: 

- Serve as the primary point of contact for contract and proposal-related inquiries. 

- Provide regular status updates on contracts and proposals to internal stakeholders. 

- Identify opportunities to improve contract and proposal workflows. 



Compliance and Documentation: 

- Ensure confidentiality and proper handling of owner, tenant, and vendor information. 

- Support audits, due diligence requests, and internal reporting as needed. 

- Perform other related duties as assigned. 



Qualifications and Experience: 

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Legal Studies, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 

- 2-3+ years of experience in contracts administration, proposals management, or a related role within property management, real estate, or construction. 

- End-to-end contract lifecycle management within property management

- Experience supporting residential, commercial, or mixed-use properties is a strong advantage. 

- Familiarity with real estate contracts, vendor agreements, and property management operations. 

- Hands-on property management contract experience who can operate independently and support the Business Development team with minimal ramp-up.

- Direct experience with proposal drafting, RFP response development, or contract review/redlining. 

- Experienced in proposal writing and contract revisions.





Required Skills: 

- Strong knowledge of contracts related to property management and real estate services. 

- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills. 

- Strong written and verbal communication skills. 

- Ability to manage multiple properties, contracts, and deadlines simultaneously. 

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace. 

- Experience with contract management systems, e-signature tools, and project management platforms (e.g., Hubspot, DocuSign, SharePoint, Asana, Monday, AppFolio, Yardi, or similar tools). 

- Self-driven and able to work independently in a remote environment. 

- Strong follow-up, time management, and prioritization skills. 

- Collaborative and responsive when working with distributed teams. 

- Detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset. 



Working conditions:

- Full remote work (work anywhere).

- Work schedule is Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST) including the 30 minutes unpaid meal break.

- Comfortable working with Hubstaff (time tracker)



How to apply:

1. Please check out our website: 

2. Send an
 attachment with your updated resume in PDF format.

3. Please include a link to your voice recording introducing yourself & your relevant experience and include your OnlineJobs.PH profile link.

4. Kindly send your application to 
 the subject line, kindly indicate the position Contracts and Proposals Specialist - your name.



*Applicants who will not follow instructions will be automatically rejected without notice.

* Shortlisted applicants will be contacted by
 for interview scheduling.

Looking forward to working with you!

title: Assistant Property Manager with Finance Experience

 experience

title: Senior People & Culture Lead
description:
About the Role

As a Senior People and Culture Lead you’ll be providing support and services to Buddle Operations throughout all aspects of the Client and Remote Professional life cycle. This includes support across staff onboarding and offboarding, RP relations, staff engagement and other admin functions.





Key Responsibilities

Strategic HR & Culture Leadership

- Develop and implement People & Culture strategy aligned with business growth goals

- Build and maintain a high-performance, accountability-driven culture

- Design and oversee career progression frameworks (tiers, salary progression, promotions)

- Lead staff engagement initiatives for remote teams

- Act as an internal advisor to leadership on people-related decisions



Talent Lifecycle Management

- Onboarding & Workforce Planning

- Develop onboarding frameworks for new hires

- Provide a welcoming environment to the new hire by inviting and facilitating pre-client orientation (covering company policies discussion and cybersecurity knowledge check).

- Manage compliant onboarding processes (contracts, documentation, benefits enrollment)



Offboarding

- Oversee full and proper staff offboarding process (which includes conducting exit interviews and equipment turnover procedures and the likes)

- Endorsing exiting/cancelled RP for re-profiling to Buddle Operations

- Issue the Master Contract Agreement, ICC, Quitclaims documents to existing staff, ensuring that documents are signed and agreed upon.

- Conducting System Sweep, Final Tech Check with all offboarded RP, help with reprofiling, final pay computation and  clearance



Performance Management

- Implement structured performance review cycles

- Design improvement plans and disciplinary procedures when required

- Provide coaching for major infractions and maintain proper documentation and coaching logs (WW and up)

- Manage escalations involving client dissatisfaction or staff conduct issues

- Support leaders in handling terminations in compliance with PH labor standards



Compensation & Benefits Administration

- Overtime

- Holiday pay

- Deductibles

- Final pay

Assess potential implementation and administration of government-mandated contributions in the future:

- SSS

- Pag-IBIG

- Checking compliance regarding submissions of pay invoices. 



Labor & Statutory Compliance

Oversee drafting and review of:

- Contractor contracts

- Statements of Work

- Addenda

- Disciplinary notices

- Ensure proper documentation for due process in disciplinary actions

- Stay updated on changes in Philippine tax and labor regulations



Policy Development & Governance

- Ensure policies are aligned with both Philippine law and international client expectations

- Review, implement and create Business Continuity Procedures for all staff during emergencies or disruptions.



HR Systems & Reporting

- Maintain accurate staff data and compliance records

- Provide leadership with reports on:

- Headcount

- Attrition

- Engagement

- Compliance risks



Staff Engagement

- Organise ongoing and create new engagement activities working with a set budget allocation per quarter



Other Responsibilities

- Make necessary process suggestions and improvements which can help the team

- Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

- Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned later on



About You

- Minimum 3 years HR leadership experience in remote workforce or BPO/offshore staffing environment preferred

- You’re a quick learner and go where you need to go to get the job done. 

- Familiarity with various HR databases (BambooHR and Hubstaff is preferred)

- You have excellent communication skills, whether that be verbal or written, and know how to change your style of communication depending on your audience. 

- You have an understanding of people and how to create environments where they can be their best. 

- You have excellent organisation, project and time management skills 

- Ability to work autonomously and as a supportive team player - you can take a task and run with it but also look to contribute to the team (and celebrate the achievements!) 

- Ability to give and receive effective feedback with curiosity and respect

- Strong decision-making skills

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

- Strong analytical skills and the ability to adapt a measured approach in a fast-paced environment

- A strong commitment to continuous process improvement, initiatives and the ability to solve problems creatively



Key Competencies

-Executive communication

- Commercial awareness (balancing staff advocacy and business sustainability)

Finer Details

title: Senior Helpdesk Engineer
description:
HOW TO APPLY:



If you feel this position aligns with your skills and experience, please fill out the application form here:


/bepartofourteam.





We’re looking for a hands-on senior IT professional who can support clients at all levels while also leading or assisting with IT projects and driving innovative solutions.

Our senior tea
mbers are critical to supporting our awesome clients and their users. They leverage industry-leading tools and expertise to resolve complex issues, prevent future problems, and improve client IT environments.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys solving challenging technical problems while also designing and implementing improvements that make a real impact.



Key Responsibilities:



Client Support (All Levels)



Provide technical support to clients via phone,
, and remote access—handling everything from basic troubleshooting to advanced escalations.

Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues for multiple clients.

Perform O365 and Windows administration, user account management, and access provisioning.

Support and troubleshoot VOIP systems (e.g., 3CX).

Manage and maintain RMM and PSA tools (e.g., Datto, Halo).

Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance to improve team troubleshooting skills.





Projects & Innovation



Lead or assist with IT projects, e.g cloud migrations, system upgrades, deployments, and process automation etc.

Identify and implement solutions to reduce recurring issues and improve efficiency.

Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts to automate routine tasks and streamline operations.

Collaborate with vendors and clients to plan, test, and deliver new IT solutions.



Documentation & Communication



Log issues and resolutions accurately for future reference.

Communicate effectively with clients and vendors to ensure smooth resolutions and project delivery.



Requirements



Previous experience working in an MSP environment is a plus.

Excellent communication skills – able to have comfortable, friendly conversations in English without being overly formal or technical.

Strong attention to detail and follow-through – “never let it go until it’s solved.”

Demonstrable experience working with Windows systems (client/server) and O365 administration.

Proficiency in advanced troubleshooting methodologies.

Scripting skills, particularly in PowerShell, to automate tasks and improve efficiency.

Experience with VOIP systems and a solid understanding of network infrastructure.

Familiarity with RMM and PSA platforms used in MSP environments (e.g., Datto, Halo).

We are heavy users of Office 365 and Azure, so you’ll need to have solid experience and know the fundamentals or demonstrate skills in something very similar..

Ability to handle difficult tasks, set proper expectations, and deliver solutions within a reasonable timeframe.

Out-of-the-box thinker – proactive, creative, and always looking to improve processes.

Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure client satisfaction.

Ability to “figure things out,” even when facing new or unfamiliar technologies.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Customer Experience Specialist
description:
About Brands Capital Group

Brands Capital Group is a dynamic e-commerce company managing fast-growing brands across multiple platforms. We are committed to delivering exceptional customer experiences and maintaining strong brand reputation through proactive engagement and continuous improvement.



Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and empathetic Customer Experience Specialist to proactively engage with customers who have submitted negative reviews on Trustpilot. This role is critical in converting detractors into satisfied customers by understanding their concerns, facilitating resolutions, and gathering valuable feedback to improve our service quality.



The ideal candidate is confident in handling difficult conversations, demonstrates exceptional empathy, and has a proven track record in customer recovery or outbound calling. You will serve as the voice of our brand during sensitive interactions and play a key role in protecting and enhancing our online reputation.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Outreach & Engagement

Conduct professional outbound calls to customers who have posted negative reviews on Trustpilot

Practice active listening to fully understand customer concerns and identify root causes of dissatisfaction

Build rapport and demonstrate empathy while maintaining professionalism throughout all interactions

Manage call volume effectively while ensuring quality customer interactions



Issue Resolution & Coordination

Gather comprehensive feedback and document customer concerns accurately in the CRM system

Provide appropriate guidance or assistance within company policies and established guidelines

Coordinate with relevant internal teams (Customer Service, Operations, Product) to facilitate timely resolutions

Follow established escalation procedures for complex issues requiring management attention



Reporting & Continuous Improvement

Maintain detailed and accurate records of all customer interactions and outcomes

Identify recurring issues and trends in customer feedback for management review

Contribute insights to improve products, services, and customer experience

Meet or exceed call quality metrics and customer satisfaction targets



Qualifications

Required Experience & Background

2–3 years of experience in customer service, outbound calling, customer retention, or recovery roles

Proven track record handling dissatisfied customers, complaints, or sensitive customer situations

Experience with follow-up calls and customer feedback campaigns is highly desirable



Essential Skills & Competencies

Exceptional verbal communication and active listening skills

High emotional intelligence with strong empathy and patience

Conflict resolution and de-escalation abilities

Professional and composed demeanor when handling negative or hostile feedback

Strong problem-solving mindset with a customer-focused approach

Excellent time management and ability to handle high call volumes efficiently

Meticulous attention to detail in documentation and reporting

Ability to follow call scripts, guidelines, and escalation protocols



Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with Trustpilot or other online review management platforms

Experience in e-commerce or retail customer service

Background in customer retention, win-back campaigns, or reputation management



What We Offer

Fully Remote Role: Work from anywhere with a stable internet connection

Competitive Compensation

Impactful Work: Directly contribute to customer satisfaction and brand reputation

Professional Growth: Opportunity to work with fast-growing e-commerce brands and develop your customer service expertise

Autonomy & Ownership: Take initiative in resolving customer issues and improving processes

Long-Term Career Path: Growth opportunities within the customer experience team.



Ready to make an impact? Apply now by completing our application form:





We look forward to hearing from you!

title: SENIOR FB ADS + Google ADS specialist 5+ Years experience
description:
About the Companies

Legend Sports and Razzaque Paradise Properties are growth-driven companies operating in competitive real estate markets. We are focused on lead generation and acquisition, not vanity metrics. Our goal is simple: consistent, high-quality real estate leads that convert into deals.



We are looking for a top-tier Paid Ads Specialist with deep, hands-on experience in real estate
 Ads and Google Ads to take ownership of our acquisition funnel.



The Role

We are hiring an experienced Real Estate
 & Google Ads Specialist with at least 5 years of proven experience running paid acquisition campaigns in real estate.



This role is for someone who understands real estate buyer and seller psychology, knows how to build funnels that convert, and can optimize campaigns for cost per lead, cost per acquisition, and deal quality.



This is not an entry-level role. We want a strategic operator, not just an ad launcher.



Key Responsibilities

• Plan, launch, and scale
 Ads and Google Ads for real estate acquisition

• Build and optimize full-funnel campaigns (cold traffic ? retargeting ? conversion)

• Generate qualified buyer and seller leads, not junk traffic

• Continuously optimize for CPL, CPA, ROAS, and lead quality

• Write and test high-converting ad creatives, copy, and audiences

• Set up and manage tracking (Meta Pixel, Google Tags, conversions, events)

• Analyze performance data and make data-driven decisions

• Identify and fix funnel bottlenecks quickly

• Collaborate with internal teams to improve lead follow-up and conversion



What We’re Looking For

• Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience running
 & Google Ads for real estate

• Proven track record in real estate lead generation and acquisition

• Strong understanding of buyer/seller funnels and local market targeting

• Experience with high-spend accounts and scaling winning campaigns

• Ability to manage budgets responsibly and profitably

• Highly analytical, results-driven, and detail-oriented

• Self-starter who takes ownership and accountability



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent flow of high-quality real estate leads

• Stable and scalable acquisition systems

• Improved CPL and CPA over time

• Clear reporting and transparency on performance

• Direct contribution to closed deals and revenue growth



Why Work With Us

• Serious brands with real budgets and clear acquisition goals

• Long-term opportunity for the right performer

• Full ownership of the paid ads channel

• Results-focused environment (no micromanagement, no fluff)



If you are a real estate paid ads expert who knows how to drive acquisition—not just clicks—we want to hear from you.

title: Full-Time Video Editor & Content VA for SAT Prep Brand
description:
Overview

I run a fast-growing SAT Prep brand (“James Lu SAT”) with 70k+ followers and a paid SAT course. I’m looking for a full-time virtual assistant from the Philippines who is strong at video editing + basic VA tasks and can help me run a consistent content + community machine. You’ll be responsible for turning my raw recordings and community into daily content, happy students, and more course sales. 



Almost everything you do will have clear tutorials and SOPs.



Your Top Tasks

*Edit short-form and long-form social media content (YouTube, TikTok, Instagram)

*Make YouTube thumbnails (simple, clear designs – I provide face poses)

*Monitor and moderate an online community on 
 (remove spam, surface wins)

*Check Instagram DMs, TikTok DMs, and
 daily and reply using my scripts

*Research video ideas from comments and competitor channels

*Other odd tasks related to content, students, or the community as needed



Requirements

*Strong English (written and spoken)

*Can work full-time (40 hours/week)

*Can learn new skills fast

*Proven video editing experience (short-form + long-form)

*Comfortable using tools like CapCut / Premiere / Final Cut + Canva or similar

*Fast, reliable internet and a computer that can handle video editing

*Detail-oriented, follows SOPs, and hits deadlines without micromanagement

*Bonus: Familiarity with SAT / test prep / math content



Pay & Perks

*Salary: $700–$1,000 USD per month (full-time), depending on skill and experience

*You can work whenever you want as long as: You check community + DMs every day, and you hit the deadlines and content targets

* Flexible vacation – if you need time off, just let me know in advance

* Opportunity to advance and get bonuses – if you do a good job, I will give you raises and bonuses



How to Apply (Follow Exactly)

1. Change the subject line to: “I saw [Insert the name of my most popular YouTube video here]” (My YT channel: James Lu SAT)

2. At the top of your message, write 2–3 sentences on: Why would you like this position? and Why are you a good fit? (Do not write more than 3 sentences here.)

3. Answer this question: What is the price of the course I sell?

4. Under that, put the following, numbered for easy reading:

 a. Number of years in video editing

 b. Links to 2–3 short-form videos you have edited

 c. Link to 1 long-form video you have edited

 d. A brief list of editing and design tools you use



If you do not follow all the steps above, your application will not be considered.



If I d
 to interview you, there will be a short Zoom call and video will be required.



Thank you,

James Lu

- Work closely with a compact team to ensure marketing objectives harmonize with campaign strategies.  

- Evaluate campaign performance metrics and deliver actionable insights to maximize ROI.  

- Execute A/B testing to fine-tune ad creatives and messages.  

- Keep abreast of industry trends and platform updates to identify new advertising opportunities.



**Qualifications:**  

- Demonstrated experience in managing campaigns on Google Ads and
 Meta Ads.  

- Solid grasp of digital marketing metrics and analytics.  

- Proven ability to collaborate effectively within a team.  

- Exceptional communication and organizational skills.  

- Experience overseeing multiple brands or campaigns is an advantage.



**What We Offer:**  

- A nurturing and adaptable work atmosphere.  

- Opportunities for professional advancement and skill development.

title: Outbound Caller (AU Leads) — Survey Calls (Recorded) | Project-Based
description:
We’re looking for a reliable outbound caller to contact our existing leads (and source more leads if needed) and complete a short survey over the phone.



Goal: Achieve 15 completed calls where the person answers the survey questions (calls count as “completed” only if the survey is answered).



What you’ll do



Call our lead list (we’ll provide it)



Speak with the owner/manager/admin and ask survey questions



Log answers exactly as said (verbatim where possible)



If we run short on reachable contacts, source additional leads and continue calling



Track call outcomes (no answer, wrong number, call back, not interested, etc.)



Important note about recording



All calls are recorded for quality and training purposes. By applying, you acknowledge you’re comfortable working in a recorded-call environment.



Requirements



Confident spoken English (clear and professional)



Comfortable making outbound calls and handling basic objections



Strong note-taking + accurate data entry



Reliable internet + quiet calling environment



Bonus: experience calling Australian businesses / using VoIP tools



Deliverables



15 completed survey calls



A filled-in tracker with:



who answered (owner/manager/admin)



lead source (if known)



what happens after an enquiry (in their words)



what gets missed/delayed (in their words)



cost of the problem (in their words)



current tools used (spreadsheet/CRM/etc.)



estimated enquiry volume per week



strongest objection (if any)



best follow-up channel



best quote we can reuse (exact phrase)



Compensation



Project-based: 30 AUD for this project (15 completed survey calls).



Future work



If you do well on this project, we have more calling and lead-gen projects coming and would love to keep working with you.



To apply



Send your resume + a short voice note introducing yourself and your calling experience to: 



(Voice note can be a WhatsApp-style recording or a Loom/Drive link—whatever is easiest.)



Voice note prompt (30–45 seconds):

Your name, location/time zone, calling experience, and a quick sample of how you’d open a 3–5 minute survey call.

title: Bookkeeper (E-Commerce)
description:
About the Role:

Brands Capital Group is looking for a detail-oriented Bookkeeper to manage accurate financial records across our multi-platform e-commerce operations (Shopify, Amazon, eBay, and more). This is a fully remote, full-time position reporting to Finance Manager.



What You'll Do:

Record and categorize daily sales transactions across multiple platforms

Process refunds, cancellations, and chargebacks

Track payment gateway fees (PayPal, Stripe, Square)

Reconcile bank accounts, credit cards, and payment processors daily/weekly

Manage accounts payable & receivable, including vendor invoices and COGS tracking

Generate monthly P&L statements, balance sheets, and cash flow reports

Track sales tax/VAT by jurisdiction and ensure multi-jurisdiction compliance

Monitor inventory costs, product margins, and identify cost-saving opportunities

Prepare quarterly tax documents and year-end reports





Requirements:

Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

3–5 years of bookkeeping/accounting experience, preferably in e-commerce or retail

Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Xero, or similar accounting software

Strong understanding of Shopify, Amazon, eBay financial reporting

Experience with PayPal, Stripe, Square reconciliation

Knowledge of sales tax/VAT and multi-jurisdiction compliance



Nice to Have:

Certified Bookkeeper designation

Experience with A2X, Link My Books, or Synder

GAAP knowledge and accrual accounting experience





What We Offer:

Fully remote setup

Competitive salary

Long-term growth within a fast-growing e-commerce team

Creative ownership and room for innovation





How to Apply:

To be considered for this role, please complete our application form. Note: Only applicants who complete the form will be processed.



Apply here:

title: Digital Marketing Specialist — Facebook (Meta) Ads Specialist
description:
We're looking for a reliable, results-driven Digital Marketing Assistant to join our remote team on a permanent, full-time basis. 

 

Your core focus will be managing and 
 (Meta) ad campaigns across client accounts — this is a Meta Ads role first and foremost, with light support tasks added only when ad workload allows.

 

If you love data, enjoy testing and analyzing campaigns, and take pride in delivering real results for clients — we'd love to hear from you.

 

What You'll Be Doing

Primary —
 (Meta) Ads (80%+ of your time)

Plan, build, launch, and manage Meta ad campaigns end-to-end

Test and iterate on audiences, creatives, and ad copy

Monitor campaign performance and optimise for results

Report on key metrics and proactively suggest improvements

 

Secondary — As Needed Only

Write basic ad copy and short-form marketing content

Design simple creatives using Canva or similar tools

Support social media posting and LinkedIn lead gen campaigns

Assist with basic
 marketing (newsletters and simple automations)

Help with light website or landing page tasks

Light marketing admin and data entry as required

 

What We're Looking For

Must Have

Minimum 1 year of hands-on experience running
 (Meta) Ads

Strong written and spoken English

Ability to work independently, stay organised, and meet deadlines

High attention to detail and a proactive mindset

 

Nice to Have (Not Required)

Basic SEO or content knowledge

Copywriting or graphic design experience (Canva is fine)

Familiarity with WordPress, HubSpot, Wix, or similar platforms

Experience with common digital marketing tools

 

Working Hours & Setup

Full-time | 40 hours/week | Monday to Friday

Day shift: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM Manila Time — no night shifts

100% remote

 

What We Offer

Competitive salary: PHP 30,000–37,000/month depending on experience

Permanent day shift with no rotation

Long-term, stable role with real growth opportunities

Supportive and communicative team environment

PH public holiday coverage (subject to contract)

Ongoing training and skill development

 

How to Apply

Please submit all of the following — incomplete applications will not be reviewed:

Updated CV (link)

Portfolio (link)

DISC Personality Test result

Short video assessment (link)

Video Assessment Instructions: Record a 3–5 minute Loom video walking us through how you would set up a
 Ad Campaign named "NZ Client Growth Campaign." You may use sample images and ad copy. Cover your targeting approach, campaign structure, and overall strategy. We're not looking for perfection — we want to see solid fundamentals and clear thinking.

title: Full-Time Appointment Setting Virtual Assistant (Phone Based - Medicare)
description:
Assistantly Inc. is a Texas.-based staffing agency that connects high-performing Virtual Assistants with growing Medicare insurance agencies across the United States.



We are currently hiring a dedicated Appointment Setting Virtual Assistant who's fluent in English to support licensed Medicare agents and agencies. Your primary responsibility will be booking qualified appointments with individuals turning 65 or currently on Medicare who have requested information about their coverage options.



This role is heavily phone-based and requires fluent english - confidence, clarity, and professionalism when speaking with U.S.-based prospects.



We are not looking for freelancers managing multiple jobs. This is a full-time, long-term opportunity for someone seeking stability, structure, and growth. Your main goal will be to keep agents’ calendars consistently filled with qualified appointments.



Responsibilities:



Make outbound calls to leads who requested Medicare information



Handle inbound calls and convert them into booked appointments



Follow scripts naturally and confidently



Professionally overcome basic objections



Confirm appointments and send reminders



Follow up on no-shows and missed calls



Maintain accurate notes in the CRM



Identify leads that require additional follow-up



Ensure no interested prospect is left unattended



This is a performance-driven, results-oriented role focused on booked appointments and calendar management.



What We’re Looking For



Very strong spoken English



Neutral to minimal accent suitable for U.S. phone calls



Confident and natural phone presence



Comfortable handling objections



Ability to follow scripts while sounding conversational



Organized and detail-oriented



Self-starter who takes initiative



Reliable internet connection and quiet work environment



Full-time availability (no side jobs)



Long-term commitment



Appointment setting, call center, or insurance-related experience is strongly preferred.



What We Offer



$6 per hour (weekly pay)



100% remote work



Long-term, stable placement



Clear expectations and structured support



Opportunity for growth into leadership or higher-responsibility roles



How to Apply (Follow Instructions Exactly)



Step 1: Record a voice recording using Vocaroo while reading the script provided at the link below:


/document/d/1qLyjfVUTY04rCJY_AQMqHm5OOXmQ7yIsn0YM3JOvX5E/edit?usp=sharing



Step 2: Attach your resume.



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

title: Amazon Brand Manager
description:
We’re looking for a performance-driven Amazon Brand Manager to own and grow our presence across multiple Amazon storefronts. If you thrive in fast-paced e-commerce environments, know Amazon inside and out, and can juggle strategy, execution, and analysis across several brands simultaneously, this role is for you.



Responsibilities:



Multistorefront Management: Own and scale 5+ Amazon storefronts, ensuring consistent brand voice, high-quality visuals, and fully optimized listings.

Launch & Promo Strategy: Plan and execute product launches, promotions, and seasonal campaigns to maximize visibility and sales.

Performance Monitoring: Track storefront KPIs (sales, traffic, conversion, advertising ROI), customer feedback, and competitor moves—turn insights into actionable strategies.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Coordinate with creative, PPC, inventory, and logistics teams to align messaging, stock, and advertising.

Compliance & Trends: Stay up-to-date with Amazon algorithm updates, policies, and marketplace trends to maintain optimal visibility and compliance.

Listing Optimization: Implement Amazon SEO best practices—optimize titles, bullets, descriptions, keywords, and A+ content.

UX & Conversion: Lead storefront UX improvements, A/B tests, and creative updates to boost conversion and engagement.

Reporting: Produce regular dashboards and reports summarizing performance and recommending next steps for growth.



Requirements:



Proven experience managing 5+ Amazon storefronts simultaneously.

3+ years in Amazon brand management, e-commerce, or digital marketing.

Deep knowledge of Amazon Seller Central, Brand Registry, A+ / Premium A+ content, and Amazon SEO.

Analytical mindset with demonstrated success in improving sales, conversion rates, and advertising ROI.

Comfortable using keyword research and listing-optimization tools; adept at data interpretation and strategic planning.

Strong project-management, communication, and cross-functional collaboration skills.

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive in problem-solving.

Experience with Helium 10, Jungle Scout, DataHawk, or similar analytics suites is a plus.

Familiarity with Amazon DSP or external traffic/acquisition strategies is a plus.

Graphic-design chops or oversight experience for creative production is a plus.

Knowledge of international Amazon marketplaces (UK, EU, CA, etc.) is a plus.

title: Amazon Sourcing Specialist
description:
We’re seeking a detail-oriented and cost-conscious Purchasing/Sourcing Specialist to manage and optimize supplier relationships for our Amazon private-label and marketplace operations. You will lead supplier sourcing and negotiation, build landed cost models, and manage execution across samples, POs, freight, and replenishment. The ideal candidate combines sharp cost analysis with operational rigor — ensuring supply chain flows smoothly to FBA/3PL while hitting margin and targets.



Responsibilities:



Source, vet, and onboard manufacturers; run RFQs and negotiate pricing, MOQ, lead times, and payment terms

Build and maintain accurate landed cost models, factoring in duties, freight, and FBA fees to achieve margin goals

Coordinate product samples, specs, labeling, packaging, and regulatory compliance for Amazon and category standards

Create and track POs from production through delivery; ensure on-time, in-full (OTIF) performance from suppliers and carriers

Track vendor performance on cost, quality, lead time, and defect rate; lead corrective actions as needed

Conduct supplier audits and risk assessments, including geopolitical, compliance, and capacity considerations

Drive cost-saving initiatives through negotiation, packaging optimization, freight consolidation, or alternate sourcing

Support continuous improvement in sourcing processes and supplier performance



Requirements:



3+ years in purchasing, sourcing, or supply chain — ideally for Amazon FBA or e-commerce businesses

Proven experience negotiating with overseas factories, including MOQs, pricing, and payment terms

Solid understanding of landed cost analysis, profit margins, and Amazon’s fee structures

Working knowledge of quality control checkpoints and regulatory product compliance

Advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with PO systems

Strong organization, documentation, and multi-SKU project management ability

Proactive problem-solver who can work autonomously in a fast-paced, remote environment

Familiarity with sourcing and market tools like Helium 10 or Keepa is preferred

Experience with EDI, inventory planning, or demand forecasting is preferred

Category experience in regulated goods such as home improvement products or replacement parts is a plus

Exposure to total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis in sourcing decisions is a plus

title: Amazon Catalog Manager
description:
Job Summary:



We’re seeking an experienced Amazon Catalog Manager to own end-to-end listing health and performance for a large SKU portfolio. You’ll manage backend attributes and compliance, optimize front-end content, and analyze key metrics to improve rankings, conversion, and revenue. Ideal for a data-driven operator with deep Seller Central expertise and a track record scaling large catalogs.



Responsibilities:



Catalog Management



Maintain and optimize 500+ SKUs in Seller Central, ensuring accurate categories, browse nodes, variations, and buy box–relevant settings.



Execute monthly content audits (titles, bullets, images, A+), fix suppressions/stranded inventory, and uphold Amazon TOS and compliance.



Manage backend attributes (search terms, item type keywords, intended use, target audience) and ensure listing data integrity.



Sales & Ranking Optimization



Track keyword rankings, CVR, pricing, and subcategory BSR; set weekly sales targets and target BSR per ASIN.



Identify underperforming listings and implement remediation plans (content, offers, pricing/ coupons, deals, images, reviews strategy inputs).



Monitor profitability and contribution margins, coordinating with ads and pricing to hit goals.



Insights & Collaboration



Partner with internal teams on pricing, promotions, creative, and inventory to align levers with growth targets.



Run competitive audits (content, offers, reviews, price moves) and recommend tactical adjustments.



Build and deliver actionable, data-driven performance reports and dashboards.



Requirements:



4+ years hands-on experience in Amazon Seller Central (required).



Proven success managing large catalogs (500+ SKUs) with complex variations.



Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (lookups, pivots, data cleaning).



Expert knowledge of listing optimization, keyword research/strategy, and backend attributes.



Strong grasp of Amazon TOS, compliance, suppressions, and listing health mechanics.



Familiarity with Sellerboard, Keepa, DataRova (or similar) is a plus.



Fluent English; highly organized, analytical, and self-directed.



Committed to a single full-time role.

title: TikTok Shop Content Strategist
description:
We are seeking a TikTok Shop Content Strategist who is deeply TikTok-native and experienced in both creative strategy and hands-on content creation. This role sits at the intersection of trend forecasting, performance analysis, and short-form video production, with a clear focus on driving engagement, discovery, and revenue through TikTok. You will own the TikTok content roadmap end-to-end, translating insights and trends into scroll-stopping, conversion-driven content while collaborating closely with Growth, Creative, Influencer, and Paid teams.



Responsibilities:



Own and execute the TikTok content strategy aligned with brand, growth, and product priorities

Build and manage weekly and monthly content calendars tied to launches, campaigns, and cultural 
nts

Translate performance insights into actionable creative briefs, concepts, and content themes

Identify whitespace opportunities across formats such as UGC-style content, trends, education, POVs, and product demos

Concept, script, film, and edit TikTok content optimized for platform-native performance

Create authentic, non-overproduced videos that resonate with TikTok audiences

Test multiple hooks, angles, and storytelling structures per concept and iterate rapidly based on results

Monitor TikTok trends, sounds, formats, and creator behavior, adapting them in a brand-safe and commercially relevant way

Track and analyze content performance including views, engagement, saves, CTR, and conversions

Partner with growth and paid teams to identify high-performing organic content for amplification

Collaborate with influencer, affiliate, creative, and brand teams to ensure consistency in voice, tone, and visual identity

Support product launches with high-impact TikTok storytelling



Requirements:



1–2+ years of experience creating and/or strategizing TikTok content for a brand or creator account

Deep understanding of TikTok trends, algorithms, and creator culture

Proven ability to produce content that drives both engagement and conversion

Strong storytelling instincts with a clear focus on hooks and retention

Comfortable being on camera and directing others on camera when needed

Highly organized, fast-moving, and comfortable testing, learning, and iterating quickly

Data-informed creative mindset with a focus on performance over vanity metrics

title: Retention Marketing Manager
description:
We’re looking for a seasoned Retention Marketing Manager to take ownership of
, SMS, and direct mail programs. This role is essential in deepening customer loyalty, increasing repeat purchases, and expanding the subscriber base. Working closely with creative and e-commerce teams, you'll drive strategy and execution while ensuring all retention touchpoints align with a bold, engaging brand identity.



Responsibilities:



Lead strategy and execution of retention marketing across
, SMS, and direct mail channels.

Collaborate with creative teams to develop compelling assets that align with the brand’s voice and visual identity.

Analyze campaign performance metrics such as repeat purchase rates, subscriber growth, and segmentation efficiency to optimize strategies.

Provide creative direction and feedback to maintain consistent, inclusive messaging.

Use tools like Asana and Klaviyo to manage workflows, ensuring efficient campaign planning and execution.

Own the retention marketing budget and prioritize initiatives based on ROI and impact.



Requirements:



5+ years of experience in retention marketing, preferably within a direct-to-consumer or lifestyle brand.

Proficient in Klaviyo and Postscript; familiarity with Figma and Asana is a plus.

Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to turn insights into actionable strategies.

Ability to balance data-driven decision making with creative storytelling.

Up-to-date with digital trends, cultural 
nts, and evolving consumer behavior

Inclusive and culturally aware approach to messaging and customer engagement.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, remote work environment.

title: Influencer Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:



We are seeking an Influencer Coordinator / Affiliate Outreach Coordinator to support and scale a fast-growing brand’s affiliate and creator partnerships. This role focuses on building strong relationships with creators, managing ongoing campaigns, tracking performance, and ensuring timely execution across deliverables, payments, and content documentation. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to help grow a high-performing influencer and affiliate ecosystem aligned with broader marketing and growth objectives.



Responsibilities:

- Manage and optimize relationships with existing and prospective affiliate and influencer partners

- Maintain regular communication with assigned creators to ensure deliverables are met, contracts are followed, and content quality standards are upheld

- Monitor trends and patterns across social and digital marketing efforts to identify new opportunities

- Coordinate with internal teams on payment terms, schedules, and delivery to ensure creators are paid accurately and on time

- Track and document all content produced by creators in designated folders and internal systems

- Log creator posts daily, including publish dates, performance metrics, and post links

- Contract a targeted number of creators on a weekly basis to meet campaign and business goals

- Source, evaluate, and engage new influencer and affiliate partners across platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube,
, and

- Negotiate and manage influencer partnerships while maintaining strong, ongoing relationships

- Review influencer content to ensure compliance with brand guidelines, tone, and messaging prior to posting

- Assist in creating influencer briefs, one-pagers, and campaign documentation aligned with marketing objectives

- Collaborate with design and content teams to support the creation of high-quality social and creator-led content



Requirements:

- Minimum of 3 years of experience in influencer coordination, affiliate outreach, or a related role

- Strong expertise across major social media platforms, particularly Instagram and TikTok

- Solid understanding of marketing metrics and the ability to analyze performance data and KPIs

- Experience with editorial and social media content development, with a foundational understanding of digital design and user experience principles

- Proven track record of successfully managing and scaling influencer or affiliate programs

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail

- Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple creators and deadlines simultaneously

- Experience working in a high-growth or startup environment; SaaS or B2B experience is a strong plus

title: TikTok Shop Operations Manager
description:
Own end-to-end TikTok Shop operations for creator storefronts. You will set up shops, manage product catalogs, coordinate fulfillment, ensure policy compliance, and build scalable processes so creators can sell without friction. This role suits a highly organized, proactive operator who loves turning moving parts into clean, reliable systems.



Responsibilities:



Lead onboarding and configuration of new TikTok Shops for creators, ensuring fast, accurate setup.

Manage the full product listing lifecycle: uploads, keywords, creatives, pricing updates, inventory sync, and listing health.

Coordinate order flow between internal fulfillment systems and TikTok Shop; monitor SLAs, troubleshoot shipping and OMS issues, and resolve exceptions.

Maintain platform compliance by mastering TikTok Shop policies, guidelines, rating standards, and best practices.

Partner with Creator Management and DTC Strategy on promos and campaigns; provide operational readiness plans and post-mortems.

Build and maintain SOPs, checklists, and documentation; design scalable processes and automations to reduce errors and manual work.

Track operational KPIs such as listing accuracy, order cycle times, cancellation rate, on-time ship rate, and store rating; surface insights and corrective actions.



Requirements:



2+ years in e-commerce operations, marketplace management, or similar operational role. Direct TikTok Shop experience is a strong plus.

Proven organizational rigor and attention to detail across multi-step workflows and cross-team dependencies.

Strong problem solving skills with the ability to anticipate risks, triage issues, and drive resolutions quickly.

Process builder who documents clearly and improves systems over time.

Excellent written and verbal communication for internal teams and creator partners.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment with shifting priorities.



Bonus: experience with Shopify, Amazon Seller Central, OMS tools, and basic logistics and fulfillment concepts; familiarity with SQL or workflow automation is helpful.
